loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 40-year-old taxi operator in Kilifi, Kenya. He is a father of three school-age children. He has been in this business for the last seven years and the business is doing great.

This is his fourth loan to finance his business. He will use the money to repair his taxi and will use the anticipated profit to repay his loan and educate his children. He hopes to be successful in his business in the future.

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 60 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Ma. Luisa has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, soft-drinks, personal care products and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Samy

texts.en: Samy is 33 years old, married, and has three children. He takes care of his aging father who lives with him in the same house. Samy has a small livestock fattening business and is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to expand his business and generate income for his family.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira is 31 years old, married, and has two children. She creates clothing using a sewing machine and sells to her neighbors. She is very well-known in her village for her good designs since she has been creating clothing for a long time. She is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy modern cloth for her new designs.

loans.use: To buy modern cloth for her new designs.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married mother of three children, two of whom attend school. She lives at her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high costs of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en: Robelyn is 28 years old and married with one kid. Robelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Robelyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs. Robelyn has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Robelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 50 years old, married, and has nine children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cecelia has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Cecelia has been in this business for four years. In the future, Cecelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Shayirgul

texts.ru: Шайиргул успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На этот раз Шайиргул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически-чистой продукции, также для уплаты аренды за земельный надел. На сегодня Шайиргул имеет в хозяйстве имеет 4 коровы, 6 овец. На 2,0 Га арендованной земли она выращивает рис. Доход Шайиргул около 31,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В будущем Шайиргул хочет и дальше инвестировать и развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en: Shayirgul successfully paid off her last loan, which she used for its intended purpose. She is grateful to Kiva and to everyone who helped finance her. This time Shayirgul has turned to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase fertilizer for cultivating her land and growing organic rice, as well as to pay rent on her farming land. Today Shayirgul has four cows and six sheep on her farm. She grows organic rice on a rented two hectare plot of land . Her income is around 31,000 KGS per month. In the future Shayirgul wants to continue investing in and growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for land cultivation and growing organic rice and to pay rent on her farming land.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin is a young married woman with one child. She is 23 years old and lives in Jarash with her husband. She is an example of a lady who is patient and has will-power.

She decided to be productive, so she started her own business, which is a small grocery store. She is working hard to provide a good life for her child and she wants to save money to give him the best education he can get.

Yasmin has a lot of dreams to achieve. She also has the enthusiasm and energy of youth to work hard to reach her goals.

Now that she believes her business is working well, she has decided to expand and develop her work. Therefore, Yasmin has applied for a loan to buy a larger quantity of products and food supplies to sell and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of products and food supplies to sell at her grocery store

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.ru: 53 летный житель района Файзабад, Исматулло. Он семейный человек. У него прекрасная семья. Детям 24, 21 и 18 лет. Его жена домохозяйка и занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Дети учатся в университете и в школе. Исматулло работает строительным инженером в районе. Он начал свою новую работу 5 лет назад. Исматулло воспитанный человек и он хорошо воспитывает своих детей. Он обратился за кредитом, чтобы оплатит за учебы сына. Без оплаты сына исключат с университета. Исматулло надеется на Вашу поддержку. Ему очень нужно поддержка с Вашей стороны.
texts.en: Ismatullo is 53 years old and lives in the Fayzabad region of Tajikistan. He is a family man. He has a wonderful family. His children are 24, 21 and 18 years old. His wife is a homemaker and does farming work. The children study at university and school. Ismatullo works as a civil engineer in the region. He started at his new job five years ago. Ismatullo is an educated man and he is bringing his children up well. He applied for a loan in order to pay for his son's education. If he cannot pay his son will be expelled. Ismatullo is hoping for your support. He needs support from you.

loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion operates a tailoring business to make a living. She was thankful to GDMPC for the capital entrusted to her in order to improve her business, for she solely provides for the needs of her family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan.

To improve her services, she took a new loan recently to buy machine parts and to pay for the expenses of repairing and maintaining her machine. She wants to improve the general living conditions of her family by improving her business first. She wants to be able to buy another sewing machine to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for sewing machine repair.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Filipinos are known to be resourceful and creative. When Filipinos come up with ways on how to survive from their day-to-day living, as long as it’s decent, they’ll exert extra hard work, An example is Marilou, a 50-year-old businesswoman, married to Francisco, who is committed to her goals. Currently, she is involved in buying and selling different frozen products like chicken, pork sausages, hotdogs and other meat products.

Marilou wants to buy additional frozen products so that customers will have a variety of choices. This is why she applied for a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to buy packs of pork sausages, ham, hotdogs and other frozen products. She is hoping that her request will be considered this time. Since she is aiming to support her children’s education and make the business flourish, she really perseveres to earn more each day.

Marilou regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and experience with the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen products for her buy-and-sell business so that customers will have a variety of choices.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Erma works hard to support her family.

She has an egg retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Erma is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy additional eggs to offer for sale.

Erma has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy eggs to offer for sale.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 40-year-old man who lives in Ayidiki, in the Greater Accra Region. William is a water vendor. He sells gallons and buckets of water to his neighbors who do not have access to piped water. William's major business challenge is frequent water shortages.

He needs this loan to purchase a poly tank with the required inputs to install the tank. This will enable him to store more water to sell to his clients when there is a water shortage. This loan will help William to sustain his business and financially secure his home.

loans.use: to purchase a poly tank to store and sell water.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en: Heba is 33 years old, married, and has three children. She fattens one cow. She is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy another head of cattle to increase her sales of cheese, milk, and butter, which will increase her income.

loans.use: to buy another cow.

loans.name: Maya Dambe Group

texts.fr: Mamou est éléveuse  de moutons agée  de 41ans, c’est elle qui tient  la corne du bélier , elle habite au mali où elle vit avec  son marie cultivateur  et ses  3 enfants ; 1 fille et 2 garçons dont  la fille  et un garçon scolarisés. Elle exerce l’élevage  dépuis 9 ans , elle fait ses achats et  ventes  dans un marché local  et dans son village . Elle a sollicité auprès du RMCR un prêt pour acheter  un mouton de plus afin d’augmenter  son revenu   et  de pouvoir assurer l’éducation, la santé et  de ses  enfants.
texts.en:
Mamou is forty-one years old and raises sheep. She is seen in the photo holding the sheep by the horn. She lives in Mali with her husband, who is a farmer, and their three children (one girl and two boys). Their daughter and one of their sons currently attend school.

Mamou has been raising livestock for nine years. She buys and sells the animals at a local market and in her village. She has requested this loan to buy an extra sheep to increase her earnings to pay for education and healthcare for her children.

loans.use: to buy sheep for selling on.

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.ru: Фарруху 33 года. В свое время он не смог получить высшее образования, и был вынужден не учиться, а работать, чтобы прокормить свою семью. Сейчас Фаррух женатый человек и он отец троих детей. Все его дети школьники. На сегодняшний день Фарруху тяжело собрать троих детей в школу, так как школьная форма, книги и учебники стоят дорого. Фарух единственный кормилец в семье. Он планирует получить кредит и купить все необходимые принадлежности для учебы в школе. Поддержите Фарруха.
texts.en: Farrukh is 33 years old. He was unable to get a higher education when he was younger, and had to work to support his family. Now Farrukh is married and the father of three children. All of his children are pupils at school. Right now it is difficult for Farrukh to send his children to school, because the uniforms, books, and school supplies are expensive. Farrukh is the sole breadwinner in his family. He plans to get a loan and purchase all the necessary school supplies. Please support Farrukh.

loans.use: to obtain school uniforms for his children.

loans.name: Tariq

texts.en: Tariq is a 21-year-old married man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Tariq has a stall for selling fruits and vegetables in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict. Tariq took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy some fruits and vegetables to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to cover school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy some fruits and vegetables to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is single and the mother of five. For more than 20 years, she has operated a general store in her village. Wilfreda needs to add capital in the form of inventory to increase her sales because her business is the main source of income that supports her children's needs.

Wilfreda joined GDMPC recently and has requested a loan to buy additional groceries for sale. She hopes that, in the future, her business will prosper. She wants to settle down, having a complete and happy family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for sale.

loans.name: Geneva

texts.en:
Geneva is 43 years old, with three children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Geneva runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Geneva has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr: Agée de 48 ans et mère de deux enfants, Adjoa est une femme mariée vivant à Adidogomé. Adjoa est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Pour s’approvisionner, Adjoa demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue  d’épargner et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants dès la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
Adjoa is forty-eight years old, married and mother to two children. She lives in Adidogomé and sells charcoal. She buys her supplies once a month from the market and sells it from a stall in front of her home.

Adjoa has requested this loan to buy more bags of charcoal for sale. She hopes to increase her savings and pay for the education of her children during this new school year.

loans.use: to buy 11 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Célibataire et sans enfant, Abla est une jeune femme âgée de 20 aqns qui habite à Adidogomé. Abla est une revendeuse des objets en plastique qu’elle s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Abla sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités de sceaux et des douzaines de plats en plastiques afin de satisfaire parfaitement les attentes de ses clients et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour subvenir aux charges et besoins quotidiens qu’elle éprouve.
texts.en:
Abla is twenty years old, single and has no children. She lives in Adidogomé and sells plastic items. She buys her stock twice a month from the market and sells it from her home and in the surrounding areas.

Abla has requested this loan to buy plastic buckets and dozens of plastic plates to perfectly satisfy the needs of her customers. She hopes to make a good profit and be able to pay her day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy 12 units of plastic buckets and 14 units of plastic plates for sale.

loans.name: Wael

texts.en: Wael is 26, single, and has a small grocery store project. He previously requested a 5000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on its due dates. Wael is requesting another loan (10,000 EGP) loan to buy grocery products such as oil, rice and pasta to increase his sales and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as oil, rice and pasta for his grocery store.

loans.name: Pardali

texts.ru: Пардали 55 летный мужчина района Хуросон. Он семейный человек. У него четверых детей. Младшие дети  учатся в средней школе. Жена домохозяйка. Сам Пардали трудолюбивый и заботливый человек. Он во дворе имеет коровник, и там выращивает крупнорогатого скота. 14 лет Пардали продвигает свою деятельность. Его научил заниматься этим видом деятельностью его отец. Пардали с детство мечтал выращивать скота. Он решил идти по стопам отца. Пардали хочет купить крупнорогатого скота, и увеличить поголовье скота и за счет этого увеличить доход от животноводческой деятельности. Пардали обратился к Вам за кредитом, потому что он верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Pardali is a 55 year old resident of the Khuroson region. He is a family man. He has four children. The younger children are in secondary school and his wife is a homemaker. Pardali is a hardworking and considerate man. On his farm he has a cattle barn and he raises cattle. He has been working in this profession for 14 years. His father taught him this occupation. He has been dreaming of raising cattle since he was a child. He decided to follow in his father's footsteps. Pardali wants to purchase cattle to increase his herd and thus increase his income from livestock. Pardali has turned to you for a loan, because he believes in you and your support.

loans.use: to purchase several cattle.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 61 years old and married, with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Marilyn has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Marilyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sinoeun's Group

texts.en:
A divorced woman who lives in Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district, Sinoeun is 33 years old. She has sold grocery items to support her living for two years. Her selling business is not going well and she has fewer customers. She is able to save only 5USD each day after expense.
Sinoeun has never been with VisionFund, and this is the first time for her to get this Kiva loan. In a group of three, she is the group leader. With this loan portion, she is going to buy more grocery items to attract customers and increase the number of sales. She hopes to increase her income to save for future needs.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to attract customers and increase the number of sales as well as her income to save for future need.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Jlg-005(A)-Pattavarthi Group

texts.en:
The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. Pappa belongs to Kulithalai, in rural Tamil Nadu. She is a 45 year old lady who works as a daily wage labourer in the agriculture sector. She has six adult members in her family. Her monthly saving is Rs.800 only. She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Pappa’s family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk a kilometer to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. Their women are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites. 

Joining hands with Tamilarasi and Chellammal whose families face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, she has formed a group of three members and is hoping to address this issue. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Pappa, Tamilarasi and Chellammal their families. It will also mean that they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, they seek a loan of Rs. 42,000 to build a toilet at home. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all three families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: to fund the installation of a toilet in her home

loans.name: Jlg-005-Pattavarthi Group

texts.en:
Kasthuri hails from Kulithalai, Tamil Nadu. She is the leader of a JLG comprising three resolute women. They come from similar backgrounds, working hard to sustain their families. Kasthuri lives with her six family members including two children. The monthly saving is only Rs.1,000. She has no access to toilets, and therefore her family has to resort to open defecation using the false privacy of nearby fields and surrounding shrubbery. These unsafe sanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse. 

Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Kasthuri, Jeyanthi and Maheshwari and their families. It will also mean that they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, they seek a loan of Rs. 42000 to build a toilet at home. Your loan will provide these 3 families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: to install a toilet in her home

loans.name: Jlg-003-Pattavarthi Group

texts.en: Kamalam leads a group of three self-inspired women in Kulithalai, Tamil Nadu. Kamalam is a daily wage labourer in agriculture sector. Her family consists of four adult members. Her monthly saving is only Rs. 1,750 only. Due to insufficient means to construct a toilet at home, her family has to resort to open defecation using the false privacy of nearby fields and surrounding shrubbery. They, especially their women and daughters, are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites. All the members of the group come from similar backgrounds, working hard to sustain their families. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Kamalam, Chithra & Maheswari and their families. It will also mean that they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, they seek a loan of Rs. 42,000 to build a toilet at home. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all three families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: to construct a toilet in her home

loans.name: Jlg-007-Keelathaliyampatti Group

texts.en:
Amirdhalingam is 42 and mother of a child. She hails from rural Tamil Nadu and has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Amirdhalingam's family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, her family is at risk of infection and falls ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month. The women and daughters in their family are exposed to the additional risk of molestation. 

Joining hands with 3 others whose families, all facing similar problems, Amirdhalingam has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue. Seeking to improve their situation, they seek a loan of Rs. 42000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will provide these 3 families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: To improve sanitation facilities in her home by installing a toilet

loans.name: Jlg-004(A)-Pattavarthi Group

texts.en:
There is a sanitation crisis in India, as a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. This group of three is led by Marudhambal, a 50-year-old woman living in the state of Tamil Nadu. Marudhambal understood the importance of having a toilet at home, but she did not have the means to build one, with a monthly income of Rs. 8500. With no access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private, which they do in dense bushes or isolated fields. The women and girls, seeking privacy, often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves. The family, especially the women and girls, are consequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Taking matters into their own hands, Marudhambal and her group want to build toilets for themselves in their own homes. They seek a loan of Rs. 42,000 to cover the cost of raw materials and labor for constructing these toilets. Your loan will provide these three families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. A higher standard of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: to fund the installation of a toilet in her home

loans.name: Jlg-004-Pattavarthi Group

texts.en:
Amaravathi is 40 and a mother of two. She has formed a self-help group with her friends in the rural part of Karur, in Tamil Nadu. She works hard to support her family, and saves diligently. However, her finances are not adequate for her to access basic necessities like toilets in her home. Her family has to trek long distances at dawn to use the fields to relieve themselves. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse. 

Taking matters into their own hands, Amaravathi and her group want to build toilets for themselves in their own homes. They seek a loan of Rs. 42000 to cover the cost of raw materials and labor for constructing these toilets. Your loan will help these 3 hardworking rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: to build a toilet in her home

loans.name: Jlg-002-Pattavarthi Group

texts.en:
The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. This group of 4 is led by Jeyaseeli Amudha, a 42 year old woman, living in the state of Tamil Nadu. Jeyaseeli understood the importance of having a toilet at home, but she does not have the means to build one. She is married and lives with her family of 3. With no access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private: in dense bushes or isolated fields. The women and girls, seeking privacy, often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves, subsequently putting themselves at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites. 

Taking matters into their own hands, Jeyaseeli Amudha and her group want to build toilets for themselves in their own homes. They seek a loan of Rs. 56000 to cover the cost of raw materials and labor for constructing these toilets. Your loan will provide these 4 families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: To fund the installation of a toilet in her home

loans.name: Jlg-007(A)-Keelathaliyampatti Group

texts.en:
Suguna is a 41 years old women. She has formed a self-help group with her friends in the rural part of Karur, in Tamil Nadu. She works hard to support her family of 4, and saves diligently. However, her finances are not adequate for her to access basic necessities like toilets in her home. Her family has to trek long distances at dawn to use the fields to relieve themselves. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse. 

Seeking to improve their situation, the group seeks a loan of Rs. 42000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help these 3 hardworking rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: To build a toilet in her home

loans.name: Jlg-008-Keelathaliyampatti Group

texts.en: Nageshwari is 34 and mother of two. She has formed a self-help group with her friends in the rural part of Karur, in Tamil Nadu. She works hard to support her family, and saves diligently. However, her finances are not adequate for her to access basic necessities like toilets in her home. Her family has to trek long distances at dawn to use the fields to relieve themselves. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse. Taking matters into their own hands, Nageshwari and her group want to build toilets for themselves in their own homes. They seek a loan of Rs. 42000 to cover the cost of raw materials and labor for constructing these toilets. Your loan will help these 3 hardworking rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: To build a toilet in her home

loans.name: Jlg-017-Elunootrymangalm Group

texts.en: Maheshwari is 30 years old and is a mother of two children. She hails from rural Tamil Nadu and has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Maheshwari's family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Joining hands with 4 others whose families all face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Maheshwari has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse. Taking advantage of the awareness initiatives and opportunity offered by GUARDIAN and Milaap, they seek a loan of Rs. 56000 to build toilets in their homes. The loan will enable them to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and they will be able to save on medical expenses.

loans.use: To improve sanitation facilities in her home by installing a toilet

loans.name: Jlg-002(A)-Melathaliyampatti Group

texts.en:
Indirani is 43 years old and lives with her family of three. She also leads a three-person loan group in Kulithalai, Tamil Nadu. All three members come from similar backgrounds, and work hard to support their families. Indirani and her family have no access to toilets, and therefore have to relieve themselves in the open, using the false privacy of nearby fields and surrounding shrubbery. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, they are at risk of infection, fall ill often, and spend a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses. The women and daughters in the family are exposed to the additional risk of molestation.

Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Indirani and her family. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. That is why this group is requesting a loan for Rs. 42,000 to build toilets at home. This loan will help three hardworking rural Indian families secure access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical expense savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: To improve sanitation facilities in her home by installing a toilet

loans.name: Jlg-019-Mettumarudhur Group

texts.en:
Gandhimathi is a 26-year-old lady with a family size of six. She has formed a self-help group with her friends in Kulithalai, in the rural part of Karur, in Tamil Nadu.

She works hard to support her family, and saves diligently. However, the finances are not adequate for her to access basic necessities like toilets in her home. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, their families are at risk of infection and fall ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month.

So, taking advantage of the awareness initiatives, the group now seeks a loan of Rs. 42,000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: To fund the installation of a toilet in her home

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru: Его зовут Абдурасул. Ему 28 лет. Он муж, отец и сын. Абдурасул единственный кормилец в семье. Он обеспечивает своих детей и семьи и родителей. Его семья проживает на районе Рудаки. Абдурасул предоставляет услуги по перевозки больших грузов на своей грузовой машине FORLAND. Начинается учебный год и его детям нужно купить школьную форму, учебники, книги. По этой причине Абдурасул обратился за кредитом. Он надеется, что с помощью заемных средств он приобретет все необходимые школьные принадлежности и его дети смогут начать учебу без затруднений.
texts.en: This is Abdurasul. He is 28 years old. He is a husband, father, and son. Abdurasul is the sole breadwinner in his family. He provides for his children, family, and parents. His family lives in the Rudaki region. Abdurasul provides heavy cargo transportation services with his FORLAND freight truck. The school year is starting and Abdurasul's children need school uniforms, books, and textbooks. For this reason, Abdurasul has applied for a loan. He hopes that with the help of this loan he can purchase all the necessary school supplies and his children can start school without any difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms for his children.

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en:
Mon is a 50-year-old widow who has three dependent children and lives in Prey Veng province. She grows rice and sells desserts to earn income for a living. She has been involved in these businesses since she was 19 years old and she is able to generate income around $12 (USD) per day. Drought has caused to reduce her income recently, which make it very hard for her to support her three children. 
This is the second loan with VisionFund for Mon and her group member. She supported her family through the past loan. Now she is willing to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer to increase productivity of her crop yield. With any remaining money, she will buy ingredients for making desserts to sell. She is very hopeful this new loan will increase her income to save for future needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to increase productivity of her crop.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Mariée, Abla est une femme qui vit avec son mari à Adidogomé. Abla est âgée de 32 ans et prépare puis vend de la pâte bandée faite à base du maïs appelé « Kom ». Abla achète le nécessaire servant à la préparation une fois par mois au marché et le revend de quartier en quartier et à domicile. Abla  sollicite ce crédit pour commander des bols de maïs  en vue de gagner plus de bénéfices et pouvoir soutenir aux besoins de la famille  puis améliorer ses conditions de vie quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Abla is a married woman who lives with her husband in Adidogomé. Abla is 32 years old and she prepares and sells wrapped maize dough called « Kom ».

Abla buys the necessary ingredients for the preparation of her dough once a month at the market and sells the dough by going from neighborhood to neighborhood and out of her home.

Abla is asking for this loan to order bowlfuls of maize so as to earn more profit and be able to cover the needs of her family and then improve her daily living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 75 bowlfuls of maize.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Tho's Group

texts.en:
Tho, a farmer living in Kampong Cham province, is 34 years old. She has four children, two of whom are in school. For 16 years, she has grown cassava and rice to support her family. The price of her cassava is decreasing, so she is only able to earn around 11 USD per day to support her big family.

Tho has been with VisionFund for one cycle, and she completely repaid her previous loan. She was able to improve her living conditions with the previous loan. Now, she has formed a group of four to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to produce a good yield. She hopes that the second loan will help her to increase the crop products so she can earn more income and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase the productivity of her crop yield in order to earn more income to support her children’s education

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: St. Saikah

texts.en:
St. Saikah, 38, who lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband is an employee in a factory. She sells electronics and her customers are allowed to pay her on credit. She and her husband pull together to increase their family’s income.


St. Saikah wants to have safe sanitation and water facilities for her family. She has applied for a 7,200,000 IDR loan through Kiva's field partner KPP-UMKM Syariah to build them in her home. Her family’s income is not sufficient to build a toilet and clean water source with cash, but they are able to repay loans received.


St. Saikah and her family want to live a healthy life with good sanitation and water. She is very grateful for the opportunity extended by Kiva and wants to thank all its lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet and clean water source in her home

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica may be young at her age of 25, but her desire to enrich her family’s life is tremendous. She combines all income generating ventures that she knows to help her driver husband, Rogine, earn a living. She runs a variety store, sells frozen foods, retails cellphone load, and buys scrap once in a while. She wants to earn and save enough to ensure the future and education of her two small children. 

They are living in Bacolod City, the capital city of Negros Occidental. It’s a prolific city for many businesses as many schools, offices, and entertainment places flourish in the area. This is why Jessica was encouraged to run all these enterprises. She still longs to improve her business by borrowing additional capital worth PHP 14,000 which she can use to buy more supplies for her variety store and additional chicken meat, pork, hotdogs and sausages. She plans to set aside some money for her cellphone e-loading and scrap businesses. May you be God’s channel of blessings to her. 

Jessica consistently meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her variety store, additional chicken meat, pork, hotdogs and sausages

loans.name: Sreyeang's Group

texts.en:
Srey Eang, 53, is a farmer living in a small wooden house located in Prey Veng province. The main source of her income has been from growing rice for 34 years. She earns additional income buying recycling items and selling ice cream. The crop did not grow well because of drought, which is the main problem for her business. She can make about $12 (USD) per day to support her family. After her family’s expenses, Srey Eang can save around $5 (USD) each day. Unfortunately, she lacks capital to support her farming business so she decided to ask for a loan with VisionFund. 
This is the second loan for her. She has household supplies to support her family from her past loan. In a group of four, she is the leader. As the group leader, she is going to use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and recycling items to support her business. She hopes to get more income to save for future needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to boost her crop yields

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Non's Group

texts.en:
Non is a 45-year-old mother of five dependent children who are all in school. They live in Prey Veng province. 

Traditional rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 26 years. Selling feeding crickets is an additional source of her family’s income. From those two businesses, she is able to earn about $12 (USD) per day. Recently, Non earned a low income because her crop did not grow well due to drought.

This is the second loan for her group which consists of two members. The past loan enabled Non to completely renovate her old house and support her family. For this second loan, she is willing to buy seed and fertilizer to boost her crop yield and the remaining money will be spent on buying more crickets for feed. She expects that her second loan portion will bring her more profits and enable her to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer to boost her crop yield.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Haiquan

texts.en:
Haiquan is a 52-year-old man who has been engaged in selling seeds and fertilizer wholesale for more than ten years with his wife. He has a son who is working in a foreign country and couldn’t take care of his old parents. Haiquan was living in a poor family. He didn’t receive much education and devoted himself to society very early. Haiquan is an honest and hardworking person.

Last year, Haiquan repaired his old house, which cost a large amount of money, and sometimes, his clients will owe the feed and fertilizer money also. This year, since there are a lot of accounts receivable, Haiquan’s business faces a turnover problem.

Haiquan requested CNY 6,000 in Microcred, and this is his second time borrowing money. He has good personal credit. He will use the money to stock feed and fertilizer so his business could go well.

loans.use: to stock feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Amélé est une femme mariée âgée de 51 ans résidante à Adidogomé. Mère de quatre enfants, Amélé produit des amuse-gueules faites à base du maïs et de l’arachide.  Amélé s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché du nécessaire et le revend à domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Amélé désire ce prêt pour commander des bols d’arachide et de maïs. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Amélé compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider ses enfants à avoir un épanouissement et une bonne éducation.
texts.en:
Amélé is a married woman, aged 51 and living in Adidogomé. The mother of four children, Amélé makes snacks out of maize and peanuts.

Amélé renews her stock of ingredients as necessary three times a month in the market and sells her snacks out of her house and in the surrounding neighborhoods.

Amélé wishes to have this loan to order some bowls of peanuts and maize. With the profit she will make, she intends to improve her sales and help her children to flourish and get a good education.

loans.use: to buy 10 bowlfuls of peanuts and 12 bowlfuls of maize

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia, age 41, from the province of Negros Occidental. She is married to Angelito, a driver with whom she has two children. One of them is already working while the other is still in elementary school. 

Virginia’s whole family is working diligently to gain enough resources to meet their everyday needs and save for the future. While her husband drives a passenger vehicle for income, she operates a small general store that sells commodities like toiletries, snack items, canned goods, and beverages. 

Her eldest child also contributes by paying their monthly utilities such as electricity and water. The family owns a rice field that gives them supplementary income every four months given a favorable weather condition. On weekends, their youngest child helps by working in their rice field. 

But there are circumstances that Virginia cannot control. Typhoons and other calamities affect their rice harvest and the income derived from it. Hence she aims to further improve her general store by adding supplies to her inventory. She aims to buy more grocery items and beverages with the help of a PHP 16,000 loan. Please extend your assistance to her and may you receive more blessings and guidance from God.  

Virginia faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items and beverages

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 47-year-old married mother of seven children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her son owns a flower shop in which he sells roses, rose petals, garlands and bouquets. His main profession is to decorate cars for wedding ceremonies. 

The flower business is not profitable and barely fulfills the family's needs. Now the wedding season is going to start but her son does not have a sufficient stock of flowers to meet the rapid increase in demand. 

So, Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to buy more roses to string into garlands and for making bouquets. Nasreen hopes that this loan will bring positive changes to the business and in their lives. Now, she will be able to increase her savings faster. 

Nasreen praises lenders for their support and thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy roses for her son's flower shop.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over one and half years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es: Juan tiene 39 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos de 19, 4 Y 9 años de edad el es un hombre muy trabajador que se preocupa por llevar el sustento del hogar, por lo cual les está brindando estudios a sus dos hijos mayores por lo que quiere verlos triunfar en la vida. Juan se dedica a prestar sus servicios en construcción como maestro de obra en diferentes proyectos desde hace 15 años ya que  por medio de este trabajo es como mantiene la economía del hogar. Juan desea terminar de construir su vivienda ya que con sus ingresos no tiene mucha posibilidad por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: puertas, ventanas, balcones y cemento arena para encementar una parte del corredor para darles una mejor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Juan is 39 years old. He lives in his own house with his domestic partner and their three children, 19, 4 and 9 years old. He is a very hardworking man who struggles to support his family, and is currently giving his two older children an education, because he wants to see them prosper in life. Juan has worked for 15 years rendering construction services as a builder foreman in different projects. Thanks to this job he supports the household finances. Juan wants to finish building his house, but with his income he does not have many chances. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in: doors, windows, balconies, cement and sand to cement a part of the hallway in order to give his family more safety.

loans.use: to invest in: doors, windows, balconies, cement and sand to cement a part of the hallway in order to give his family more safety.

loans.name: Soklim's Group

texts.en:
A 26-year-old mother of two small children, Soklim is living in a wooden house with her family located in Prey Veng province. One of her children is in school while the other one is under school age. Growing rice is the main source of her family’s income, and working as a construction worker is an additional source of income for her to complement her family’s need. She has been involved in her rice farming business since she was 18 years old and she is able to generate income of around 12USD per day.

Soklim is an existing borrower of VisionFund for one cycle already. She fully paid back the past loan, which has helped her to improve her living and have enough household supplies to use. Unluckily, her crop has not grown well due to drought last year, and she might earn a lower income.

To overcome this hardship, she is now leading a group of two to take this second Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield as well as her income to support her child’s studying.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yield as well as her income.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Meswaleh

texts.en:
Meswaleh is a married woman and has been blessed with one child who is still too young to attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Meswaleh has a fish selling business, which has been operational for over two years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Meswaleh dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 38 years old, married with two children who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juliet has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Juliet requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Juliet has been in this business for six years. In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Majeed

texts.en:
Majeed is 40 years old,. He lives in Jarash with his wife and his four children. He is working hard to provide a good life and good education for his family, and he does not want to see them need anything.

Majeed did some enhancements to his barbershop by taking the first loan and adding new decoration in addition to new shaving tools and another barber seat. By doing that, more customers began to come to be served, and his work moved forward. That made Majeed apply for a loan to develop and expand his shop more and more, to buy more barber tools, and to do more promotion for his shop to attract people more and more.

Also Majeed is thinking of getting one employee in the near future to expand the business more.

loans.use: to develop and expand his shop  more and more and buy more barber  tools and use it to do more promotion for his shop.

loans.name: Blanca Esmeralda

texts.es: Blanca tiene 37 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres pequeños hijos de 14, 10, 4 años de edad a los cuales a dos les está brindando estudios por ser los más mayores, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y se preocupa por llevar el sustento al hogar y que no le falte lo necesario a sus hijos y gracias a su compañero de vida que le aporta para los gastos del hogar. Blanca se dedica a la venta de lociones para caballeros y damas desde hace 5 años y buscando la manera de obtener más ganancias vende ropa de marca como pantalones y blusas es así como ella mantiene la economía del hogar. Blanca desea cambiar las láminas del techo de su vivienda ya que las que tiene se encuentran deterioradas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lamina zincalum y polines de esta manera poder brindarles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca, 37, lives in her own home with her life partner and her three small children, ages 14, 10, and 4. She's providing an education for the two oldest. She's a very enterprising woman and she's concerned about supporting her family so her children don't lack what they need. She's grateful to her husband, who helps cover the household expenses.

Blanca has earned a living for five years selling men's and women's lotions, and she sells designer clothing like pants and blouses as a way to earn more money. That's how she supports the household budget.

Blanca wants to replace the metal roofing on her house because currently it's deteriorated. She's asking FUSAI for a loan to buy corrugated metal roofing and beams so she can give her children better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal roofing and beams so she can give her children better living conditions.

loans.name: Dona

texts.en:
This is Dona, 35 years old, from Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. She is married to Alberto, a driver, and they have children who are studying in high school and college.

Dona runs a “sari-sari” or variety store that sells various commodities like canned goods, snack items, sachets of toiletries, repacked seasonings and condiments, beverages, and many others. She knows that competition in this line of business grows stiffer as time goes by, therefore she thinks of another way to earn extra income. She ventures into direct selling of Tupperware, a plasticware well-known for its durability and usability. Her profits help provide for their everyday needs but she’s anxious about her children’s education.

She dreams of expanding her businesses. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to procure more dry goods, grocery items, and beverages for her variety store. She will also keep some amount to buy Tupperware products as ordered by her customers. Hopefully she can gain higher profits that will help sustain her children’s educational expenses.

She has already availed several loans from CCT Credit Cooperative before and she has been faithful in repaying them. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to procure more dry goods, grocery items, and beverages.

loans.name: Ma. Hermelita

texts.en:
Ma. Hermelita is 34 years old and is married. She has four children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Hermelita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ma. Hermelita requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Ma. Hermelita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Ma. Hermelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 59 years old. She is married and has four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rhodora has a cafeteria business in the Philippines. Rhodora requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy coffee, milk, sugar and utensils for her cafeteria business.

Rhodora has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rhodora would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy coffee, milk, sugar and utensils for her cafeteria business.

loans.name: Majeedan's Group

texts.en:
Majeedan is a 53-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. Her husband remains sick most of the time and sits idle at home. Her daughter runs a small boutique at home where she sells garments at very reasonable rates. She purchases clothing from a market at a low price, sews it and then sells it for a higher price in her community. The ladies of town like her garments collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothing has increased due to attractive designs and colors. Her son affords all the household expenses from his earnings and she contributes her earnings only for savings.

She wants to increase the variety of clothing on daily basis. Majeedan has requested a loan so that her daughter can buy a wider variety of garments to fulfill the demand. Majeedan wishes for a bright future for her children and her dream is to provide better education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of garments for her daughter's boutique.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 48 years old, married and has six children, one of whom is in school. Mercedes is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mercedes requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mercedes has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Mercedes would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 57 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them. Esmeralda has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Esmeralda has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries.

In the future Esmeralda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Atef

texts.en: Atef is 35, married, has one child and lives with his parents in the same house. He has a small store in which there are a photocopier, writing tools, school handouts, and gifts. He is requesting 5000 EGP to buy more writing tools, supplies for the photocopier and more gifts.

loans.use: To buy more writing tools, supplies for the photocopier and more gifts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and gravel; and to pay for labour to pave the floor of her house with concrete so that she can provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.name: Ninalyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ninalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Ninalyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

Ninalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Josinta

texts.en: Josinta is 29 years old and married with 3 children. She operates a retail shop. The last time she took a loan, it was used to re-stock her business and it helped her to increase her income levels. Josinta has been able to save some money and now wants to construct a house. However, the money she has is not enough to support the project. Josinta requests a loan to top-up her savings to buy building materials like iron bars, bricks and stones to construct a house.

loans.use: to buy building materials like iron bars, bricks and stones to construct her house.

loans.name: Maa Mangala Shg A-1 Group

texts.en:
B. Durgavaralakshmi is a 26-year-old entrepreneur standing in the middle in the photograph. She is married and is a blessed mother of her two-year-old daughter. B. Durgavaralakshmi is a mason by profession and works very hard to meet her ends. She is a resident of a small village in Koraput district, Odisha, India.

B. Durgavaralakshmi and her family do not have a toilet in their home. They have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private, which is a major concern for her as she feels that her privacy is being hampered. And this makes her more vulnerable.

Therefore, B. Durgavaralakshmi, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a toilet and install sanitary fittings in it to increase her convinience and privacy and minimize the risk of crimes and vulnerability.

B. Durgavaralakshmi and her group members are eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to build a toilet and install sanitary fittings in it

loans.name: Maa Mangala Shg A-2 Group

texts.en:
The lady standing in the middle of the photo is Elisha who is 46 years old. She is a humble and sensible lady who hails from a village in Koraput district, Odisha, India. She is a woman with great ideas and a creative mind. She has an 18-year-old daughter in her care who is a very bright student and wants to pursue her career in the banking industry. But Elisha is not financially sound enough to provide the course fees for her coaching classes.

Therefore, Elisha along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. Elisha will use her portion of the loan amount to pay the course fees for her daughter's coaching classes so that she can undertake her studies very smoothly without any deviation. This loan amount will help Elisha's daughter fulfill her dreams and get her dream job.

Elisha is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to pay the course fees for her daughter's coaching classes.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Mère de neuf enfants, Ama est une femme mariée âgée de 44 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Ama est une marchande de produits d’alimentations générales qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile dans sa propre boutique pour gagner des revenus. Ama désire ce prêt pour commander des bidons d’huile, des cartons de tomates et des sacs de riz. Avec le bénéfice qui en résultera, Ama va pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Mother of nine children, Ama is a married 44-year-old woman who lives in Adidogomé.

Ama sells general food products and buys supplies three times a month at the market. She resells the food from home in her own shop to make an income. Ama is asking for this loan to order containers of oil, boxes of tomatoes, and bags of rice.

With the resulting profits, Ama will be able to help her husband with the family expenses and provide a good education for their children.

loans.use: to buy four containers of oil, six boxes of tomatoes, and six bags of rice.

loans.name: Mario Adalberto

texts.es: Mario tiene 33 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 3 pequeños hijos de 6 años y dos gemelos de 9 años de edad a los cuales están sacando adelante en sus estudios con el apoyo que le brinda su compañera de vida, el es un hombre muy responsable y se siente orgulloso de llevar el sustento al hogar para que no les falte nada a su familia el se dedica a la albañilería desde  hace 8 años. Mario solicito un crédito el cual invirtió en encementar el piso de su vivienda por lo cual no logro instalar puertas y ventanas en su vivienda, gracias a la buena experiencia anterior solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI que le permita invertir en: puertas, ventanas y balcones para terminar de construir su vivienda y dar mejor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Mario is 33 years old. He lives in his own home with his life partner and their 3 small children, a 6 year old and 9 year old twins. The children are succeeding at school with help from their mother.

Mario is a very responsible man, and feels proud of providing for his family so that they lack nothing. He has worked in masonry for 8 years. Mario previously sought a loan which he used to cement the floor of his house, but wasn't able to install doors and windows. Thanks to his prior good experience, he now seeks a new loan from FUSAI that will allow him to invest in doors, windows, and iron window bars, to finish building his home and provide better security to his family.

loans.use: to invest in doors, windows, and iron window bars to finish building his home and provide better security to his family.

loans.name: Nuredin

texts.en:
Nuredin is 51 and a member of the vulnerable Egyptian Albanian community. He is a married father of two, 23 and 17, who still go to school. The loan Nuredin is requesting will be used to pay for his wife who has been sick for very long time to go to a health specialist. Kindly note that majority of vulnerable ethnic members lack nutrition and sanitation and their living conditions are very poor; this makes them suffer from many illnesses.

For the past 20 years, Nuredin has been working as blacksmith making mostly agricultural tools including shovels, hand hay and harvesting, hay makings and other tools. Nuredin works as a night man also.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's medical expenses

loans.name: Maa Mangala Shg A-3 Group

texts.en:
Aruna, 25 years old and married, is standing on the left in the photograph. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for six years. Aruna lives in Koraput district, a rural town in Odisha, India. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. The income from her business is unstable because when some disease happens to the poultry, they can die, which would leave her nothing to sell. So she will be in financial trouble. The main hardship that Aruna faces is the lack of capital.

She, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. She hopes that this loan will improve her living standard. With her business profit, Aruna hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise

loans.name: Essivi  Rolande

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Essivi est une femme âgée de 26 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Essivi est une marchande des fournitures de bureau qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Essivi  sollicite ce prêt pour commander des cartons de cahiers et des boîtes d’écritoires en vue d’avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de leurs enfants et à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées par son foyer.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of three children, Essivi is a woman aged 26, living in Adidogomé. Essivi sells office supplies and renews her stock three times a month in the market. She resells her goods in front of her house.

Essivi is requesting this loan to order some cartons of notebooks and boxes of writing boards so as to have a large inventory and maximize her profit. She wants to help her husband with the education of their children and to cover the daily expenses of their household.

loans.use: to buy three cartons of notebooks and two boxes of writing boards.

loans.name: Domiana

texts.en:
Domiana is 42 years old. She is married and has two children. Her business is farming, mostly mangoes, maize, and cow peas. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of 18,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy a water pump and seeds. She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy a water pump and seeds.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
This 64-year-old entrepreneur is Angeles from Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. For 26 years she has been earning profits from a direct selling business. She sells various products of Avon, Natasha, Boardwalk, Sundance and Personal Collection. Most of them are personal care and home products, RTWs, bags and shoes. Her income adds to her husband Lucio’s salary as a contractor and sustains her family of eight children. As of now, her children are already grown up and working. It’s now Angeles’ time to reward herself with some savings for her retirement.

She applied for PHP 36,000 loan to enhance her direct selling business. She has already expanded her network of customers who regularly place orders from her. She will use this additional capital to buy those pre-ordered merchandise plus more reserved items to sell. With this, she can boost her income and savings for her retirement.

She’s really positive that KIVA lenders have kind hearts for old people like her who has proven her integrity as a faithful member of CCT Credit Cooperative. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of Gods she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise for her direct selling business

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling fruits. Jenelyn dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maa Mangala Shg A-4 Group

texts.en:
K. Sarada is a 37-year-old lady standing on the extreme right in the photograph. She hails from a small village in Koraput district, Odisha, India. She has a family comprised of her husband and two sons. K. Sarada does not have a toilet in her home. She has to walk nearly 2km to access a public toilet daily, which is not feasible enough.

K. Sarada, along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a toilet in her home. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for her family. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick.

The loan amount will help her in safeguarding her family's health by reducing unnecessary medical expenses.

loans.use: to build a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that neither has piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food. Halima has operated a tailoring business for the past three years. She makes women suits and men suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.en: Shabnam is a 44-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible housewife and looks after her family at home. Her son owns an decoration piece sale shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He wants to purchase a variety of new designed decoration pieces to improve his business,however, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore Shabnam has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase decoration pieces for her son's decoration shop. She is hopeful that the loan will be productive one for the business. Shabnam is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her son's decoration shop.

loans.name: Roger

texts.fr:
Roger est un homme dynamique âgé de 56 ans. Il vit avec sa femme et ses 3 enfants en ville. Depuis 3 ans il tient une petite quincaillerie dans un quartier animé de la ville. 
Roger est emprunteur chez Vahatra depuis 2 ans. Les bénéfices des prêts d’avant lui ont permis d’exercer une activité d’élevage porcin et de volaille. Avec ce prêt, Roger compte acheter d’autres matériaux de construction et d’articles de quincaillerie qu’il n’a pas encore. Il espère attirer plus de clients et augmenter ses bénéfices.
Roger souhaite que ses enfants réussissent leurs études et prévois de construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Roger is a dynamic man aged 56. He lives with his wife and three children in town. For three years he has had a little hardware store in an busy area of the town. He has been a borrower with Vahatra for two years. The profits from his prior loans have permitted him to run a business raising pigs and chickens.

With this loan, Roger intends to buy other construction materials and hardware items that he doesn't yet have. He hopes to attract more clients and grow his profits.

Roger hopes that his children will succeed in their studies and plans to build a house for the family.

loans.use: to buy various sorts of hardware to resell, retail.

loans.name: Gavilan Group

texts.en: The Gavilan group is composed of Mexican peasants who live in remote houses without any electricity service. Fulgencia, standing first from the right, is one of the strong women of Gavilan. She is a field worker and a three-child mother who wants to have electric lighting at home to make her children's lives easier. The installation of a third generation solar home system will help Fulgencia with this objective. The loan is to fund solar systems for this group and will be paid back with the monthly fee for first-year-of-operation maintenance services they pay.

loans.use: to pay for a small photovoltaic system for their house.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru:
Манзура успешно погасила свой предыдущий кредит и благодарит всех кредитов, которые поддержали ее и верили ей. Она благодаря займу смогла расширить свою деятельность. Манзура обратилась во второй раз и уверена, что ее не оставят без внимания и на этот раз. 
Скоро младший брат Манзуры женится, и она хочет ему помочь в проведении свадебного мероприятия. В Таджикистане свадьба масштабное событие и приглашаются гости около 150-200 человек. Таджики очень дружелюбная нация старавшаяся сохранять родственные связи, за счет этого приглашаются столь большое количество гостей, и соответственно свадебное мероприятие требует больших расходов. Манзура намерена заемные деньги потратить на свадьбу брата. Средства пойдут за проведения мероприятия и свадебных подарков для невесты и ее родственников.
texts.en:
Manzura successfully repaid her previous loan and thanks all the lenders who supported her and believed in her. Thanks to the loan, she was able to expand her business. Manzura has applied for a second time and is sure that she will not be left ignored this time either.

Soon Manzura's younger brother will get married, and she wants to help him to conduct his wedding celebrations. In Tajikistan a wedding is a large-scale event and about 150-200 people are invited as guests. Tajiks are a very friendly nation that strives to maintain family ties and because of this a large number of guests are invited, and correspondingly a wedding celebration requires great expenses. Manzura intends to spend the borrowed money on her brother's wedding. The funds will go to conducting the celebrations and to wedding presents for the bride and her relatives.

loans.use: to conduct a wedding celebration for her younger brother.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is determined, and she perseveres in running her variety store business because she dreams of owning a bigger store someday. Indeed, without sufficient capital, all of the hard work will be of little worth. But when her previous loan was granted, the amount made a great impact on the business. She bought stocks of grocery items and necessary materials for her variety store. She wants to thank lenders since the amount they have provided became a way for her to increase sales. The business is growing. Her total income reaches to approximately Php 19,000 month.

Wilfreda wants to thank Center for Community Transformation (CCT) as well for approving her previous loan. This year, she is requesting another loan of Php 8,000 to add onto her business. She will utilize the amount to buy additional grocery items such as bottled drinks, school supplies, sacks of rice and processed foods.

On a weekly basis, Wilfreda regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God.
