A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items, such as bottled drinks, school supplies, sacks of rice and processed foods.

loans.name: Jallety

texts.en:
Jallety is a 56-year-old land lady and a baker in Kilifi, Kenya. She is a married mother of six children and her husband provides additional income. She has been in this business for the last five years doing well.

This is her third borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to renovate her rentals and the anticipated profit to expand her bakery business. She hopes to grow her bakery business in future and create employment to youths in her community.

loans.use: to renovate her rentals

loans.name: Voahangy

texts.fr:
Voahangy est une femme travailleuse et courageuse de 39 ans. Elle est séparée de son mari il y a maintenant cinq ans. Donc elle a élever seul leurs quatre enfants. Ces derniers sont maintenant âgés de 12 à 22 ans. L'ainé est en préparation de la fin de ses études et fait de petit boulot pour l'aider. Les trois derniers sont encore en secondaire.
Elle exerce une activité de confection depuis 2010. Auparavant, elle travaillait dans une entreprise de zone franche et elle n'a pas eu le temps de s'occuper de ses enfants, c'est pourquoi, elle décidait de démissionner et changer de travail. Elle voudrait offrir à ses enfants une meilleur éducation et une meilleure condition de vie , malgré la situation. Elle projette aussi d'avoir sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Voahangy is a hardworking and courageous 39-year-old woman. She has been separated from her husband for five years. Thus, she raises their four children on her own. These last are now 12 to 22 years old. The oldest is preparing to graduate and takes small jobs to help her. The last three are still in secondary school.

She has been working as a tailor since 2010. Previously, she worked in a free zone company and she did not have time to take care of her children. This is why she decided to resign and change work. She would like to offer her children a better education and better living conditions in spite of the situation. She also plans to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of fabric.

loans.name: Christo Nti Group

texts.en: Diana is a group representative, aged 45 years. She is single with one dependent child who is in school. The group is called Christo Nti. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change their future for the better. Diana sells shoes, sandals and scarves. She has been operating this business for 11 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes, sandals and scarves to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her child and to re-invest back into her business.

loans.use: to buy more shoes, sandals and scarves to sell.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 26-year-old, married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and little daughter in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, a few years ago Bassam started his own business. He manages a grocery store for selling the basic needs of home. He is good and has a loyal clientele.

This is the only source of income for the family. Bassam took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy new inventory for his grocery store. This will increase his sales and also his income. Bassam appears in the photo.

loans.use: buy new inventory for his grocery store.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 38 years old. She is married and has four children, two of whom are in school.

Melanie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more school supplies, foot-wear and other personal care products to sell.

Melanie has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling feeds.

Melanie aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more school supplies, foot-wear and other personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Maa Mangala Shg A-5 Group

texts.en: Mita is a 28-year-old lady standing on the extreme left in the photograph. She hails from a humble background in Koraput district, Odisha, India. She is a mother of a teenaged child. Her husband is a farmer by profession and they have access to very limited resources due to the lack of adequate capital. Unfortunately, she does not have a toilet facility in her house but she understands the importance of having a toilet at home. She leads a group of two women who have come together to apply for a loan of 45,000 INR. They need the loan to build toilets in their respective homes. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for these families. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. Your loan will provide these three families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: to build a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Noleen

texts.en:
Noleen is 50 years old. She is married and has seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Noleen has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Noleen requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Noleen has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Noleen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Maa Mangala Shg A-6 Group

texts.en:
Slipa is a 29-year-old single mother who lives with her father and her child in Koraput district, Odisha, India. She has been involved in vegetable cultivation for two years and her father has been involved in paddy cultivation for five years. As a farmer, her father has knowledge of vegetable cultivation and he is helping her in this activity. Whatever they earn is not sufficient to manage their family. She, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR and she will use her portion to purchase hybrid seeds, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor charges.

The family income will increase and they will be inspired to do more. She says that the income will help to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor charges

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 31 year-old married mother of two children who works hard to support her family. She is on the staff of one of company, and her husband works in agriculture. Even though the family works very hard, it can be difficult for them to afford the cost of her education.

She is very happy because Tuba Rai Metin gave a loan of $ 800. It will allow Jacinta to study at university . She will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks, school supplies and other things. She hopes that further education will help the family to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks, school supplies and other things.

loans.name: Marianne

texts.fr:
Mariane est une femme battante âgée de 66 ans. Veuve depuis longtemps, elle assure seule les besoins de ses trois enfants. Elle habite loin de la ville et possède un dépôt de médicaments pour ravitailler le village. Son activité rend service aux gens du quartier qui n’ont plus besoin de se déplacer en ville pour acheter les médicaments. 
Cela fait 3 ans que Mariane vend des médicaments. Avec ce prêt, elle va acheter plus de stocks de médicaments et se ravitailler d’autres médicaments qu’elle n’a pas encore.
Mariane espère gagner des bénéfices pour être autonome et ne plus prendre de prêts à l’avenir. Elle constitue petit à petit de l’épargne pour assurer l’avenir de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marianne, aged 66, is a fighter. A longtime widow, she is the only one who earns money for the needs of her three children. She lives far from town and owns a medicine depot to serve the village. Her business helps the people in the area who no longer have to go off to town to buy medicines.

Marianne has been selling medicines for three years. With this loan she is going to buy a bigger stockpile of medicines and also add some medicines she does not currently stock. She hopes to earn enough profit to be independent and not have to take out any more loans. She is putting aside savings little by little to ensure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines wholesale and then resell them, retail

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is from Pasay City, Philippines, and is a 39 year-old business woman. She is currently involved in different types of businesses: buying and selling of personal or home products, soap making, and she owns a house for rent. She has been operating these businesses for almost 20 years and she is motivated to grow and improve them for it provides income for her family.

Ma. Victoria is primarily involved in trading different home and personal products. She invests in products from well-known local companies that give opportunities to housewives like her who wants to have an additional source of income. These companies give brochures of their products for customers to choose from. After purchasing the items, the customers will then have to make payments on a weekly basis. Ma. Victoria should have items on display so that customers will not wait for weeks just to have the items.

For the past 6 months, Ma. Victoria considered the businesses growing. To continue what she has started, she decided to apply for a loan worth Php 20,000 which she will use as supporting capital to buy necessities for her businesses. She is hoping that CCT will grant her request since this will be a great help for her business’ growth for she dreams to have her businesses expanded someday.

Ma. Victoria believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy necessities for her business, like stocks of personal products so that customers will not wait for weeks just to have the items.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 31 years old. She is married and has three children who are all attending school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Sharon has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Sharon requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell.

Sharon has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Sharon would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: New Beginning - Tinhgia Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vạn is 50 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture as a farmer for more than 10 years. Vạn lives in Tinh Gia district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village and the market need is low in this region. Her income is not high enough for her to do what she really needs to comfort her life.

The main hardship that Vạn faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase necessary things like seeds, machines, and fertilizer for her business. This is Vạn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan will improve her living standard. She is the group leader of "New Beginning - TinhGia", which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Vạn hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase necessary things like seeds, machines, and fertilizer for her business.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Johna works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fattening pigs. Johna is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Johna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Twigarukire Group

texts.fr:
Jeannette fait parti du groupe Twigarukire, et habite  à Gitega.  Elle a 40 ans et est marié  à Léopold un commerçant .Ensemble, ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 14 à 18 ans, tous étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de bière de banane  depuis 18 ans.

Elle est à ses vingt-et –unième crédits à Turame. Avec le crédit de Kiva, elle voudrait acheter  une grande quantité  de bière  de banane à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait acheter des  terres cultivables et voir  ses  enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Jeanette is a member of the Twigarukire group and lives in Gitega. She is 40 years old and married to Leopold, who is a salesman. They have three children between the ages of 14 and 18, all of whom attend school.

She has been selling banana beer for 18 years.

This is her 21 st loan from Turame. With the Kiva credit that she requests she would like to buy a large quantity of banana beer for resale to earn more.

In the coming years, she wishes to buy fertile plots of land and see her children through their studies.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of banana beer for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of fish for resale to earn more.

loans.name: La Familia Perez Group

texts.es:
Rosa  (la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía) es una mujer de 41 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia con el que vive muy feliz mente, Rosa cuenta que con el crédito anterior le fue muy bien, ya que  logro comprar sus materiales para seguir elaborando cintas y pudo satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes por lo que sus ingresos mejoraron, con este avance Rosa se encuentra contenta mas no así satisfecha y nuevamente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo siempre en su compra de hilos de tipo seda, alemán y lustrina como también mostacia para la respectiva elaboración de cintas típicas, esto lo hace porque su clientela ha aumentado gracias a su valiosa creatividad y dedicación a su trabajo de artesana.
La mayor esperanza de Rosa es finalizar la construcción de su casa para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad.
texts.en:
Rosa (the first one on the right in the photograph) is a 41-year-old woman. She's married and has a beautiful family with whom she lives very happily.

Rosa said the last loan went very well for her because she managed to buy her supplies to continue making belts. She also was able to better satisfy her customers' needs, so her income improved.

Rosa's happy about this progress, but not satisfied, so she's requesting another loan to invest again in buying silk and cotton thread and embroidery floss as well as beaded thread to make traditional belts. She's doing this because her clientele has increased thanks to her valued creativity and dedication to her work as an artisan.

Rosa's biggest hope is to finish construction on her house so she can give her family greater stability.

loans.use: to buy silk and cotton thread, embroidery floss, and beaded thread

loans.name: Kora Group

texts.fr:
J. Pierre fait partie du groupe  Kora et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 45 ans et est marié à Febronie ,une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de 5 à 20 ans,dont  6 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce d'habits    depuis  20 ans. 

Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  des habits à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait augmenter son capital ,et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
J. Pierre is a member of the Kora Group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 45 years old and married to Febronie, a shopkeeper. They have seven children together aged between five and 20 years old. Six of them are currently receiving an education.

J. Pierre has been selling clothing for 20 years. With this Kiva loan, he will be able to increase his capital and purchase clothes which will be resold at a profit.

In the coming years, he would like to increase his capital and see his children continue to receive an education.

loans.use: to increase their capital and allow them to purchase clothes which will be resold at a profit.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José tiene 54 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa, el es un hombre muy trabajador que siempre se ha dedicado a su trabajo gracias a lo que sus padres le enseñaron el se defiende solo en esta vida él se dedica a prestar sus servicios como jornalero lo que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar, pero además buscando la manera de obtener mejores ingresos económicos vende minutas por diferentes comunidades y así poder contar con una fuente de ingresos más sostenible. José desea cambiar las láminas del techo de su cocina ya que cuando llueve le azota mucho y se moja, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: laminas, madera clavos, y así poder tener otra mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
José is 54 years old and lives in his own home with his wife. He is a hard-working man who has always dedicated himself to his work, thanks to what his parents taught him. 

He stands on his own and works as a day laborer, which allows him  to sustain his home, but he is looking for a way to obtain better income. He also sells shaved ice in different communities, which allows him to have a more sustainable source of income. 

José wants to replace the sheet metal on the roof of his kitchen because it gets battered when it rains and water gets in. He is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy sheet metal, wood, and nails so that he can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, wood, and nails so that he can have better living conditions.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Mauricio tiene 53 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad a quien junto a su compañero de vida le están dando todo el cuido y cariño necesario que el necesita. El es un hombre muy trabajador él se dedica a prestar sus servicios como jornalero desde hace 3 años lo que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar, pero además buscando la manera de obtener mejores ingresos económicos vende pescado ambulantemente por las comunidades. Mauricio desea cambiar las carpetas del baño de su vivienda por lámina ya que quiere tener más privacidad, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera y clavos para tener otra mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Mauricio, 53, lives in his own home with his life partner and his young two-year-old child, whom Mauricio and his partner are giving all the necessary care and affection.

He's a very hardworking man. For three years he has been providing services as a day laborer, which allows him to support his household. He's always looking for ways to earn more income, so he also sells fish as a street vendor in the neighborhoods.

Mauricio wants to replace the covering in the bathroom of his house with metal roofing because he wants more privacy. He's asking FUSAI for a loan to buy metal roofing, wood, and nails so he can have a better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy metal roofing, wood, and nails to have better living conditions

loans.name: Start Now - Tinhgia Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chính is 41 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for more than 10 years. Chính lives in Tinh Gia district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village and the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Chính faces is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sugar, sweets, and milk to resell. This is Chính's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan will improve her living standard. She is the group leader of "Start now - TinhGia", which consists of four members.

With her business profit, Chính hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sugar, sweets, and milk to sell.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 44 ans qui habite à Adidogomé. Mère de deux enfants, Afi est une marchande des céréales qu’elle achète deux fois par mois au marché et le revend là également pour gagner des revenus. Pour commander des sacs de maïs et des bols de riz, Afi nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et mieux couvrir les frais scolaire de ses enfants dès la rentrée à venir.
texts.en: Afi is a married woman of 44 who lives in Adidogomé. She has two children. Afi sells cereals that she buys twice a month at the market and resells in the same place to earn a living. To order sacks of corn and bowls of rice, Afi needs this loan to fund her supply of provisions and to make a good profit margin in order to provide for her family and to manage her children's school fees more effectively at the start of the new school year.

loans.use: to buy 08 sacks of corn and 46 bowls of  rice.

loans.name: Tik Wende Group

texts.fr: Cécile est une femme de 39 ans, mariée mère de 5 enfants. elle exerce son activité depuis 7 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est son restaurant qui est situé dans une zone non lotie dont elle la seule a exercer son activité, elle est propre et dynamique, elle varie ses repas pour plaire au client, elle met l’accent sur l'accueil et le respect des clients.  Elle veut le prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de riz à 79500 F, du spaghetti à 52 500 F et le reste dans les ingrédients à 18 000 F.L'utilité du prêt c'est de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin renforcer son activité de restauration. elle a déjà reçu le prêt une fois et à rembourser à la bonne date prévue.
texts.en:
Cécile is a 39-year-old married mother to five children. She has been running her own business for seven years. One of the reasons for her restaurant's success is that it is situated in a favourable location where her business is the only one of its kind.

She works efficiently and dynamically. She varies her dishes in order to satisfy her customers and she places an emphasis on welcoming and respecting her patrons.

She is requesting this loan to purchase three bags of rice for 79,500 F, 52,500 F-worth of spaghetti and 18,000 F-worth of other ingredients. This loan will be used to purchase enough supplies to support her restaurant business. She has previously received a loan like this and she paid it back on time.

loans.use: to purchase three bags of rice for 79,500 F, 52,500 F-worth of spaghetti and 18,000 F-worth of other ingredients.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 55 years old and single.

Leonila works hard to provide for herself. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Leonila has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Leonila aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sena Ali Bazda

texts.fr:
Mr SENA ALI BAZDA est marié sans enfant avec 02 personnes en charges.
Mr vends des marchandises diverses  depuis plus de 05 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier  et  environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s’acheter 03 sacs de riz, 02 bidons d’huile, et 01 sac de farine.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir sa boutique. Il ambitionne acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Mr Sena Ali Bazda is married without children and he has two people living in his care. He has been selling various products for over five years. He gets his supplies from his local market and the surrounding area.

With the money he has requested, he plans on purchasing three bags of rice, two containers of oil and one bag of flour. He wants to use the profits from this loan to grow his store. His goal is to be able to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase three bags of rice, two containers of oil and one bag of flour.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 50 years old, married and has five children. One of her children is still studying and needs a daily allowance. Her spouse is a Barangay Official while she is managing a store for income.

Celia sells grocery items to the people in her village. She wanted to improve her profits by selling more merchandise. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, soft drinks, bread and eggs to sell.

This will help improve her sales capacity and her profits as well.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, bread and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 65 years old and married with five children.

Merlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Merlinda has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Merlinda aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Abra Meloria

texts.fr: Abra est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses deux enfants à charge. Agée de 43 ans, Abra est une femme dynamique et courageuse  qui vend du maïs sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile afin de disposer d’une bonne capacité financière. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Abra s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des bols de maïs afin de financer son activité et trouver un bon rendement pour subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et aider son mari à payer les frais scolaire des enfants dès la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en: Abra is a married woman who lives in Adidogomé with her two dependent children. She is 43. Abra is a dynamic and courageous woman who sells corn in a barn in front of her home in order to be financially stable. To reach her objectives, Abra stocks up three times each month at the market and requests this loan to purchase bowls of corn. This is in order to finance her business and obtain a good profit to manage her daily needs and to help her husband to pay the children's school fees at the beginning of the school term.

loans.use: to buy 130 bowls of corn.

loans.name: Keep Moving - N04T6Qthái Group

texts.en:
Hoa is 31 years old and she is married. She is the group leader of "Keep moving - N04T6QThái", which consists of 4 members. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village,

Hoa has operated a food stall, selling fish for 8 years. The market demand is low in her region and the income from this business is unstable because the price and the amount of fish she can catch varies with the weather conditions.

In 2014, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hoa has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. The main hardship that Hoa faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase some fishing equipment for catching more fish.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase some fishing equipment for catching more fish.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Mohammad is 19 years old. He lives in Dier Al-Balah in Gaza Strip with his small family. One year ago he started trading the birds; it’s a good business, but still needs a lot of improvement.

He applied for this youth loan to buy different kinds of birds per customer requests, cages, and food for the birds, which will increase his income, helping him to improve the financial conditions of his family.

Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of birds per customer requests.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a business minded woman who is engaged in a direct selling and a computer shop business. She is 28 years old, married and has two grade-school children. Her husband works abroad as a seaman.

Lorena wants to help her husband to elevate their standard of living even in just a simple way. Lorena thought that by expanding her business, she can offer more services for her custumers and enable her to gain greater profits. With this in mind, Lorena is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy fragrances, lotions, and beauty products. She will also use a portion of the loan for the maintenance of her computer shop business.

In the future, Lorena will succeed with the businesses she has now.

loans.use: to buy fragrances, lotions, and beauty products.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
Jose Angel tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en casa propia en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Jose Angel se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público, cuenta con una mototaxi propia con la cual brinda este servicio, hace 04 años, con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a realizar labores como peón agrícola. El préstamo será para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado. Con esto Jose Angel espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir obtener un mayor nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Angel is 35 years old and lives with his life partner and their two children in their own house. They live in the Pucará district in the province of Jaén which is in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. The people who live here work mostly in farming, raising livestock, and as merchants.

Jose Angel provides a public transportation service and uses his own motorcycle taxi for this purpose. He has been doing this for four years and has very good work and personal references in the area. He also works as a farmhand.

He will use the loan to do repairs and maintenance on his vehicle because it is currently in poor condition. This will allow him to provide better service to his customers resulting in more income and a better quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to perform repairs and maintenance on his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Tupendeze Group

texts.fr: C'est à partir de 1995 jusqu'en 2012 que les membres du groupe ont commencé à pratiquer la riziculture qu'ils ont herité de leurs parents pour subvenir aux besoins de la vie. Ce qui leur plait dans cette activité c'est sa rentabilité. L'insuffisance des moyens des membres du groupe est le problème majeur du groupe; toutefois ils sont confiants qu'avec la régularité de crédits, ils pourront atteindre de meilleurs résultats afin d'améliorer la vie future de leurs familles respectives. Rubeni, président du groupe TUPENDEZE, tient un carnet rose en main sur la photo. Signalons cependant que l'homme en chemise blanche est membre du groupe mais a décliné l'offre en dernière minute et n'a pas reçu de crédit.
texts.en: Beginning in 1995 and until 2012 the members of this group started to work on a rice growing business that they inherited from their parents to provide for their needs. What they like about this business is the profitability. The meagre funds of the members of the group is the major problem, nevertheless, they are confident that with regular loans they could obtain better results in order to improve life in the future for their respective families. Rubeni, who is the president of the Tupendeze group, is holding a pink exercise book in his hand in the photo. It should be noted that the man in the white shirt is a member of the group, but he declined the offer at the last minute and did not receive a loan.

loans.use: to pay for upkeep of the fields and labour costs, to buy fertiliser and phytosanitary products.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 50 years old and single with one daughter. The child is in class two at school. Veronica works very hard to provide for her.

Veronica runs a grocery store and toiletries business in Accra. She is requesting a GHS 4,000 loan through ID-Ghana to buy more groceries and toiletries to sell in her general store.

Veronica has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as chocolate drink, milk, detergent soap, candies, noodles, toiletries, etc.

In the future, Veronica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy chocolate drink, milk, detergent soap, candies, noodles, toiletries, etc. to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman and has been blessed with four kids, who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mwanamisi operates a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Mwanamisi dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase metal sheeting, timber, and nails to replace the roof of his house and, thus, to provide his daughter with a better living standard.

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister, who is in her thirties, is married with three children who are still in school. She has been selling charcoal for three years now. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Felister's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her charcoal stock. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, repay a loan, and cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to resell. She dreams of expanding her business.

Felister will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan's scheduled time.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Mangwa Walimaji Group

texts.fr: Grâce à l'apprentissage reçu de leurs familiers, les membres du groupe MANGWA WALIMAJI ont commencé à cultiver le riz vers les années 2008 et 2013. Le crédit qu'ils auront à recevoir leur permettre d'atténuer petit à petit l'insuffisance de fonds que connaissent leurs activités. Ils souhaitent atteindre de bons résultats dans l'avenir afin d'améliorer la survie de leurs familles et celles des autres en général. Adrien, président du groupe tient un carnet sur photo.
texts.en: Thanks to the apprenticeship that they received from their families, the members of the Mangwa Walimaji group started growing rice around 2008 to 2013. The loan that they request will enable them to diminish little by little the lack of funds that exists in their business. They would like to achieve good results in the future in order to improve their families' existence and that of all of them in general. Adrien, who is the president of the group, is holding an exercise book in the photo.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs for sowing and hoeing, and to buy phytosanitary products.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 49 years of age and she is the mother of five children. Her son owns an electrician's shop in which he sells and repairs electrics such as tube rods, bulbs and energy saver bulbs of various brands. Nowadays, the fuse bulb repair work is going famously well and is profitable in his town. This is the reason he wants to buy fuse bulbs in bulk to repair and then sell at a higher price.

Therefore, Naseem requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son can buy energy saver fuse bulbs in bulk. He will be able to generate the maximum income to afford the household expenses. In addition he wants to buy some extra electrical switches, bulbs, bulb holders and sockets for offering to his customers.

This is her fifth loan with BRAC. She describes her wish to take another loan after repayment of current loan.

She gives thanks to Kiva, Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy energy saver fuse bulbs in bulk for her son to repair and then resell from his electrician's shop.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, en una zona rural del distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la Sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Yolanda se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 6 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Yolanda espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 39 years old and married. She lives with her husband and three children in a rural area of the Pucará district, located in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region in the Sierra north of Perú. The inhabitants of this district work primarily in agriculture, ranching, and commerce.

Yolanda works raising and selling small animals like chickens, hens, ducks, turkeys, and others. Her business is located in her home. She has 6 years of experience in the business and many good personal and professional references in the area. The loan that she is seeking will be used to buy a greater quantity of animals like hens, ducks, turkeys, chickens, and others, as well as the purchase of a balanced diet for them. With this, Yolanda hopes to offer a better product to her clients that will allow her to generate a better income and as a result increase her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is a member of the vulnerable ethnic community of Egyptian Albanians. He resides in a rural area. He is a married father of three, the oldest is 15 and the youngest is 3 years old.

Vladimir has been doing rural activities for the past fifteen years and he also plays musical instruments at events. The loan that he is requesting will be used to buy fodder for his animals. He owns about four dynym of agricultural land (0.4 hectares) and rents about the same from others. He plants wheat, vetch, fodder and corn. From his dairy cow, he makes about $2200 per annum. The income he makes from his profession is about $1900 per annum. Please kindly note that Vladimir and his family are indeed very poor.

loans.use: to buy food for his dairy cow

loans.name: Nagy

texts.en: Nagy is a 32-year-old married man with one daughter, they live in his father's house. He has a small grocery store  and requests 10,000 EGP  to buy a deep freezer, frozen foods, oil, rice and pasta to increase his sales and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer and some frozen products such as fish, vegetables; and oil, rice and pasta.

loans.name: Virgen Maria De Inquilpata Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mariela ella es soltera y tiene 34 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de ganaderia, la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de queso.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Virgin Maria de Inquilpata communal bank. This bank is located in the Anta district, belonging to the Anta province and the Cusco department.

Mariela is single, 34 years old, and has one child. She works in the ranching business. She fattens and raises cattle and later sells them in different fairs. She works from 8:00 A.M. until 6:00 P.M. Through this work she wants to succeed; her dream is to increase the business of selling cattle. She is seeking a loan to buy a cow.

Mariela is the one pasted into the group photo; the photo was taken after the meeting because she asked permission to be late because of her work.

The other members are dedicated to the businesses of selling animals, agriculture, grocery stores, and selling cheese.

She expresses her thanks to those who make up part of this dream through this means and promises to comply with he payments on the established deadlines.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a married woman who has run a beauty parlor for a few years. She does her job passionately and knows the makeup and hair design techniques. She is a well-known beautician in her town. Laila is a responsible woman with two children and works hard to meet their day-to-day expenses.

She has steadily improved her business through the support of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. She has requested a loan to buy lotions, makeup kits, and lightening creams to enhance her inventory. The loan would enable her to cater to a large number of customers efficiently. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to enhance in her own business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali needs the support to achieve his dreams.
He is a 21-year-old simple man who lives with his family in Ramtha. Ali is majoring in drama at the university. He chose this major because he wants to work in this field, be a famous, and become a successful actor.

He plans to graduate from college and start a new life, but faces financial problems. He will use an education loan to pay for university fees and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for university fees and achieve his dreams.

loans.name: Afshan

texts.en:
Afshan is the age of 42; she is a responsible lady who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband has been running a general store where he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well; some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town - that is the reason his business is running well. Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand.

Therefore, Afshan requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc.

Afshan thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her husband's general store

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is 35, married, has two children and takes care of his aging father.

He has a small shop in where he fixes electric devices. He inherited fixing electric devices from his father, thus, he has a lot experience.

He is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy spare parts for modern TVs, fans and satellite cables to expand his project and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for modern TVs, fans and satellite cables.

loans.name: Serengeti Group

texts.en:
Mariamu is in her mid 30s and is married with three children. Two of them are in school and one is still small. She has been a food vendor for seven years now. She works from 06am to 05pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mariamu's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the food stock, and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, and cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in her mamalishe store. She dreams of owning a hotel.

Mariamu will share this loan with her loan group, Serengeti, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in her mamalishe store.

loans.name: Nawaizan

texts.en:
Nawaizan is a 62-year-old woman with two daughters and two sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son is a rickshaw driver by profession. His rickshaw is not working properly because and he is unable to generate an income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible but lacks the money to repair the rickshaw.

Nawaizan has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her pay for the repairs. This will help him to continue his business. Nawaizan is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repairing her son's rickshaw.

loans.name: Bintiali

texts.en:
Bintiali is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity.

Bintiali has operated a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. In addition, she also operates a firewood-selling business.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Selman

texts.en:
Selman and his wife, Fahrie, are the elderly parents of three children. They want to make some basic repairs to their poorly built home. "The roof is leaking, we are elderly, and our bones and joints hurt, especially in the winter," said Fahrie to the loan officer.

Livestock has been their business and income source for 25 years. They sell baby goats, calves and 20 kg of cottage cheese a month. They own about 6 dynym of land to graze the animals. They have a dairy cow, a horse for transportation, and 35 goats.

Selman and Fahrie are in their early retirement years and their pension is $116 a month each.

loans.use: to repair a leaking roof.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 33-year-old single man who lives with mother and 2 siblings. He has a small grocery store and requests 5,000 EGP  to buy  oil, rice, and pasta to increase his sales and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice and pasta.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is a responsible woman with three sons and three daughters, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son runs a general store to sell rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits.

He speaks in a calm manner which wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and manner, he has built up very good relationships with his customers. His general store is famous in the town and his business runs well. Due to good relationships, his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to meet the demand.

Nabeela requested a loan for her son to buy wheat, rice, flour, soaps, shampoo, detergent, and biscuits.

Nabeela thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan. She hopes that her son will utilize the loan in positive way to cope with the demand of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her son's general store

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar sells butane (a flammable hydrocarbon gas that is a constituent of petroleum and is used in bottled form as a fuel) to the locals in her place. She is a 44 year old married woman with six dependents. Her oldest child is 16 and the youngest is 4. Aside from that she also engages in selling rtw(ready-to-wear) clothing, like pants, dresses, shorts, jeans and t-shirts. During her free time, she also sells processed foods like longganisa (sausage) and chorizo (spanish pork sausage).

She has requested a loan to buy stocks of butane, ready-to-wear clothing products and to use as additional capital for food vending. These actions could maintain the flow of her inventory and continue to cater to the needs of her customers. This will enable her to continue to support the needs of her growing children.

Pilar is determined that her sources of income will become successful, combined with her determination and hard work.

loans.use: to buy stocks of butane, ready-to-wear products and additional capital for food vending.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida runs a sari-sari (variety) store to sell seasonings, noodles, powdered soap, fabric conditioner, noodles, cooking oil, eggs, biscuits, soft drinks, and dry goods.

She is a 56-year-old single woman residing in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has run a sari-sari (variety) store for six years.

She also runs a construction firm and sells materials needed in a construction company.

She has requested a loan to buy groceries, soft drinks, assorted canned goods, and items for the construction business. These items will help her to successfully manage her business, pay her obligations, and do some expansion.

She is doing her best to handle her existing business to become sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy groceries, soft drinks, canned goods, and additional items.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatumais, a married woman, has five children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma operates a fuel-selling business, selling firewood from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business. With this Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase a stock of fuel for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of fuel for resale

loans.name: Nyanyo Kpakpa Group

texts.en:
The group is called nyanyo kpakpa (good friend) and will begin their ninth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The group consists of 3 members and is represented by Adjoa. The members have various businesses including selling charcoal, sausage, gizzard, fish, drinks, cooking oil, and toiletry items. The loan will benefit their respective small businesses.

Adjoa is a member of this group and she joined ID-Ghana at the invitation in a promotion the institution did in her area. She has a gizzard and sausage business. She will use the loan to buy gizzards and sausage from wholesalers in Accra city. She will then sell these products to customers in another market.

This work permits her to generate income to support her family of four children. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responds that she likes the training the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy gizzards and sausage.

loans.name: Bihija

texts.en:
Bihijais a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Bihijais faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of business. In addition she also operates a coconut selling business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, two sacks of Irish potatoes and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, two sacks of Irish potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela, 61 years old, is from Martvili district. She is widowed and lives with her 2 children. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 2 cows and a pig. Natela milks the cows every day and produces cheese to sell. In addition, they have a 0.5 hectare plot of agricultural land, where they grow maize.

Natela is a very hardworking woman and wants to improve the living conditions of her family. She has requested a loan for starting up a new business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3500 USD. With the received credit she will open a bakery and she will bake Georgian bread. Natela will increase the family's income and will improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to open a bakery and bake Georgian bread

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 45-year-old woman with two sons and two daughters. She is a housewife and looks after her family. She is well-trained in sewing and provides stitching services through a home-based business.

She needs to purchase a sewing machine, thread, needles, and cloth. These items are very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. Shazia requests a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and  fabric.

loans.name: Durani

texts.en: Durani is a 50 year old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two sons and seven daughters. Her son is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last many years. For many days, Durani's son's rickshaw has not been working properly. He feels that most of its parts are out of order and he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Therefore, Durani has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her son to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Durani is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne, 43 years old, is married and supports 2 children. She has been a small scale farmer for the last 13 years, earning an income of KES 20,000 per month.

Roselyne has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray her crops to improve her production, so as to earn more income. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and to educate her children to higher institutions of learning.

She hopes to improve family health care and living standards.

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray her crops. This will improve her production so as to earn more income.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 31 years old, is married and supports 2 children. She has been a small scale farmer for the last 10 years, earning an income of KES 20,000 per month.

Grace has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray her crops. This will improve her production, so as to earn more income. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and to educate her children to higher institutions of learning.

She hopes to improve family health care and living standards.

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray her crops to improve her production so as to earn more income.

loans.name: Ngambireani

texts.en:
Ngambireani is a married woman. She has two children, both of whom attend school. Ngambireani owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Ngambireani has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mwasiti

texts.en:
Mwasiti is a married woman and has been blessed with four children, three of whom attend school. She and her husband live at their own house that has neither electricity, nor piped water.

Mwasiti has operated a fish selling business for over four years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability, leading to losses.

With the KES 35,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Las amigas”, se formo con la unión de varias amigas y vecinas de Ciudad del Este, son luchadoras y estan poniendo todo de si para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Raquel quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de frutas y verduras que hace saca adelante a su familia. Raquel está poniendo lo mejor de sí para poder sacar adelante a sus seres queridos y que no tengan que atravesar por necesidades como las que ella pasó.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas y verduras frescas para poder venderlas y así ganarse mejores ingresos para sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group named “Las Amigas” (The Friends) resulted from several friends and neighbors from Ciudad del Este who joined together. They are determined and willing to give everything they have to improve their living conditions through the poverty elimination program.

One of the members is Sra. Raquel. Through her effort and continuous work in her business of selling fruits and vegetables, she is able to help her family move forward. Raquel is giving her best effort so that her loved ones can get ahead and avoid the hardships that she experienced.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy fresh fruits and vegetables that she can sell. This will allow her to earn more income for her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 39 year old food kiosk owner at Kilifi Kenya. He is a husband and a father of one. He has been in his business for the last two years doing well.

This is his second time borrowing to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase cooking fat, milk, sugar, beans,r ice and maize. The anticipated profits will be used to repay his loan. He hopes to own a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat, milk, sugar, beans, rice and maize.

loans.name: Bintihassan

texts.en:
Bintihassan is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. Bintihassan faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Alerta Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (Shorly, Erna y Decilia) de la ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio Puerto Cabezas, se unieron hace 3 años, para acceder a financiamiento mediante crédito para mejorar sus pequeños negocios de venta de productos básicos, incrementar sus ingresos y cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hogares, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas.

Shorly: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una señora jovial, con cualidades de líder. Tiene 50 años de edad, casada con 6 hijos mayores de edad el menor de 18 años estudia su primer año de carrera universitaria. Con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar, estudios de sus hijos y tener su propia fuente de ingresos, estableció su pequeño negocio de venta de boly y bastimentos, gracias a los créditos otorgados por Pana Pana y financiados por KIVA le han permitido diversificar sus productos y establecer una pulpería. Solicita financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, chiverías, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con disponer del suficiente capital para establecer una abarrotería.
texts.en:
This solidarity group consists of three female entrepreneurs (Shorly, Erna, and Decilia) from the city of Bilwi and the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They joined together three years ago to access credit financing to improve their small businesses selling commodities, increase their income, and meet basic household needs like ensuring their children receive an education and improving their homes.

Shorly is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is a jovial woman. She is 50 years old, married, and has six children. Her one child under the age of 18 is studying in his first year at the university. In order to contribute to household expenses, the education of her children, and have her own source of income, she has set up a small business selling ice cream and other products. Thanks to loans from Pana Pana funded by Kiva, she has been able to diversify her products and establish a store. She is requesting a loan to purchase grocery items, snacks, and other products. She dreams of having enough capital to establish a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase basic grocery items, snacks, and other products

loans.name: Antorcha Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (Julia, Santa Benita y Nayma) de la ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio Puerto Cabezas, se unieron hace 6 meses, para acceder a financiamiento mediante crédito para ir incrementando sus pequeños negocios de venta de comida y productos básicos, para mejorar sus ingresos y poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hogares, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas.

Santa Benita: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora cordial de 41 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos: 2 adolescentes que estudian su secundaria y un menor de edad de 3 años. Su esposo se dedica actividades agrícolas. Con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos, ha establecido una pequeña pulpería en un tramo que tiene en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Bilwi. Recuerda con gran alegría que inicio vendiendo bolys y helados. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: Chiverías, granos básicos, entre otros productos. Ella sueña en construir su vivienda de concreto, ya que es de mayor durabilidad y seguridad para sus hijos.
texts.en:
This solidarity group consists of three female entrepreneurs (Julia, Santa Benita, and Nayma) from the city of Bilwi and the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They joined together six months ago to access credit financing to increase their small businesses selling food and commodities, to improve their incomes, and to cover the basic needs of their home such as ensuring the education of their children and improve their homes.

Santa Benita is a member of the solidarity group. She is a friendly woman of 41 years. She is married with three children. Two are teenagers studying in high school. The other is less than three years old. Her husband is a agricultural worker. In order to contribute to household expenses and provide education for the children, Santa Benita has established a small grocery store in a sector of a market in the city of Bilwi. She remembers with great joy the times she began selling and frozen treats and ice cream.

She is requesting a loan to buy snack foods, basic grocery items, and other products. She dreams of building a house in particular because it would provide stability and safety for her children.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, basic grocery items, and other products

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married and has three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has owned a food stall business, serving neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

Amina decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business. With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.use: to purchase goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 6 años, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face is pixelated is 29 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has a small store that she has managed out of her home for the past six years. She has many customers because of the variety of products that she offers. With the income she earns, she is able to cover some of her household expenses. The borrower is a single mother who lives in her own home along with her child.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snack foods, sweet bread, and other items. This will enable her to generate more income so that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snack foods, sweet bread, and other items.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
For the last ten years, Regina has been engaged in fishing. She has sold fish and crabs to the locals in her place.

Regina is married and has four children. Her oldest child is 17 and the youngest is 10 years old. Her husband is also a fisherman. She decided to take a loan to finance her fishing business.
Together with her family, she lives in Talibon, Bohol.

With the availability of the materials needed, she could improve his husband's catch and also she could sell more volumes of fish and crab as well. She could provide her family with nutritious diets and finance her children's schooling. She has requested a loan to buy crab traps, and gasoline (motor boat's fuel).

In the future, she would like to expand her fishing business to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy crab traps and gasoline (motor boat's fuel).

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson 43 years old. He is married and supports three children. He has been a small-scale farmer for the last 10 years, earning an income of KES 10,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow, given he has prepared enough fields of Napier grass, so as to start a business of supplying milk for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and educate his children to higher learning institutions. He hopes to improve his family's health care and living standards.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and start a business of supplying milk for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray her crops to improve her production so as to earn more income.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat, 39 years old, is married and supports 3 children. He has been a small scale farmer for the last 10 years, earning an income of KES 15,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray his crops. This will improve his production so as to earn more income.

Josephat plans to use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and to educate his children to higher institutions of learning.

He hopes to improve his family's health care and living standards.

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray his crops to improve his production so as to earn more income.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes sales business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and also to passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

Fatuma decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan of KES 50,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Sompopo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres luchadoras que se integraron hace 2 meses, para gestionar  financiamiento mediante créditos con garantía solidaria, para comprar mercadería para sus pequeños negocios y de esa manera vender más y mejorar sus ingresos. Todas ellas quieren lograr mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas.

REMALIN: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una señora amable, con cualidades de líder. Tiene 30 años de edad, madre soltera de 3 hijos: 2 adolescentes que estudian su primaria y un pequeño de 3 años de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos, elabora frito de pollo, enchiladas. Solicita financiamiento para comprar ingredientes e insumos: repollo, vinagre, sal, pepino, tomate, pollo, aceite, arroz, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is composed of thee hardworking women who joined together two months ago to obtain financing through group loans to buy merchandise for their small businesses to sell more products and increase their income. They all want to achieve an improvement in their living conditions, to meet basic needs, ensure the education of their children, and improve their homes.

Remalin is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is a kind woman with leadership qualities. She is 30 years old and is the single mother of 3 children. Two are adolescents in primary school and one is a little three-year-old. In order to raise her children, she prepared fried chicken enchiladas. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients and supplies like cabbage, vinegar, salt, cucumbers, tomatoes, chicken, oil, rice, and other products. She dreams of establishing a store.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies like cabbage, vinegar, salt, cucumbers, tomatoes, chicken, cooking oil, rice, and other products

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is 39 years old, married and has 2 children.

Hanaa has a beauty salon and dress rental business. She is requesting an EGP 10,000 loan to buy modern dresses and makeup for her salon.

loans.use: To buy modern dresses and makeup for her salon.

loans.name: Sobhi

texts.en: Sobhi is 42 years old, married, and has three children. He has a small grocery store project, and he previously requested a 5,000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on its due date. He is requesting another loan (10,000 EGP) to buy a freezer for ice cream and some grocery products such as oil, rice and pasta.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for ice cream and some grocery products such as oil, rice and pasta.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is a 39-year-old married woman. She lives in the Ozurgeti district with her husband and son. The family owns a plot of agricultural land, where they grow mandarins and maize. They sell the harvest locally. Tea decided to start a trading business in order to increase the family income.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 4,000 GEL. With the received credit. she will purchase a stock of nuts and will resell at a higher price in order to increase her family income. Tea hopes that the business will be profitable and awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading in nuts

loans.name: Los Tromes Group

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal LOS TROMES, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
El socio Jorge continua dedicándose al  negocio de venta de  materiales de construcción como ladrillos entre otros, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales ,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de ladrillos entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de materiales de construcción.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Jorge belongs to the Los Tromes communal bank, located in Cusco province. He continues to make a living with his business selling construction materials including bricks and other items. He is a responsible and hard-working person. He has been in this business, which gives him a feeling of personal fulfillment, for a good while. This is how he supports his family.

Jorge is requesting a loan to purchase bricks and other items. He is grateful for the offered loan and promises to make his loan repayments on time. The other members work selling construction materials.

The group members who appear in the photos that are attached to the group photo took the photos after the meeting due to work reasons.

loans.use: to buy bricks and other items.

loans.name: Obed

texts.en:
Obed is a 26-year-old married man with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a hardworking man for his growing young family trading in agricultural produce for now many years. 

He obtained capital from growing maize, beans and Irish potatoes on a commercial basis. He has a challenge of inadequate capital to meet the demand for his customers and high transport costs since feeder roads are impassable during the rainy season. He has a personal goal of buying a motorcycle to ease transport and educating his children as well as a business goal of expanding his business into new markets. 

Obed wants a loan to buy more groundnuts for selling.

loans.use: to buy more groundnuts for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tea leaves from farmers and sell to the factory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Las Prosperas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo “Las Prosperas” está emprendiendo su segundo ciclo. La mayoría de los socios se conocen entre sí y son responsables. Este es el segundo crédito que tiene la Sra Dina de 43 años de edad, soltera con tres hijos, dos de ellos son independientes y uno que estudia en el colegio. La Sra Dina se dedica hace dos años a la venta de abarrotes en un pequeño espacio de su vivienda todos los días y paralelo a este negocio también vende productos de bellezas  de catálogos, con el mérito de salir adelante y así poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y los estudios de su hijo. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la Sra Dina ha logrado mejorar su vivienda. Una de las metas de la Sra Dina es tener una moto lineal para poder trasladarse con facilidad. Solicito el crédito para  comprar mercadería de abarrotes de primera necesidad  (arroz, leche, azúcar, fideos y aceite). La Sra Dina es la persona que viste polo de color anaranjado.
Se siente muy contenta con el apoyo que está recibiendo por parte de los inversionistas de KIVA y desea que el apoyo siga continuando.
texts.en:
"Las Prosperas" Group is in its second loan cycle. Its members are responsible, and the majority of them know each other. 

This is Dina's second loan. She is 43 years old, is single, and has three children. One of them goes to school, and the other two are independent.

With the purpose of covering her household expenses and paying for her child's education, Dina set up a small store at her home, where she has been selling groceries every day for two years now. She also sells beauty products through catalogues. 

As a result of her hard work, Dina has been able to make some home improvements. One of her goals is to own a motorbike so that she can go from one place to another with ease.

She is requesting this loan to buy basic-needs goods such as rice, milk, sugar, noodles, and oil.

In the photo, Dina is wearing an orange T-shirt.

She is very happy for the support that she is receiving from Kiva lenders and hopes that they continue to provide their support.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as rice, milk, sugar, noodles, and oil.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is married and works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more merchandise to sell in her store. Fe would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Tomas
