texts.es: Don Tomas de 66 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica desde hace 30 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, cuando ya está su cosecha la almacena en los graneros que muestra en la fotografia para luego comercializar los productos en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Don Tomas is 66 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife and daughter. He has been farming for 30 years by planting corn and sorghum. When his crops are harvested, they are stored in granaries like the one shown in the photograph before being sold in the neighboring towns where he has many established customers.

Tomas is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, and other supplies so that he can continue to cultivate his crops. This is his only source of work, so the loan will help him to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 30 and single and has an upholstery cloth project. He is requesting 8,000 EGP to buy modern and varied cloth materials to expand his project.

loans.use: to buy modern and varied cloth materials.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 35 years old, married and lives in Caticugan, Siquijor in the Philippines. She operates a sari-sari, or small general store, where she earns an income that sufficiently helps support her family.


Roselyn is a full-fledged member of Kiva's field partner PMPC and has taken out several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing with no records of default. She has now applied for a 10,000 PHP loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.


Roselyn continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en: Vladimir is a happily married man; he makes and sells cheese with his wife. Vladimir learned about the cheese business when he was a kid. He goes to many places to sell his cheese. Vladimir needs a loan to buy a dairy cow. He hopes you can help him because the competition is very hard so he wants to increase his milk production.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is thanking Kiva and CCT for their spiritual and financial support they have extended to her. Her previous loan which she has fully paid has helped sustain her store and thus covered their daily sustenance.

She is again humbly asking for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has helped fund her family's basic needs for the past seven years. Although there are days that her sales are slow she maintains her positive attitude and perseverance that they can get through in life.

Rosalia does not lose hope that one day she will own a big grocery store. Her precious dream is to see both of her children go to College. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Yola

texts.en:
Yola, who has her own house, lives with her daughter. Yola sells milk, a business she learned about when she was very young 

Yola needs a loan to buy a milking cow to increase her milk production. She is a widow; she is alone, so she hopes that you can help her.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela tiene 28 años es una joven puntarenense con increíbles deseos de superación, que no la han hecho desfallecer de su objetivo, el cual es graduarse de la Universidad, en donde estudia Ciencias de la Educación con énfasis en Orientación Educativa, cursando el 3 año, quedándole 7 materias para obtener el grado de Bachiller. La inversión es para retomar la actividad comercial, vender ropa, de mujer, hombre y niño, para completar sus gastos de estudio y lograr terminar su carrera, además de fortalecer  su negocio, como un aporte para los ingresos del hogar.

Su comercio se basa en pedidos,  para tener la seguridad de tener los artículos colocados, se cobra por quincena, se cuenta con una cartera de cerca de 40 clientes distribuidos en el la zona de residencia y sectores aledaños, a la comunidad de Puntarenas, extendiendo su rango de acción hasta la Isla Chira. La cantidad de clientes va a aumentar al contar con el capital para ofrecer artículos de moda, gracias a los contactos comerciales que tiene y que dan buena referencia de la solicitante. Su margen de ganancia es del 100%, indica que no le gusta vender muy caro y así mantener a sus clientes conformes. Se aprovechan ofertas y descuentos y se dan plazos accesibles a los clientes. Aprovechado los viajes a la U para adquirir la mercadería o llevar pedidos especiales.
Mariela se presenta como una persona trabajadora, desde los 18 años inicia en el comercio con deseos de superación, capacitación y conocimiento del negocio muy buena. Es buena comerciante y negociadora.
texts.en:
Mariela is a 28-year-old from Puntarenas with a very strong desire to improve herself, and she has not been deterred from her goal of graduating from the university. She is studying Education with an emphasis on Educational Guidance and is in her third year with 7 more courses to take before earning her degree.

The investment is so she can resume her business of selling men's, women's and children's clothing so she can earn money to pay for her studies and finish her degree. The money will also strengthen her business and allow her to contribute to the household income.

Her business is based on orders. To be sure she has product on hand, she collects payment from her customers twice a month. She has nearly 40 customers throughout her neighborhood and the surrounding area of Puntarenas, extending her range to the Isle of Chira. The number of customers will increase once she has the funds to invest in stylish articles, thanks to the business contacts she has who give this applicant good references.

Her profit margin is 100% indicating that she doesn't like to sell at a high price, and that way she keeps her customers. She takes advantage of sales and discounts and offers convenient payment terms to her customers. She take advantage of her trips to the university to acquire merchandise or to pick up special orders.

Mariela is a hard-working person who, from the age of 18 started her business with a good sense of business and a desire to improve herself and get training. She is a good businesswoman and negotiator.

loans.use: to buy men's, women's, and children's clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to re-stock his shop with salt, sugar and soap for selling.

loans.name: Channa Group

texts.en: In the picture, Channa took this photo with her group member. Channa is a 53 years old, a rice farmer and married woman. Channa is pictured 1st from the left, and she has been a farmer since 1985. Her husband is 51 years old, he makes bamboo baskets and small bamboo houses for sale and rice farmer as well.  All of them lives in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodian. Together, they can earn approximately $3 per day. Channa, a group leader, would like to request a loan as a group of five members and she will use her portion to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides for farming in the dry season. This loan helps her increase her income as well as her family's standard of living. In the future, she hopes that she can do farming both in dry and rainy seasons more than two times per year, and save money to build a new toilet.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides for farming in the dry season

loans.name: Ley Group

texts.en: Ley is a 45-year-old married rice farmer with six children in her care who lives in a Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Ley is pictured 3rd from the left and cultivated rice since 1991. Her husband is a 71-year-old rice farmer and doctor in a village as well. Ley and her husband can make approximately USD 3 per day. Ley a group leader, would like to request a loan as a group of four members and Ley is now requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for rice farming. With this loan, she will be able to gain better rice crops to sell, thereby improving the family’s finances. In the future, she is going to save money to buy more farmland to cultivate rice, renovate her house and support her children to earn high diplomas.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for rice farming

loans.name: Aun Group

texts.en: Aun is a 41-year-old married rice farmer with two children one of whom is a factory worker and the other attends school. She resides in the Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 1994. Her husband is a 44-year-old carpenter running a wooden traditional handicrafts business since 2000. Together, they can earn approximately USD5 per day. Aun is pictured 1st from the left, as group leader, would like to request a loan as a group of four members and she will use her portion to buy materials to make the wood handicraft business.  With this loan can help her and her family to improve her income as well as her family’s standard of living. In the future, she wants to expand her husband’s business, renovate a proper house and support her youngest child to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy materials for her traditional wooden handicrafts business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 53 years old. She lives with her child. Rebecca has 19 years experience selling cow legs. She buys cow legs from the main market and sells to customers in another market. In this manner she brings in income to help her get ahead and pay for her child university education.

The money from the loan will be utilized to buy more cow legs which she will sell to customers. Her dreams are to pay off the loan and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more cow legs which she will sell to customers.

loans.name: Domingo Ernesto

texts.es: Domingo tiene 19 años de edad es el un joven que siempre demuestra su espíritu de superación actualmente vive con su madre él está muy agradecido con ella por haberle enseñado por haberle dado apoyo incondicional cuando el más lo necesitaba por eso el ahora se puede defender en la vida. El se dedica a prestar sus servicios como jornalero desde hace 10 años lo que le permite llevar el sustento al hogar. Domingo desea cambiar las láminas del techo de su vivienda ya que las que tiene por el momento ya están deterioradas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: laminas, madera y clavos para tener otra mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Domingo, 19, is a young man who always shows a spirit of self-improvement. Currently he lives with his mother. He's very grateful to her for having shown him unconditional support when he most needed it. That's why now he's able to hold his own in life.

He has earned a living providing his services as a day laborer for 10 years, which allows him to support the household.

Domingo wants to change the metal roofing on his house because currently it's deteriorated. He's asking FUSAI for a loan to buy metal roofing, wood, and nails so he has a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy metal roofing, wood, and nails to have a better quality of life

loans.name: Verano Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario VERANO está conformado por 3 mujeres (Yaili Ninoska, Ina y Laura), todas son indígenas  miskitas de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que  venden ropa usada y productos básicos, con cuyos ingresos aportan para las necesidades básicas de sus hogares. Se organizaron hace 3 años para acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario verano, porque cuando se integraron fue en dicha época.  

Laura: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer luchadora, madre soltera de 8 hijos mayores de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos y tener su propia fuente de ingresos ha establecido una pequeña pulpería. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, chiverías, entre otros productos. Sueña con vender ropa usada.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "Verano" is made up of three women (Yaili Ninoska, Ina and Laura). All are of the indigenous miskitas group from the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are hardworking women who sell used clothing and basic products and who, with their incomes, contribute to take care of their basic household needs. Three years ago, they got together to receive a solidarity group-secured loan from Pana Pana. They decided to name their solidarity group "verano" (summer) because it was in that season that they joined.

Laura is a member of the solidarity group. She is a fighter and a single mother to 8 adult children. With the goal of providing for her children and to have her own source of income, she has established a small grocery story. She is asking for a loan to buy products including basic grains and dairy products. She dreams of selling used clothing.

loans.use: to buy products including basic food staples and dairy products.

loans.name: Hope Christian School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is David. He is the Director of Hope Christian High School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Lugazi with 750 students. Hope Christian School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Hope Christian School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. David ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Pheng's Group

texts.en:
Pheng’s Group lives in a rural village in Kampon Speu province in Cambodia.

Pheng makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a farm laborer to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yehia

texts.en: Yehia is 36, married to a housewife, and has six children. He has a small grocery project and is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy vegetables such as potatoes, zucchini and cucumber to generate a constant income for his family and afford a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as potatoes, zucchini and cucumber.

loans.name: Veth

texts.en:
Veth, pictured holding her niece, is 31 years old. She is married, and the family lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has five children, four of whom go to school, and has worked in a factory since 2012. Her husband, 35, sells brooms with the help of one of the children. Together, Veth and her husband can earn approximately 23 USD a day.

Veth is requesting a 1500 USD loan through Kiva's field partner KREDIT to buy a trailer for her husband to sell brooms. Future plans are to expand her husband’s business, renovate her house and send her children to university.

loans.use: to buy a trailer for her husband to sell brooms

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
She wants to make sure to provide her children with the best education! This is Claudine, a 43-year-old married mother of four children whose main aim is to provide her children with the best education to make sure that they can benefit from better future opportunities.

Three years ago, Claudine opened her small convenience store to support her husband in covering their family's increasing living expenses. Today, her business is going fine but not well enough to meet her family's increasing needs. So, Claudine is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

Claudine hopes that in the future she can develop and expand her business either through moving to another region or to a bigger place.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Devi Akou

texts.fr: Akou est une femme mariée âgée de 48 ans qui vit à Adidogoé. Mère de quatre enfants, Akou est une revendeuse de charbon de bois et  du maïs qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile pour atteindre son but. Pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois, Akou nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de faire face aux différents problèmes qu’elle éprouve quotidiennement.
texts.en:
Akou is a married, 48-year-old woman who lives in Adidogoé.

Mother of four children, Akou resells charcoal and corn that she sources two times a month from the market. She resells them from the front window of her home in order to reach her goal.

To order the charcoal, Akou needs these funds to pay for the supply and make a good profit margin. Then she can deal with various problems that she faces daily.

loans.use: to buy eight bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Celso

texts.es: Celso es una persona de 72 años de edad de estado civil casado con 7 hijos se dedica a la agricultura prooduciendo cacao, cafe, guineo tambien crian cerdos  y el dinero sera utilizado para comprar alimentos y vitaminas para los cerdos el sueño de celso es mejorar la raza de los cerdos y en sus tiempos libres le gusta descansar
texts.en: Celso is 72-years old.  He is married and has seven children.  Celso makes his living in agriculture.  He produces cacao, coffee and bananas.  He also raises pigs.  The money from the loan will be used to purchase feed and vitamins for his pigs.  Celso's dream is to improve his breed of pigs.  He likes to use his free time to rest.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucía tiene como negocio cultivar granos básicos, específicamente maíz y frijol, ella tiene 54 años de edad, vive con una hija de 25 años de edad, su esposo está en el extranjero, la siembra de sus cultivos la realiza en una manzana y media de terreno, cuenta con 40 años de experiencia en el negocio, el oficio lo aprendió de su padre y su esposo, trabaja a tiempo completo.
Se decidió por un crédito para poder comprar fertilizantes, semilla de maíz y frijol, así aumentara la producción de granos básicos para la alimentación de su familia y para vender, además generará ingresos para cubrir otras necesidades como medicamentos, ropa y educación.
Los sueños de Lucía son remodelar su vivienda para compartir un espacio más digno con su familia.
texts.en:
Lucía has a business of cultivating basic grains, specifically corn and beans. She is 54 years old and lives with her 25 year old daughter. Her husband is living abroad. The crops are grown in one and a half blocks of land. She has 40 years of experience and learned the trade from her father and her husband. She works full-time.
She is requesting a loan to be able to buy fertilizer and seeds for corn and beans. In this way she will increase her production of basic grains to feed her family and to sell, as well as generate income to cover other necessities, such as medicine, clothing and education.
Lucía's dreams are of remodelling her home to share a more dignified space with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for corn and beans in order to increase her production of basic grains to feed her family and to sell.

loans.name: Kanga

texts.en:
Kanga is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school; the other one is still too young to attend school. She lives at her house, which  has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past five years, selling goat meat to the neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

Kanga decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats to slaughter for meat to sell.

loans.use: to purchase goats to slaughter for meat to sell

loans.name: Solange

texts.fr: Agée de 40 ans, Solange est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants vivant ensemble à Adidogomé. Pour soutenir sa famille, Solange vend des mèches dans son salon de coiffure en s’approvisionnant une fois par mois au marché. Solange réalise sa rentabilité dans son activité et pour bien satisfaire aux besoins de ses clients, Solange  désire ce prêt pour commander des mèches afin d’agrandir son stock et aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et à couvrir les besoins quotidiens de la famille.
texts.en:
Solange is a 40-year-old, married woman. She is the mother of two children living together in Adidogomé.

To support the family, Solange sells hair extensions in her salon. She purchases supplies once a month at the market.

Solange makes a profit from her business. To satisfy the needs of her customers, Solange is asking for this loan to order hair extensions in order to increase her stock and to help her children with their education and cover the daily needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy three dozen hair extensions.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en: Cipriana is a married woman. She is the owner of her house and she does her best to live well. Cipriana sells milk. She has been in this business since she was a child so she has a lot of experience. Cipriana's husband works as a teacher but he helps her with the farm when he has time  Cipriana needs a loan to buy a milking cow. She hopes you can trust her.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La socia Mery se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de boletos turísticos a las diferentes personas del extranjero y también personas nacionales,la socia por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener una agencia de viajes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar boletos turísticos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Mery continues to work in the business of selling tour tickets to different people from abroad as well as to nationals. Through this business the member has been able to provide for her family.
The member's dream is to have a travel agency.
The member is requesting the loan to buy tourist tickets.
The member is happy about the loan and promises to complete all the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tour tickets.

loans.name: Familia De Jesús Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está integrado por personas muy trabajadoras quienes se sienten especialmente orgullosas por pertenecer a una comunidad con raíces de la cultura mazahua. Aunque la mayor parte del tiempo los habitantes se encuentren laborando cuando tienen tiempo de celebrar alguna festividad lo hacen llenos de alegría y amistad. 
   Doña Rosa es una mujer muy entusiasta, trabajadora y alegre, su comunidad le parece un lugar hermoso por la gran vegetación que crece a sus alrededores. Desde hace un año se decidió a criar ganado, en gran medida motivada por el apoyo que recibió por parte de VF México pues comenta "cuando adquirí el préstamo inmediatamente inicié con mi negocio y por eso estoy muy agradecida con la institución pues confiaron en mí y mi trabajo".
   Los animales son adquiridos dentro de su misma comunidad lo que fomenta el crecimiento económico de la región. Posteriormente, cuando alcanzan un desarrollo ideal, los vende a las carnicerías o gente dedicada al negocio de alimentos. Hace sólo algunos días vendió dos ejemplares cuyas ganancias fueron destinadas para solventar gastos escolares de sus dos hijos quienes iniciaron un nuevo ciclo escolar.
   Ahora con este préstamo comprará alimento procesado, maíz y zacate para los cinco becerros que tiene en casa. Uno de sus más grandes sueños es incrementar la cantidad de cabezas que cría en sus corrales para poder terminar de construir su casa; "mis hijos son el motor que tengo para salir adelante" agregó Rosa quien desea que sus hijos puedan terminar una carrera profesional.
Los demás integrantes del grupo son Alberto quien invertirá en una ferretería; Rubén, en ropa y Don Lorenzo, en borregos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras debajo del quiosco municipal.
texts.en:
This group is made up of hardworking people who are especially proud to be part of a community with roots in the mazahua culture. Although most of the time the residents are working, when they have time to celebrate a special occasion they do so full of happiness and friendship.

Rosa is an enthusiastic, hardworking and happy woman. She thinks her community is beautiful because of the vegetation that grows all around. A year ago she decided to raise livestock, in large part motivated by the support she received from VF Mexico. She says, "When I received the loan I immediately began my business and for that I am very grateful to the institution for believing in me and my work."

She purchases the animals in her community which allows for economic growth in the region. Subsequently, when they have sufficiently grown, she sells them to butcher shops or people who work in the food business. Just a few days ago, she sold two exemplary animals. She used the profit she made to pay for the school expenses of her two children who started a new school year.

Now, with this loan, she will buy processed feed, corn and hay for the five calves that she has at her house. One of her greatest dreams is to increase the number of animals she raises in her pens in order to finish building her house. "My children are the motivation I have to get ahead," added Rosa, who hopes that her children will be able to achieve professional careers.

The other members of the group are Alberto, who will invest in a hardware store, Ruben, in clothing, and Lorenzo, in sheep.

*The photo was taken on the stairs below the municipal kiosk.

loans.use: to buy feed, corn, and hay.

location.town: Santa Cruz Mextepec, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Elena Hermida

texts.es:
Elena tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de fruta, como tumbos, guabas, maracuyás, desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de variedad de frutas y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Elena is 49 years old, in a common law marriage with three children. She lives with her family in the district of Oyotún. The people there work in agriculture, business and cattle raising. It is located two hours from the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, on the norther coast of Perú.

Elena makes her living selling fruit, such as tumbo, guava and passion fruit. For many years her business has been located in her home.

She seeks a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternative to buy a larger quantity of fruits, in order to generate increased income for her family.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity and variety of fruits

loans.name: Pastor

texts.en: Pastor is 57 years old. He is the father of three adult sons.  Pastor works as a taxi driver and he needs a loan to pay the maintenance on his car. Pastor learned to drive when he was a teenager so he knows what he is doing.  Pastor hopes you can help him because his sons have their own expenses.  At least Pastor is the owner of his vehicle.

loans.use: to pay the maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Timur

texts.en:
“Education is one thing that someone can’t take away. Advancing yourself and obtaining an education allow you not to be ignorant or manipulated by wrongdoers of this world. I have many family members who did not receive higher education once they graduated high school. Looking back, as a child through the years I have witnessed them being taken disadvantage of, due to the lack of education and knowledge of the situation they were in. I promised myself I was not going to be put in such a hard situation. 

My family’s main income source is a small eatery where people come to have a cheap lunch. Another thing is that my family lives in another region, where summer is the only good season for sales. Having paid for taxes, food, transportation and medicine, there is still not enough money for post-secondary education. Therefore, the question of paying for my higher education goes by the wayside. My parents have done everything possible for me that they could, but now they are weak to pay the full tuition by themselves. I had an idea to find a job, but I understand well that there aren’t well-paid jobs for students in our country, and if working, I shall pay less attention to education, which makes no sense.

So I find a Kiva loan as a good way to go forward, as it is interest free for AUCA students and I am sure that I will be able to repay it after graduation, as the graduates of this prestigious university work in the field of their specialization and use the knowledge gained here in a proper way. I will try to study hard and be one of them.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education at AUCA

loans.name: Kashaka Girls School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Bosco. He is the Deputy Head teacher of Kashaka Girls Secondary School, a girls school in the rural area of Kashaka in Mbarara with 850 students. Kashaka Girls School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1,000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Kashaka Girls School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Bosco ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for the students

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is 78 years old. She is a widow who has a son. She is a retired person with a retirement payment. She needs a loan to fix up the stairs at the house where she lives because they are in bad shape and that is dangerous not only for her. Gladys is the mother of one adult son and he helps her a lot so you can trust Gladys.

loans.use: to fix the stairs at the house where she lives.

loans.name: Aleyda Marilu

texts.es:
Aleyda está satisfecha por tener un negocio más rentable con ayuda del crédito anterior, su estilo de vida es más digno y aporta más ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
Requiere de un nuevo crédito para que su negocio mantenga la continuidad, comprara verduras, gallinas indias, maíz etc., para preparar la venta de antojitos y tamales, espera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y su buena calificación crediticia.
texts.en:
Aleyda is pleased to have a more profitable business with the help of the previous loan. Her lifestyle is more dignified and provides more income to cover the costs of her home.
She requires a new loan to maintain her business. She will buy vegetables, chickens, corn, etc. in order to prepare antojitos and tamales to sell. She hopes to keep her customers satisfied and have a good credit rating.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, chickens, corn, etc. in order to prepare antojitos and tamales to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is 75 years old. She works as a hairdresser and she needs another loan to buy perm solution, dyes, and creams for her beauty salon. Nelly is a married woman and she likes to go to her beauty salon because she can talk with a lot of people and that distracts her. Nelly is not thinking about retirement because she is very skilfull with hairdressing so she hopes you can help her again

loans.use: to buy perm solution, dyes, and creams for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.en: Yenny and her boyfriend make jackets.  They have a workshop and she needs a loan to buy an overlock machine that will be very helpful for her.  Yenny would like a bigger workshop in the future. She also would like to increase her production of jackets. Yenny is the mother of one kid.

loans.use: to purchase another  overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es:
La socia Eleuteria  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant y ampliar el negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Eleuteria, continues to work in her business of selling food. Through this business the member provides for her family.
The member's dream is to have a restaurant and to expand her business of selling food.
The member is requesting the loan to buy chicken, vegetables, rice and beef.
The member is happy about the loan and promises to complete all of the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chicken, vegetables, rice and beef.

loans.name: Jose Juan

texts.es:
Jose Juan tiene 36 años de edad, es soltero no tiene hijos, vive juntamente con sus padres en casa de material rústico dos pisos en la parte rural del caserio Lanchepata Distrito Santo Tomas, lugar donde vive es una comunidad pequeña dedicada basicamente a la agricultura y ganaderia, su población es progresista se dedicada al café, caña de azúcar, productos de pan llevar, menestras, crianza de aniamales menores y otos, ubicada en la provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú. Su vivienda cuenta con el serviicio de agua.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café variedad catimor, a la fecha de la visita tiene 2 has en producción de tres y cuatro años de edad, cultivo que desarrolla hace 4 años en terreno propio en el Caserio Lanchepata Distrito Santo Tomas. Tambien cultiva caña de azúcar para elaboración de chancaca para su consumo, cultivo que lo realiza hace más de 10 años.Jose Juan a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa para mantenimiento de su cultivos de 1.5 hectareas de las 2 de café que tiene en producción y de esta manera asegurara la campaña 2016 con una mejor producción, aumentará su niveles de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose Juan is 36 years old. He is single and has no children. He lives with his parents in a house of rustic material and two floors in the village Lanchepata, Santo Tomas district. The place where he lives is a small community dedicated mainly to agriculture and animal husbandry. Its population is progressive, working in coffee, sugarcane, bread products, cereals, raising small animals and other things. It is located in the province of Cutervo, belonging to the region of Cajamarca, northern mountains of Peru. His house has water service. He works in agriculture, specially cultivating "catimor" variety coffee. Up to date he has 2 hectares of production of three and four years of age. He has developed these crops for 4 years in his own land in the village of Lanchepata, Santo Tomas district. He also grows sugarcane to make molasses for his consumption, which he has cultivated for more than 10 years. Jose Juan has requested a loan to Edpyme Alternativa to give maintenance to 1.5 hectares from the 2 coffee hectares he has in production. In this way he will assure his 2016 campaign with better production, will increase his level of income, and in this way improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to give maintenance to his coffee crops.

loans.name: Paolo

texts.en:
Paolo is a single man. He doesn't have children. He lives at his parents' house, and he helps them with the expenses.

Paolo works and he is going to college. He is studying tourism. He needs a loan to pay his college tuition.

Paolo works hard, and he is making big efforts to be a good student. He hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to pay his college tuition.

loans.name: Sherill

texts.en:
Her name is Sherill, aged 38, from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Being a widow has been her biggest challenge in life, but she is facing it with courage and faith in God that she can raise her children well.

She is thankful that her small general store, which sells basic food and household items, is a great help to meet her and her children's daily needs. As she learned about Kiva and CCT, which extends spiritual and financial support, she is now humbly asking for assistance of a PHP 19,000 loan. She will use the loan to fill her store with grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, sugar, eggs, coffee, powdered milk, chocolate, beverages, and toiletries to improve her sales and thus increase her income. She is thanking you in advance for supporting her livelihood.

Sherill, like most mini-general store owners, dreams to have a big grocery store someday to be able to send her children to college. She faithfully meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is aged 32 and owns a pharmacy shop in Hoima, Uganda where she has managed to earn her income. She also earns additional income from farming in order to support her family.

Grace hopes to grow her business and educate her children, though she has the challenge of few customers since people opt to go to hospitals that offer free medical care.

Grace will use the loan to buy more drugs to sell. She used her previous loan to buy more drugs to sell, and she managed to make some profit.

loans.use: to buy more drugs to sell.

loans.name: Gaber

texts.en:
Gaber is 52, married, has 5 children, and takes care of his aging parents.

Gaber has a livestock fattening business and is requesting a 6,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to increase his sales of milk, cheese, and butter which his wife and daughter sell in the local market.

Gaber believes the loan will allow him to generate a constant income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Ngome Group

texts.en:
Subira is in her late thirties and is single, with one child who is still schooling. She has been a food vendor for two years now. She works from 5:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Subira's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep increasing the food stock, and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, and cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in her food store. She dreams of owning a charcoal business.

Subira will share this loan with her loan group, Mgome, which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in her food store.

loans.name: Gloria Marina

texts.es: Gloria, de 44 años de edad vive con sus dos hijas de 15 y 7 años de edad su vivienda es propia, es una mujer muy luchadora a pesar de la falta del padre de sus hijas a ellas jamás le ha faltado nada, ella siempre ha luchado por darles lo necesario  y sacarlos adelante. Ella se dedica a la venta de medicina dicha actividad la realiza recorriendo las calles de su localidad ella tiene muchos clientes que adquieren sus productos por ser de buena calidad y le han pedidos ella se levanta desde muy temprano para dejar hecho los quehaceres del hogar y nuevamente salir a ganarse la vida. Ella está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: vitaminas, jabones naturales, ungüentos etc. y así mejorar las ganancias de su negocio y brindar más variedad a sus clientes de esta manera mejorar aún más la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria is 44 years old and lives with her two daughters who are 15 and 7 years old in her own house. She is a very determined woman, and despite her daughters' father not being present, they have never lacked anything. She has always strived to give them what they needed and to provide for them.
She works selling medicine, which she does walking through the streets of her town. She has many customers who buy her products because they are of good quality and they have requested them.
She wakes up very early in the morning to finish the household chores before going out to earn her living.
She is requesting the loan from FUSAI to invest in vitamins, natural soaps, ointments, etc. and in this way improve the earnings from her business and provide a greater variety of products to her customers. In this way she will be able to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to invest in vitamins, natural soaps, ointments, etc. to improve her business.

loans.name: Mkuza Group

texts.en:
Tausi is in her 50's and is married with one grown child. She has been selling second hand clothing for 6 years now. She works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to earn a fair monthly profit.

This will be Tausi's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy first class second hand clothing to meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of being an international business woman.

Tausi will share this loan with her loan group Mkuza which consists of 3 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy first class second hand clothing to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Juntos Podemos Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JUNTOS PODEMOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
 La socia es la Sra. Hilda, la socia continua con su negocio de librería, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo sus útiles de escritorio como cuadernos, libros, lapiceros y borradores, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez continua trabajando como cosmetóloga siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de cuadernos, lapiceros, plumones entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito y  a quienes forman parte de este sueño  y se comprometen  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “Juntos Podemos” communal bank. It is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Hilda who continues with her business, a stationary store. She is responsible and determined. She continues to sell her office supplies like notebooks, books, pencils and erasers. She has run the business for quite some time and things are going well thanks to the determination she puts into her work each day. At the same time she continues to work as a cosmetologist as this is the way she gets her family ahead.

Hilda is requesting the loan to buy notebooks, pens and markers amongst others.

The members as a group are grateful for the loan and those who form part of this dream. They promise to comply with the installments payment in the established time.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, markers, etc.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina lives in the town of Valencia, Bohol. She is married and has a thriving furniture business that allows her to earn a living. She makes tables, chairs, and cabinets. This has been her livelihood for 13 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy hardwood that she can use to make more furniture. With the loan, Marina will be able to accept more orders and make her business sustainable and productive.

Marina wants to earn more so that she will have a secure life upon retirement. She believes she can further expand her business and make it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy hardwood.

loans.name: Cesar Enrique

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 42 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, vive con su familia en este mismo distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural, que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo, region Lambayeque costa norte de Peru.

Cesar se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalería, contando con herramientas propias, como mochila de fumigar, cuenta con una moto lineal la cual le sirve para transportarse y así poder realizar sus labores de la mejor manera; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para mantenimiento de herreamientas y equipos diversos, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio; Cesar piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona.
texts.en:
Cesar is 42 years old, single, has no children and lives with his family in the Oyotún district, a rural zone that belongs to the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region of the north coast of Perú.

Cesar works offering services as a day laborer; he has his own tools, such as a backpack sprayer and a motorcycle he uses for transportation, enabling him to accomplish his work in the best way possible. He has more than 10 years of experience in the business, which he does out of his home.
He is requesting this loan for the upkeep of his tools and various equipment. Such investment will allow him to keep his equipment and tools in better condition, which will have a great influence on his business. Cesar plans to improve his service productivity and thus be able to tend to the various needs of his clients in the area.

loans.use: upkeep his tools and various equipment.

loans.name: Bwizi Networking Group

texts.en:
Vena is a hardworking and married woman with three children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is a 46-year-old farmer who deals in produce buying and selling plus crop farming for additional income. She has been in this business for several years, from where she has been able to sustain herself and the family at large. She started this business in order to raise school fees after the two children had dropped out of school and had intentions of supplementing her husband's income. She has a business goal of expanding her produce business despite the challenges of unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations.

Under the group's guarantorship, Vena is requesting a loan to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Nyarukoni Catholic Workers Movement Group

texts.en:
Wilson, a member of Nyarukoni Catholic Workers Movement Group, is a resident of Kyenjojo. He is a hardworking young man aged 29 years and still single. He deals in agricultural produce, specifically selling maize, beans and groundnuts. He started this business after dropping out of school due to failure to raise his school fees. He aims at saving for the future, to look after his family and educate his children (that he plans to produce) beyond the level he stopped on and also own the biggest food store in his town.

Wilson is in need of a loan to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 29 and married with two children; both attend school.

He deals in produce, mostly buying and selling maize, beans, and rice. He ventured into a lucrative business of motorcycle riding while transporting people, in order to supplement his income.

He intends to grow and develop his business as well as pay school fees for his children. He will use the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is 47 years old and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a father of six children who all attend school. He trades in cocoa. He earns additional income in the form of a salary from Ugaden Cocoa trading company. He started the business 20 years ago, mainly to get income. He is challenged by increasing transportation costs and limited capital to buy enough cocoa. He plans to expand his business and sell to more cocoa agents in the future. Samson has requested a loan to buy more cocoa to sell to increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to resell to cocoa companies.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a 41-year-old married woman with 7 children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She operates a retail shop alongside trading in agricultural produce for additional income. She started from carrying out farming basically maize, beans and Irish potatoes. From there she accumulated savings for start up capital for her business. She has a challenge of inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand from her customers as she has desires of growing her business into wholesale and expanding it into other new markets. Therefore, Rosemary wants a loan to buy agricultural produce such as maize and beans for resale, to diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural produce such as maize and beans for resale to diversify her business.

loans.name: Noemy Estela

texts.es: Noemy de 50 años de edad  vive con su esposo su vivienda es propia ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora siempre se las ha ingeniado para tener el alimento diario en su hogar. Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su hogar se levanta desde muy temprano para preparar los materiales que ocupara durante el día y hacer el desayuno as u esposo dicha actividad la realiza a medio día y en la noche. Ella esta solicitando un credito a FUSAI para invertirlo en la compra de maíz y una plancha mas grande para su negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su esposo y también mejorar su salud a la vez.
texts.en:
Noemy is 50 years old. She lives with her husband in a house they own. She is very hard-working and enterprising. She has always managed to have food every day in her house. She works selling tortillas at her house. She gets up very early to prepare the materials that she will use during the day and make breakfast for her husband. She makes her sales at mid-day and in the evening.

She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying corn and a larger griddle for her business. Doing this she will improve her quality of living and that of her husband and also improve her health at the same time.

loans.use: to buy corn and a larger griddle for her business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel, es casado, vive con su esposa, hijos y nietos, disfruta mucho de su familia, su fuente de ingresos es cultivar maíz y frijol, inicia su jornada de trabajo a las siete de la mañana y la finaliza a las tres de la tarde, tiene su negocio desde hace 40 años y lo aprendió de su familia, no representa dificultades en realizar sus actividades.
Daniel utilizará el crédito para comprar abono, insecticidas y herbicidas para sembrar maíz, fortalecerá su negocio para que sus cosechas sean mayores y no se vean afectadas por plagas, considera que si administra bien el crédito tendrá resultados positivos y cambiara su estilo de vida.
Sus objetivos son mantenerse trabajando y darles el apoyo necesario a sus hijos para que se puedan superar académicamente.
texts.en:
Daniel is married and he lives with his wife, children and grandchildren. He enjoys his family very much. The source of his income is cultivating corn and beans.
He begins his work day at 7 in the morning and finishes it at 3 in the afternoon. He has had his business for 40 years and learned it from his family. He does not have difficulties completing his activities.
Daniel will use the loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides to plant corn, this will strengthen his business because the harvest will be better and will not be affected by infestations. He knows that if he uses the loan well he will have positive results and will be able to change his lifestyle.
His goals are to continue working and to give the necessary support to his children so that they can succeed academically.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides to plant corn, this will strengthen his business because the harvest will be better and will not be affected by infestations.

loans.name: Ma. Aurea

texts.en:
This is Ma. Aurea, 52 years old, a *CCT member (Center for Community Transformation) at Silang, Cavite, where she meets with co-fellowship members weekly to draw strength and inspiration from the study of the Word of God. She is happily married to Felix, an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker), with whom she has six children. Two of her children are already married, two are already working and two are already in college. The couple both work hard to provide for their family and send their children to college because education is a great equalizer and a path to better opportunities in life.

Ma. Aurea has been operating her tricycle for almost two years. A tricycle is a three-wheeled passenger vehicle with a side car and usually carries four passengers. It is used as a kind of taxi to transport passengers from their house to schools, or to church, the market or to city hall or to a friend's house. It is also used in making deliveries. Most Filipinos do not own a vehicle so a tricycle is a common means of public transportation in the Philippines.

Proper maintenance of her tricycle is required to ensure efficient and safe service. In view of this, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan to replace the tires of her unit and pay for its maintenance. This will allow her a stable income to help send her children to college.

Ma. Aurea plans to acquire another unit to serve more passengers and improve her income. She wants her children to finish school and become professionals someday. She is thanking you in advance for your support.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for new tires and maintenance for her tricycle.

loans.name: Zakary

texts.en:
Zakary resides in Nairobi, Kenya, where he has been diligently working for a social enterprise since July 2014. He has become an exemplary sales employee at a social enterprise that creates linkages between clean energy suppliers and financial institutions. Zakary has provided clean energy solutions to over 800 households, impacting nearly 5,000 Kenyans.

One of the main products Zakary sells is the Burn Jikokoa cookstove, which is a life-saving stove that reduces charcoal use by 50%, thus increasing family savings. The stoves also burn charcoal at a much more efficient rate, emitting 60% less carbon emissions than a traditional cookstove, and creating a healthier environment. Use of the Jikokoa has resulted in extra cash flow for many families to pay school fees, pay off loans, and invest more in their businesses.

Zakary plans to use the Kiva loan to purchase more Jikokoa cookstoves to sell within Nairobi, and to reach an additional 500 households before the end of the year. The loan will help Zakary to raise business capital he would have otherwise been unable to raise, grow his business, and reach thousands of Kenyans.

Not only will the loan benefit Zakary’s business, but it will also improve the health of thousands of Kenyans, reduce impact on the environment, and allow families to save over $200 a year.

loans.use: to buy life-saving stoves to sell to Kenyan families.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La socia Eusebia se sigue dedicando al trabajo en una institucion publica y tambien la socia abrio su tienda donde vende ropa como pantalones,blusas y chompas,la socia por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar polos,chompas,blusas y pantalones.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Eusebia continues to make a living working in a public institution. She also opened a business where she sells clothing like pants, blouses and sweaters. Through this business she provides for her family. Her dream is to have an actual shop from which to sell clothing. She is asking for a loan to buy shirts, sweaters, blouses and pants. She is happy to get a loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy shirts, sweaters, blouses and pants.

loans.name: Temboni Group

texts.en:
Joseph, who is in his 30's, is married and has two children. One of his children is in school and the other is still a small baby. He has been running a photo and video studio for nine years now. He works from 7am to 8pm and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Joseph's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to improve his business by updating the studio. He purchased new chairs and mirrors. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva lenders for their support. He has managed to pay back all of his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, repay a loan, pay rent, buy a plot of land, and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy up-to-date digital cameras so that he can make nice films.

Joseph will share this loan with his loan group Temboni, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date cameras to be able to make nice films.

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas is involved in farming and also runs a retail shop selling cosmetics and shoe polish.

Cosmas is faced with the challenges of low capital and defaulters, both of which hinder the progress of his business. However, he has a vision of increasing his family's income.

Cosmas is now involved in growing cocoa to supplement his earnings, since this is a major economic activity in the region. He has requested a loan to hire labour and buy tools for harvesting his cocoa gardens for the profitable harvest season.

Cosmas is proud of his business as he was able to pay the school fees for all of his children.

loans.use: to hire labour and buy tools for harvesting his cocoa gardens.

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Мехринисо трудолюбивая и заботливая женщина. Она мать двоих маленьких детей. Муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Он каждый месяц отправляет деньги домой. Сейчас Мехринисо одна воспитывает детей. Она занята домашними делами и ухаживает о детьми. Мехринисо успевает на все. У нее есть бизнес. Дома Мехринисо занимается шитьем женской одежды и параллельно во дворе выращивает скота. Ей нравится, зарабатывает честно нажитым трудом. Она хорошо справляется с обоими бизнесами. Таких женщин мало встречаешь. Мехринисо хочет купить скота и увеличить их численной. И решила обратиться за кредитом. Мехринисо ждет Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mehriniso is a hardworking and caring woman and the mother of two small children. Her husband is working in Russia and sends money home every month. Right now, she is raising her children on her own. She is busy with household tasks and looking after the children.

Mehriniso does well at everything. She has a business sewing women's clothing and concurrently raises livestock on her property. She likes earning honest money through her efforts and manages both businesses well. You don't meet many woman like that. She wants to buy livestock and increase their value, so she has decided to request a loan. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock and increase their value

loans.name: Jose Ladislao

texts.es: Jose un hombre de 65 años de edad el vive con su esposa y su hijo su vivienda es propia es un hombre honrado y trabajador que ha sabido ganarse la vida con toda su dedicación y trabajo. El se dedica a prestar sus servicios y esta al cuido de un terreno y también en su tiempo libre se dedica a cuidar de su cultivo de hortalizas de las cuales las vende para generar mas ingresos para tener lo necesario en su hogar. El esta solicitando un credito para adquirir semillas de jicama y reparar el vehículo en el cual transporta su mercadería que siembra en sus tierras y así tener un producto mas para ofrecer a sus clientes y tener mas variedad para ofrecer. El espera la aprobación pronta de su credito para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Jose is a man of 65 years who lives with his wife and son in his own home. He is an honest and hardworking man who has managed to make a living through his hard work. He earns his living providing services and caring for land. He spends his free time caring for vegetables that he cultivates and sells to generate more income for his household.

He is requesting a loan to buy jicama seeds and repair the vehicle he uses to transport his merchandise. He will plant on his land and have more product to sell his customers and offer them more variety. He hopes for the prompt approval for his loan so he can improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase jicama seeds and repair a vehicle he uses to transport his merchandise

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
El socio Esteban se dedica al trabajo en una agencia, el socio tiene una agencia de viajes que vende boletos turísticos a diferentes extranjeros nacionales e internacionales, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5.00 p.m,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de agencia de viajes. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar una computadora para su agencia de viajes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The client Esteban earns his living working in an agency; he has a travel agency where he sells tourists tickets to various national and international destinations. He works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. His dream is to expand his travel agency business.

Esteban is requesting a loan to buy a computer for his travel agency. He is happy about the loan and promises to meet his repayment deadlines.

loans.use: to purchase a computer for his travel agency

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru: Роза, 58 лет, замужем, есть 2 сыновей и дочь. Роза на пенсии, в качестве дохода для своей семьи Роза занимается животноводством, стартовав с покупки скота на 4,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Розы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: корова, 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Роза обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Роза планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на ремонт сараев.
texts.en:
Roza is 58 and married with two sons and a daughter. She receives a pension and works in animal husbandry as a source of income for her family, a business she started with the purchase of livestock for 4,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has a cow and five sheep on her farm with a monthly income of 8,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her farm, Roza has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase cows to increase her head count of livestock. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her number of livestock and plans to save toward renovating her sheds.

loans.use: to purchase some cows in order to increase her head count of livestock

loans.name: Zhyldyz

texts.ru: Жылдыз, 32 года, замужем, есть 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, с 1994 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве Жылдыз на сегодняшний день есть 8 коров, 6 овец и 2 лошади. На 4,0 Га земли выращивает клевер для  внутрихозяйственного потребления. Ежемесячная прибыль Жылдыз составляет 23,000 сом (KGS), в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк "Бай Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и бычка для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от бизнеса помогут улучшить благосостояние Жылдыз, а также накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Zhyldyz is 32 and married with two children. She has a high school education and has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture since 1994. She currently has eight cows, six sheep and two horses on her farm as well as 4.0 hectares of land where she grows clover for her own use. Her monthly income is 23,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her farm, Zhyldyz has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase a cow and a steer to increase her number of livestock. Income from the business will help her improve her well-being and save toward home renovations.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a steer in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддас 38 летняя жительница района под названием Шахритус. Он замужем и имеет троих детей. Мукаддас занимается растениеводством. Она каждый год сажает урожай, и этот год тоже не стал исключением. Она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения и подготовить почву для посева урожая. Она надеется, что купить минеральные удобрения, семена, закончит посев и будет ждать время сбора урожая. Мукаддас будет признательна, если ее поддержать.
texts.en: Mukaddas is a 38-year-old resident of the Shahrituz region. She is married and has three children. She works in agriculture, planting a crop every year, and this year is no exception. She is looking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and prepare the soil for planting crops. She hopes to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds and to finish planting and then to look forward to gathering the harvest. She appreciates any support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and prepare the soil for planting

loans.name: Erick Armando

texts.es:
Erick practica la crianza de cerdos, su padre se dedicó a enseñarle el oficio, el negocio lo tiene desde hace cuatro años, trabaja de lunes a domingo, al tener su propia fuente de ingresos puede superarse y ayudar a su familia, vive con sus padres y hermanos, es soltero y no tiene hijos.  
El crédito le ayudara a incrementar su inventario, comprara cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, la finalidad de la inversión es atender a nuevos clientes y generar más ingresos.
Sus planes son mantenerse trabajando y mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Erick is in the business of raising pigs. His father taught him this business. He has had this business for four years, working Monday to Sunday, to have his own source of income so that he can succeed and help his family. He lives with his parents and siblings. He’s single and has no children.

The loan will help increase his herd of pigs and buy balanced feed for them. The purpose of this investment is to reach new customers and generate more income. He plans to keep working and improving his business.

loans.use: to invest in pigs and feed to reach new customers

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: María de 24 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hija de 8 años de edad la cual los dos luchan por darle lo mejor y su educación. Ella siempre se ha esforzado por ayudar a su esposo en la economía del hogar hace algún tiempo ella aprendió a crear manualidades de bisutería de los cuales ella decidió sacarle provecho en su localidad pues ella elabora los accesorios como pulseras, collares, anillos y aretes la ventaja de este oficio es que para ello no tiene que dejar sola a su hija, en la mañana estudia su hija y ella provecha a elaborar los accesorios, y en las tardes sale a venderlos. Ella está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en piedras para bisutería, hilo, broches etc. para realizar más accesorios y también para elaborar cosas nuevas ella espera la aprobación del crédito para invertir de inmediato y mejorar sus ganancias y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María, 24, lives with her husband and 8-year-old daughter. Both parents are striving to give her the best and provide an education.

María has always made an effort to help her husband with the household finances. Some time ago, she learned how to craft costume jewelry, and she decided to sell it locally. She makes accessories like bracelets, necklaces, rings, and earrings. The advantage of this work is that she does not have to leave her daughter by herself. Her daughter goes to school in the morning, and she uses that time to make the accessories, and in the afternoons she goes out to sell them.

She is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in costume jewelry stones, thread, clasps, etc., so that she can make more accessories and also make new things. She will invest the loan money immediately upon approval and improve her earnings and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in costume jewelry stones, thread, clasps, etc., for her costume jewelry business.

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es:
Ana está entusiasmada porque su clientela está satisfecha con los productos que ella vende, opta por nuevo crédito para comprar lociones, talcos, cremas, cosméticos y ropa, incorporara nueva mercadería y con precios al alcance de sus clientes para mantener las ventas.
El crédito anterior le ha servido para tener un negocio más competente, sus ingresos han mejorado, la familia se mantiene y cuenta con nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Ana is excited because her clientele is happy with the products that she sells. She is opting for a new loan to purchase lotions, talcum powders, cosmetics, and clothes. She will add new merchandise that is within her customers' price range in order to maintain sales.

The previous loan helped her to have a more effective business. Her income has improved, her family is the same, and she has new customers.

loans.use: to buy lotions, talcum powder, creams, cosmetics, and clothes. She will add new merchandise that is within her clients' price range.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica is a single lady living in Kasese, Uganda. She is a banker by profession with a great desire to pursue a Master's degree. She sees opportunities of a promotion with a salary increment at her work place and she cannot bare to lose that chance. However, Jessica's salary is not enough to pay her school fees, but she can pay back a loan if given a chance because its payable in installments. She requests money to pay her school fees so that she is able to win that promotion.

loans.use: to pay her school fees.

loans.name: Karla Lissette

texts.es: Karla de 22 años de edad vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 3 años ella se esfuerza por ayudarle a su esposo con la  economía del hogar. Ella se dedica al venta de tamales en su comunidad, ella se levanta desde muy temprano para preparar los materiales que ocupa para elaborar los tamales y hacerles desayuno a su esposo he hijo en las tardes ella sale a vender su producto recorriendo las calles de su comunidad tiene muchos clientes que adquieren su producto porque tienen un excelente sabor y precios accesibles. Ella está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en: elotes, margarina, leche, azúcar, etc. Para elaborar más tamales y así vender más  y generar más ingresos para su hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo y ellos espera una respuesta favorable para invertir de inmediato.
texts.en: Karla is 22 years old, she lives with her husband and her three-year-old son. She works hard to help her husband out with their household budget. She sells tamales in her community, rising very early every morning to prepare the ingredients to make the tamales, and to make breakfast for her husband and son. In the afternoons she goes out to sell her products, walking the streets in her community. She has many customers for her products, because they taste delicious and are affordable. She is applying for a FUSAI loan to invest in corn, margarine, milk, sugar etc. to make more tamales, increase sales, and generate more income for her household, and improve her son's standard of living; she hopes for a positive response so she can invest right away.

loans.use: to invest in corn, margarine, milk, sugar, etc. for her tamale business.

loans.name: Twalibu

texts.en: Twalibu is a 34-year-old married man with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He owns a retail shop, does cocoa farming and gets a salary to earn a living. This has assisted him in running his business, though competition in his area is still a problem to his business growth. He wishes to expand his business to new markets and attract many customers. He used the previous loan to buy electronic torches, vests for men and toilet paper to sell. He is now requesting a loan to buy  more books, toilet paper and other scholastic items like pens to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy books, toilet paper and other scholastic items like pens to sell to his customers.

loans.name: John.

texts.en: John trades in produce, especially groundnuts, beans and maize. He started this business in 2010 in order to support his family financially. John lives in Kagadi, Uganda and is age 49. People describe him as a very hardworking man. John wants money to buy more groundnuts, beans and maize. He dreams of growing his business and uplifting his standard of living but his major challenge is a lack of a good transport system to help him collect his goods from distant villages.

loans.use: to buy more groundnuts, beans and maize.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a 34-year-old woman who is single and has no children. Therefore, her income is only for herself. She currently works as the chief of the design staff for a small clothing design enterprise. She is now willing to launch a new independent project, as a freelancer. She wants to do a clothing catalog of her own designs, and sell by demand.

In order to start her catalog and freelancer life, she is looking for a 5,000.00 MXN loan. Kubo believes that she is going to be a good client, because she has had previous loans and repaid them on time.

loans.use: to start her project as a freelancer.

loans.name: Las Cafeteras Group

texts.es:
Entre cerros y sembradíos de caña y café se encuentra una hermosa comunidad la cual ofrece paisajes muy agradables todas las mañanas. El cristo en lo alto del cerro, el pico de Orizaba y los amaneceres son inigualables, además observar a los jornaleros mientras se dirigen al campo da muestra de la entrega que tienen hacia su trabajo.
   En dicha comunidad se formó un grupo llamado Las Cafeteras integrado por cinco mujeres cuya principal actividad es la venta de café, ellas son: Amada y Rosa quienes además vende ropa; Magdalena, café; María, abarrotes y Patricia, comida típica. 
   Doña Magdalena es conocida en  la comunidad como Magda y está casada con José Luis con quien ha procreado 4 hijos de los cuales sólo uno depende económicamente de la pareja. Su esposo desciende de una familia productora de café; su abuelo es el propietario de la fábrica donde el grano se somete a una serie de procesos para obtener el producto final, es decir, un rico café orgánico y libre de químicos.
   Doña Magda se incorporó al negocio del café al contraer matrimonio y desde hace 6 años se independizaron al crear su propia marca. Al día de hoy su finca consta de más de 2000 árboles de café y ocupan todo el producto pues la cascara y las hojas las emplean como abono orgánico. El proceso para obtener el producto final consta de secar los granos, dorarlos cuidadosamente para obtener buen olor y sabor, molerlo, embolsarlo, sellarlo y etiquetarlo en bolsas de distintas medidas. “El secreto de un buen café es que no esté muy frio ni muy caliente al servirse” pronuncia con una gran sonrisa en el rostro mientras embolsa café.
   Los préstamos  los invierte en la compra de bolsas y etiquetas además de una báscula, una licuadora y una selladora de bolsas. Las ganancias le son de utilidad pues con ellas solventan los gastos del hogar, la educación de su hijo y, lo más importante, reinvierte en la producción de café. Su nuevo objetivo es comprar una desalmendradora,  una secadora y un tostador pues comenta, “hacer café tiene su chiste, mis clientes siempre elogian nuestro producto. Damos gracias VF México por creer en nosotros y darnos un nuevo préstamo”.
*La fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de María, Magda es quien viste blusa a rayas y falda color café.
texts.en:
Between the hills and fields of sugar cane and coffee you find the beautiful community that offers very pleasant landscapes every morning. The Christ statue is at the top of the hill, and the mountain peak of Orizaba and the sunrise are unequaled, as the day labourers head out to the fields with their supplies.
