In this community there is a group called "Las Cafeteras" which is made up of five women, whose main occupation is selling coffee. They are: Amanda and Rosa who also sell clothing, Magdalena, who sells coffee, María, who sells groceries and Patricia who sells typical food.
Magdalena is known in the community as Magda and is married to José Luis, with whom she has 4 children who are economically dependant on their parents. Her husband is descendant from a family that produced coffee. His grandfather was the owner of a factory where the bean was put through a series of processes to obtain the final product, that is, delicious organic coffee that is free from chemicals.
Magda incorporated the coffee business into the marriage and 6 years ago they became independent and created their own brand. Today their farm consists of more than 2000 coffee trees, and they use the whole product, including the shell and leaves which are used in an organic fertilizer. The process to obtain the final product consists of drying the beans, toasting them carefully to get a good smell and taste, grinding them, packaging and sealing them and labelling them in bags of different sizes. "The secret of good coffee is serving it not too cold and not too hot" she pronounces with a big smile on her face while packaging the coffee.
The loans will be invested in buying bags and labels as well as a scale, a blender, and a sealer for the bags. The earnings will be used to cover the costs of their home, the education of their son and most importantly be reinvested in the coffee production. Her new goal is to buy a coffee husking machine, and coffee dryer and toaster. She comments: "Making coffee is fun, my customers always chose our product. Thank you to VF México for believing in us and giving us a new loan."
The picture was taken in María's cafe, Magda is the one wearing a stripped blouse and a beige skirt.

loans.use: to buy bags and another grinder.

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.en:
Julio is a 21-year-old lad. He has no kids and he is single. Currently, he lives in his parents' home. He is economically supported by his parents, but he also works in the family business, which is a small restaurant that sells mostly chicken derivative food like consome, tostadas, soups and tacos.

He know that someday he may inherit the family business to run as he wants, so he has been looking at how to improve it. He thinks that small investments can help in the long term. This way in a few years, the restaurant may increase in size.

Now he is looking to repaint the restaurant and buy some fixed assets like chairs, tables, pots and pans. He is asking for a 10,000.00 MXN loan to improve his restaurant as much as possible. Kubo believes he is very capable of repaying the loan because he has a good business and his parents' full support. His parents trust him with some business decisions and with all the money they can provide to improve it.

loans.use: to remodel his restaurant

loans.name: La Estrella De Camanchaj Group

texts.en:
The beautiful rural community of Camanchaj is high in the mountains near Chichicastenango in Guatemala. Most of the people in the town speak K’iche with a small percentage who speak Spanish. The women of Camanchaj make gorgeous and exquisitely handmade textiles. Besides textiles, some women also make crafts and have animal husbandry businesses.

Camanchaj is the home of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Estrellas de Camanchaj” (Stars of Camanchaj) with its eight members, including the leader of this group, Josefa, who is 23 years old and has a two-year-old son. Her son is her inspiration for working hard in order to create a good future for them both.

Josefa weaves fabrics that she sells in her community. A couple of times a week, she goes to the market-place where she has a small shop to sell her fabrics. She is asking for a 29,600 GTQ loan to be apportioned among her group. With her share she will buy a large quantity of good-quality thread to weave more fabric. She would also like to buy some shawls, napkins and other finished products to sell in her shop. Josefa is grateful she has been able to obtain a loan through Friendship Bridge.

In Guatemala it is impossible for Maya women to borrow funds for their businesses. Kiva's field partner Friendship Bridge provides members microcredit and non-formal educations via their “Microcredit Plus” program. During the monthly meetings, the Trust Bank Facilitator provides lessons in important subjects that the women can use on a daily basis. Very important for the development of their credit standings are business subjects like accounting, bookkeeping, sound investment practices, customer service and marketing. This is a win-win program that helps Josefa and the other 22,000 clients have a brighter future and for the women to provide good educations for their children.

Many thanks to the KIVA investors around the world who are helping the rural Maya women of Guatemala empower themselves and develop sound businesses. They are poised to step into a brighter future benefitting themselves, their families and their communities.

loans.use: buy a large quantity of good-quality thread to weave more fabric, plus shawls, napkins and other products to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Sozulkan

texts.ru: Созулкан, 64 года, замужем, мать-героиня 6 детей. Созулкан на пенсии, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки 5 овец и бычка. Благодаря упорному труду Созулкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 11 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего дела, Созулкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма для скота. Кредитные средства позволят подготовиться к зимнему периоду, сохранив поголовье овец.  Доходы от бизнеса Созулкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Sozulkan is 64 years old, married, a heroic mother of six children. She is retired now and breeds livestock for a living. She started this business 10 years ago having bought five sheep and a bull. Thanks to her hard work, Sozulkan now owns 11 sheep. Her monthly income is 6,000 som (KGS). To develop her business further, Sozulkan turned to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to buy forage for livestock. The borrowed money will be of great help to prepare for the winter maintaining the head of livestock. Sozulkan is going to invest future income to increase the total number of livestock.

loans.use: to buy forage for livestock and later invest in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: pants, underwear for men and women, women's blouses, children's clothing, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Maria Conelle

texts.en:
Maria Conelle is 21 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Conelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Maria Conelle has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Maria Conelle would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 27 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school. For the past two years she has raised pigs to earn an income in the Philippines.

Lorna has taken out and successfully repaid two prior loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for an 8000 PHP loan to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs. She is saving money to provide a stable future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.en:
Flor de María, 32, the second from the left, has a chicken farm in Los Ángeles, a Tzotzil community in the central Chiapas highlands. Gabriela, 22, first from the left, Carolina, 26, third from the left and Manuela, 66, fourth from the left, work with her on the farm and will serve as guarantors of Flor’s loan. Gabriela is Flor’s sister, Carolina is her sister-in-law and Manuela is her mother-n-law.

The four women have been working together in poultry growth for three years now. They adapted a lot they own into a farm with all the services needed for a poultry growth system. The farm is currently unused due to a lack of resources.

Flor is asking for a loan to buy 400 chickens, feed and medicines needed to restock the farm. As a result, she will be able to exploit the farm to larger capacity than ever before. Besides, it will provide four families with a steady source of income in one of the most excluded regions in the country.

loans.use: to buy chickens, medicine and feed to restart production of her poultry farm.

loans.name: Mayelin Raquel

texts.es: Mayeli con 27 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus hijas de 5 y 2 años de edad ella es una mujer muy luchadora que se las ha ingeniado para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Ella se dedica a la venta de naranjas ella mantiene la venta en su casa y también sale a recorrer las calles de su comunidad. Ella está solicitando un crédito para invertir en: melones, mandarinas, guayabas, sandias, manzanas, etc.,  para tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes, de esa manera ella mejorara día a día y sus hijas tendrán una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mayeli, 27 years old, lives with her husband and daughters, aged 5 and 2. She is a very persevering woman who has managed to help her husband with household expenses. 

She works selling oranges. She manages the sales in her house, and she also goes out to sell the oranges in the streets of her community. She is requesting a loan to invest in: melons, tangerines, guavas, watermelons, apples, etc., to have more variety to offer her customers. That way, she will improve her business every day, and her daughters will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in: melons, tangerines, guavas, watermelons, apples, etc., for her fruit sales.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel de 46 años de edad vive con sus dos hijas de 15 y 12 años de edad y su esposo, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta pupusas quesadillas y refrescos de los cuales a sus clientes les fascinan porque son de muy buen sabor y precios accesibles de esta manera ella ayuda al aporte económico del hogar. Ella está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en: maíz, quesillo, frijoles, aceite, chicharrón etc. Para ella este crédito le será de gran ayuda pues mejorara en su negocio y en las ganancias de este con esto mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maribel is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters, ages 15 and 12. She is a very enterprising and hard-working woman who sells pupusas (Salvadoran grilled stuffed tortillas), quesadillas and soft drinks.  Her customers love her food because it tastes very good and is affordable. In this way she helps support her household. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy corn, soft cheese, beans, cooking oil, roast pork, etc. 

This loan will be a great help to her, as she will improve her business's profitability  and thereby improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy corn, soft cheese, beans, cooking oil, roast pork, etc. for her business selling pupusas (Salvadoran grilled stuffed tortillas).

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 61 años de edad, vive sola , en casa propia en el Caserio de Saltur, en una comunidad tranquila, del distrito de Zaña que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo, Region lambayeque, Costa norte de Perú.

Alejandrina se dedica a las actividad de venta de ropa, con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio, en el Caserio de Saltur y alrededores, con buenas referencias laborales y personales de parte de sus clientes; además se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Solicita préstamo para la compra de mercaderia, dicha inversión le servirá para poder aumentar sus venta y por ende sus ganancias y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 61 years old. She lives alone in her own house in the hamlet of Saltur, in a peaceful community of the district of Zaña, which belongs to the province of Chiclayo and the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Alejandrina sells clothing in the hamlet of Saltur and its surroundings. She has more than three years of experience in this business. She has good work and personal references on the part of her customers. In addition, she raises and sells small animals. 

She is applying for the loan for the purchase of merchandise. This investment will serve to increase her sales and in the end her earnings and thus improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of merchandise to increase the stock of her business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a resident of the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is 40 years old and married with four dependents. Her oldest child is 15 while the youngest is four. Her husband has an income that supports the family's daily needs.

In her business, Fe sells RTW (ready-to-wear) t-shirts, blouses, pants and jeans. Aside from that, she also sells items like body spray, beauty soap, cologne and lotion. She has requested a loan to buy various items to sell, including dresses, bags and shoes. With the proper handling of her resources, Fe will be able to purchase more items and deliver them to her clients. Thus, her earnings will improve and she will be able to balance her finances. She will continue to support her children's needs and to maintain a balance of flow for her livelihood.

Fe is doing her very best to continue to support the education of all her children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy various items including dresses, bags and shoes.

loans.name: Kembang Kertas Group

texts.en:
As the head of Kembang Kertas Group, Ni Nengah controls and monitors the member of her group. She is assisted by other boards. She sell all her pigs and earns a satisfactory profit, which she saves to use for business capital later.

The Kembang Kertas group are requesting a new loan of 9,950,000 IDR. They will use the loan to increase their number of piglets, renovate their barns and purchase superior feed. The group still needs a loan because they do not yet have enough capital to run their businesses by themselves. Ni Nengah will use her loan portion to purchase two superior piglets plus feed. She hopes she can have enough savings soon to continue the business by herself. 

The Kembang Kertas Group have made the previous repayment of 9,950,000 IDR to MUK on time. They tell us they earned an increased profit during the loan period of six months. Their pigs can grow fat and healthy. They can sell the pigs at a high price because there is high demand from the market. Now, they already have savings to use for capital.

Ni Nengah and the other members feel happy to be receiving support all this time from lenders, Kiva and MUK. Their situation stimulates their spirit to run the business. The Group hopes the cooperation between MUK, Kiva and the clients will continue smoothly and last into the future.

loans.use: to purchase two superior piglets plus feed.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia de 57 años vive con su esposo su vivienda es propia  es una mujer muy amable y solidaria con las personas es por eso que se caracteriza en su lugar de residencia. Ella actualmente tiene una tienda de artículos de primera necesidad es por esto que tiene muchos clientes porque los productos que se encuentran son de buena calidad y precios accesibles. Ella está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en aceites, productos lácteos, huevos, sopas, pastas etc. para mejorar su negocio y tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar más la calidad de vida de ella y su esposo ella espera una respuesta favorable a su crédito.
texts.en:
Emilia, who is 57 years old, lives with her husband. Their home is their own. She is a woman who is very kind and supportive with people; this is what she is known for in her place of residence. She now has a store with articles of basic necessity. She has many customers because the products that are found there are of good quality and at affordable prices.

She is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in oils, dairy products, eggs, soups, pastas, etc., to improve her business and have a greater variety of products to offer her customers in order to improve the quality of life of herself and her husband.

She hopes for a favorable response for her loan.

loans.use: to invest in oil, dairy products, eggs, soups, pastas, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Armelita

texts.en:
Armelita is a married woman with three children aged 17, 14 and seven years old. She is 45 years old herself, and a resident of the town of Talibon, Bohol. For almost six years now, Armelita has owned and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities ranging from biscuits, chips, coffee and powdered milk to fabric conditioner, candies, soft drinks and toiletries. 

She decided to take a loan to buy assorted groceries such as soft drinks, liquor and dry goods. These will boost her store content and prevent her from running out of stock. Thus, Armelita will be able to attend to her customers' needs, and she will be able to pay her obligations. She is hoping that she can manage her business well for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries such as soft drinks, liquor and dry goods.

loans.name: Blanca Dinora

texts.es: Blanca de 43 años de edad vive con esposo, sus dos hijos de 17 y 12 años y una niña de 14 años de edad ella siempre se las ha ingeniado para ayudar al aporte de la economía familiar ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que se esfuerza por salir y sacar adelante a sus hijos día a día. Ella se dedica al venta de frutas en su comunidad por el momento solo vende naranjas y bananos algunos de sus clientes llegan hasta su lugar de residencia para adquirir sus productos ya que los tiene a precios muy accesibles. Ella está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en: melones, papayas, mamones, plátanos, aguacates, cocos etc., de esta manera mejorar su negocio y a la vez los ingresos en su hogar y siempre tener lo necesario en su casa y poco a poco ir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca, 43 years old, lives with her husband, two sons aged 17 and 12, and a daughter aged 14. She has always managed to help to contribute to the family economy. She is a very enterprising woman who makes an effort to go out and help her children to succeed day after day.

Blanca is a fruit vendor in her community. For the moment, she only sells oranges and bananas. Some of her clients come all the way to her house to purchase her products because she sells them at such accessible prices.

She is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in melons, papayas, mamón, plantains, avocados, coconuts, etc. In this way, she can improve her business, and at the same time her household income, always having what's needed in her house, and little by little improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in: melons, papayas, mamón, plantains, avocados, coconuts, etc. for her fruit sales.

loans.name: Teratai Indah Group

texts.en:
In their last loan application, the Teratai Indah Group changed their business loan from pig breeder to farming - although, they are still involved in the pig business. With their last loan, they bought paddy seeds, fertilizer and paid rent for a tractor. Now, after maintaining the rice field well, they have already harvested and earned a satisfactory profit. Most of them can set aside their profits for savings and to fulfill their daily needs.

Now facing the dry season, the Teratai Indah Group continue with their loan. They will use the loan amount to purchase various seeds that are suitable for the dry season, such as peanut, cassava, chili, etc. Two of the group members have decided to increase their loan to purchase more seeds and fertilizer. As the head responsible for her group, Sayu Komang will use her loan to purchase peanut and cassava seeds and also fertilizer.  

The group anticipates a good harvest so that they can earn a satisfactory profit. Sayu Komang dreams to renovate her house and build a new kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase peanut and cassava seeds and also fertilizer.

loans.name: Dinazon

texts.en:
Poverty inspires Dinazon to work hard. 

She was only 18 years old when she started vending vegetables in the market. She was not given a chance to study because her parents were incapable of sending her to school. At the age of 18, she was still single and stood as a parent for her brothers and sisters. She is proud that through vending, she was able to successfully send her siblings to school to finish their studies. 

Now, Dinazon is 54 years of age. She is still managing the business because she wants her only child to finish her studies, too. 

With regards to her business, Dinazon is asking for 20,000 PHP to buy more vegetables to sell. Her goal is to earn a greater income for the preparation of her daughter’s college education. She will do her best to succeed in attaining her goal.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a farmer. She toils the land and does farming. She grows and sells rice. She is married with two dependents who are 19 and 17 years old, respectively. Her husband is also a farmer. She is in need of capital to improve her main source of income.

With the availability of the resources needed, her farm would produce quality rice, enabling her to sell at a higher price. Thus, her income would increase and she could start to invest in any possible business to have an additional source of income.

Adelaida has requested a loan to buy farming supplies like fertilizers and pesticides. Thus, she could continue to expand her business and improve the family's living conditions and continue to finance the education of her two children as well.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies like fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more scrap materials, empty bottles, cans and jars to resell.

loans.name: Jenivee

texts.en: Jenivee is 18 years old from Abuleg, Dinalungan, Aurora. She is taking a 6-month Bookkeeping course at the ASKI Skills and Knowledge Institute. She is eager to finish the course to find a stable job. Because of financial difficulties, she wants the help of an education loan of PHP 33,000 to aid in her schooling. She is hopeful that KIVA lenders will approve her loan.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 32 years old and married with one child.

Erma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Erma has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Erma aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jennyfer

texts.en:
Jennyfer is 59 years old and married with four children. Jennyfer works very hard to provide for them.

Jennyfer has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jennyfer has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

In the future Jennyfer would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 43 years old and married with two children.

Olivia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Olivia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Olivia has been farming rice for twenty years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Olivia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sari Madu Group

texts.en:
As per the agreement that was already signed, the Sari Madu Group paid off their loan on time. They were very happy. All the crops produced to the maximum. It is because they always maintained them well and did not forget to spray with insectiside and to give them fertilizer. During the harvest time, the group sold the crops to a big buyer and earned a satisfactory profit.

Ni Nengah, as the head, feels the happiness of her group. She succeded in leading the group towards having an increasing profit and a better life. Its proven by the success of one of her group members who decided to resign after she earned a maximum profit and to continue the business with her own money. Three members need to increase their loan to expand their business. The new loan is being used to expand the farming business by buying new seeds, farming tools, insecticide and fertilizer. Ni Nengah used her loan to purchase peanut and chilli seeds and fertilizer. Now its the dry season and she is prepared for that. Ni Nengah hopes that in the next six months, the crops will grow fast and produce a maximum result. She will save all the profit to support her plan to renovate her house.

Two members not pictured because of a religious ceremony at their temple.

loans.use: to buy paddy seeds, insecticide and fertilizer

loans.name: El Maguey Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Maguey proviene de una comunidad oaxaqueña rodeada por sembradíos de caña de azúcar, y árboles frondosos cuyos frutos frescos son un manjar para los habitantes. Los amaneceres son inigualables en esa zona pues el volcán conocido como el Pico de Orizaba brinda una vista esplendida en el horizonte. Aunque sin duda lo más agradable son los sonidos de la fauna local y las risas de los niños mientras juegan en el campo.
   Los integrantes del grupo antes mencionado son: Yolanda quien invertirá en refresco; Aracely, en ropa; Aidee y Francisca, en zapatos; Primitiva, en pan; Angelina, en botanas y pan, Vanessa, en abarrotes y María quien brinda servicio de molino.
   María Santa es conocida por todos por su segundo nombre, tienen dos hijas que dependen económicamente de ella y su esposo Renaldo y son su gran motivación en la vida. En su barrio anteriormente no había ningún molino, por lo que los usuarios debían salir hasta una comunidad vecina para obtener el servicio. Fue entonces cuando Santa encontró la oportunidad para obtener ingresos favorables; con la ayuda de su esposo comenzó desde hace 15 años a moler todo tipo de granos y chiles adquiriendo una clientela sólida. “Al principio era un poco pesado levantarme temprano, ahora sin necesidad de poner alarma me levanto y ofrezco un servicio de calidad” comentó satisfecha.
   Las ganancias le han permitido construir un pequeño corredor junto al molino, en donde realizan fila sus clientes  mientras esperan su turno ya que la afluencia es grande debido a, sobre todo, la costumbre de hacer tortillas a mano. Una clave importante para el éxito de su negocio es la excelente atención que reciben los clientes los cuales recomiendan a Santa y regresan a la brevedad.
   El préstamo solicitado le ayudaría a comprar una piedra para moler, una banda transportadora y pagar servicios del local continuando así con la actividad que durante 15 años  ha beneficiado a su familia.
   Todo el grupo agradece a VF México y KIVA por los préstamos otorgados pues cada uno de ellos les ha permitido enriquecer su actividad.
* La fotografía fue tomada en el negocio de Doña Angelina la cual carga gustosamente a su bisnieta, María es quien viste blusa color rosa.
texts.en:
The group "El Maguey" comes from a Oaxacan community surrounded by plantings of sugar cane and leafy trees whose fresh fruits are a delicacy for the residents. The sunrises are unequaled in this zone because the volcano known as El Pico do Orizaba offers a splendid sight on the horizon. However, without a doubt, the most pleasant things are the sounds of the local animals and the laughter of the children while they play in the fields.

The members of the aforementioned group are: Yolanda, who will invest in soft drinks; Aracely, in clothing; Aldea and Francisco, in shoes; Primitiva, in bread; Angelina, in snacks and bread; Vanessa, in groceries; and Maria, who offers milling services.

Maria Santa is known by everyone by her second name. She has two daughters who depend on her and her husband, Renaldo, economically and are her great motivation in life. In her previous neighborhood, there was no mill, and so the users had to go to a neighboring community to obtain this service. It was then that Santa found the opportunity to obtain advantageous income. With the help of her husband, she began 15 years ago to mill every type of grain and chiles, acquiring a solid customer base. "At the beginning it was a little difficult to get up early. Now, without the need of setting an alarm, I get up and offer a quality service," she comments, satisfied.

The earnings have allowed her to build a small veranda next to the mill, where her customers line up while they wait their turn, since the number of customers is great, due above all to the custom of making tortillas by hand. An important key to the success of her business is the excellent attention that the customers receive, and they recommend Santa and come back soon.

The loan she has applied for will help her to buy a stone for the mill and a conveyer belt and to pay for services, thus continuing with the business that has benefited her family for 15 years.

All the group is grateful to Vision Fund Mexico and to Kiva for the loans granted, since each one of them has been able to strengthen her business.

The photograph was taken in the business of Doña Angelina, who is happily holding her great-granddaughter. Maria is the one wearing a pink blouse.

loans.use: to buy one stone and one band for the mill and pay for electricity.

loans.name: Jeanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Jeanie works hard to support her family.

She has a purified drinking water retail business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a clothing retail business. Jeanie is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of purified water to sell to customers.

Jeanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of purified water to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is married. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan, and now she is applying for her second loan of $1,000 to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as detergent, milk, noodles, candles, cigarettes, eggs, soap, candies, cooking oil and other things. She is happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as detergent, milk,  noodles, candles, cigarettes, eggs, soap, candies, cooking oil and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in sheet metal, cement, wood, sand, and nails to cement the floor of her home.

loans.name: Reina

texts.en:
For the last 20 years, Reina has been running a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like biscuits, spices, sugar, eggs, edible oil, soap, powdered soap and tissue paper.

She is a married woman with six children from Talibon, Bohol. Her husband's occupation is a security guard.

She needs a loan to finance her business. She is asking for a loan to buy supplies like rice, flour, and assorted dry goods. These will help Riena maintain the stocks of the store and enable her to cater to the needs of her respective customers. With these, her income will increase and she can start to roll-out her capital. Then she can start to expand and be successful and sustainable in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy supplies like rice, flour and assorted dry goods.

loans.name: Natercia

texts.en: Natercia is businesswoman,. She started her business with her own working capital of $300 in 2012. Natercia has machine-mill-rice and wood-cutting machines in her house. She also sells rice and rice flour, She has been thinking of how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her house such as wood, saws, wood-cutting machines, machetes and a wood-hollowing machine. She is happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy some additional supplies to keep in her house such as wood, saws, wood-cutting machines, machetes and a wood-hollowing machine.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela goes fishing. She catches and sells fish and crab to the locals in the community. She hails from the town of Getafe, Bohol.

She is a married woman with four grown children. Her husband is also a fisherman. She needs funds to support her fishing activity.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like fishing net, crab net and a motorboat engine. With these, she can maximize all the resources and improve the living conditions of her family. She can start to settle her obligation and handle her finances.

In the future, she is aiming to save enough money to purchase another fishing boat to have a sufficient source of income .

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, crab net and a motorboat engine.

loans.name: Casilda

texts.en: Casilda is in agriculture and is selling vegetables and gasoline. She is requesting a loan of $700 to improve her business. She will use this loan to buy more vegetables and gasoline in one place, and after she buys them, she will bring them to the market to sell. She started selling vegetables in 2000 with her own working capital of $100. Now she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy more vegetables such as papaya fruit, papaya flowers, leeks, onions and other things to sell. Everyday her life is selling vegetables and gasoline because she is earning a good income from it.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and gasoline from another place to sell.

loans.name: Gulhan

texts.ru: Гулхан, 38 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, уже 5 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Сумев развить свой бизнес, на сегодняшний день, благодаря упорству и целеустремленности Гулхан, в хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы. На 0,40 Га земли выращивает кукурузу и морковь. Гулхан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS), на полученные средства приобретет минеральные удобрения для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически-чистых овощей. На доходы от кредита Гулхан будет и дальше развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Gulhan is 38 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. She has secondary education and has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation for five years. Having managed to develop her business and thanks to tenacity has three cows on her farm. She grows sweet corn and carrots on 0.40 hectares of land.

Gulhan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS). For the money she receives she will purchase mineral fertilizers to prepare and cultivate the land for growing ecological vegetables. Gulhan plans to use the income from the loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for land cultivation and growing organic vegetables.

loans.name: Los Cuates Group

texts.es:
Una comunidad oaxaqueña pertenece a las zonas productoras de caña de azúcar más importantes de todo el país. La mayoría de sus habitantes se dedica a trabajar en el campo, en el ingenio azucarero local  y algunos otros tienen pequeños comercios a lo largo y ancho de la región. En una de las colonias rodeada por cerros se formó un grupo llamado Los Cuates nombrado así pues en la casa donde se reúnen los integrantes, viven dos hermanos gemelos; los miembros son: Obdulia, Irene y Raquel quienes invertirán en pollo; Bernardina y Oscar, en refresco; Iran, en servicios de albañilería y Guadalupe, en la renta de madera. 
   Doña Obdulia es una persona muy trabajadora, tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales dos son los famosos cuates quienes dependen económicamente de ella. Anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar como empleada doméstica no obstante esto le restaba tiempo con sus hijos por lo que decidió renunciar a su trabajo para solucionarlo. Posteriormente inició con la venta de pollo, “recuerdo que compré sólo 10 pollos por temor a no venderlos pues hay competencia aquí, pero gracias al trato amable, la calidad y el precio accesible logré mantener mi actividad” comentó muy contenta. Todos los días se despierta a las 5 de la mañana para comenzar su rutina en donde alista los animales hasta que queden listos para su venta, después desayuna con sus hijos y los lleva hasta su escuela para al regresar abrir su negocio.
   Las ganancias le han permitido solventar los gastos de su hogar, de la educación de sus hijos y los del negocio. Con la oportunidad del préstamo podrá  invertir en la compra de 20 pollos, bolsas plásticas y una cubeta. Uno de sus planes a futuro es aumentar su producción y convertirse en mayorista dentro de su comunidad.
   Todos los integrantes se expresan así sobre los préstamos, “gracias por la oportunidad de crecimiento que nos han brindado, por preocuparse por nosotros. Dios los guarde y los proteja siempre”.
*La fotografía fue tomada en donde vende pollo Doña Obdulia, ella es quien está apoyada sobre el mostrador.
texts.en:
A Oaxacan community belongs to the most important sugar cane-producing zones in the entire country. The majority of its inhabitants work in the fields, in local sugar industries, and some have small businesses far and wide throughout the region.

In one of the communities surrounded by hills, a group called Los Cuates was founded. Two twin brothers live in the house where the members meet. The members are: Obdulia, Irene, and Raquel, who sell chicken; Bernardina and Oscar, who sell soft drinks; Iran, who works in construction services; and Guadalupe, who buys and sells wood.

Doña Obdulia is a very hard-working person. She has four children, two of which are economically dependent on her. She used to work as a housekeeper; however, this took away time with her children, which is why she decided to give up her housekeeping job. She then began selling chicken. "I remember that I only bought ten chickens out of fear that I wouldn't be able to sell them because of the competition here, but thanks to friendly behavior, quality and accessible prices, I was able to sustain my endeavor," she tells us with satisfaction. Every day she wakes up at 5 AM to begin her routine, in which she prepares the animals for sale. Then she has breakfast with her children and takes them to school. When she returns, she opens her business.

The income has allowed her to cover household expenses, the education of her children, and business expenses. With this loan she will be able to buy 20 chickens, plastic bags, and a bucket. One of her plans for the future is to increase production and become a wholesaler within her community.

All of the members would like to say, "Thank you for the opportunity for growth that you have provided, and thank you for caring about us. May God always watch over you and protect you."

*The photograph was taken where Doña Obdulia sells chicken. She is the one leaning on the counter.

loans.use: to buy 20 chickens, bags, and a new bucket.

loans.name: Ilolvi

texts.ru: Илолви 35 лет. Она работает швеей. Илолви около 5 лет в этой сфере деятельности. Она замужем и имеет детей. Ее муж на заработках в Российской федерации. Илолви решила отремонтировать дом. Для этого нужно купить стройматериалы. Илолви обратилась за кредитом, потому что МДО "Хумо" упрощает процессы кредитования и предлагает выгодные условия для женщин. Она не сомневается, что ей помогут, и заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en:
Ilolvi is 35 years old.  She has been working as a seamstress for about five years.  She is a wife and mother.  Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation.

Ilolvi has decided to repair her house. In order to do this, she needs to buy construction supplies.  She is taking a loan and has decided to turn to MDO Arvand because they simplify the loan process and offer favorable conditions for women.  She is confident that she will receive some help, and she thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies in order to renovate her house.

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en: Phan’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Phan makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as farm laborer and farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Gul'chehra

texts.ru: Гульчехра замужняя женщина в возрасте 47 лет. Она уроженка района  Хуросон. У нее один сын. Муж работает мастером по ремонту домов.  Гульчехра вместе семьей живет в районе Хуросон. Хуросон красивый район в Республике. В районе многие жители занимается животноводством. Потому что хорошая погода для развития животноводческой деятельности. Муж Гульчехры раньше выращивал скота. Сейчас свободное время помогает жене в работе. Гульчехра выращивает крупнорогатого скота у себя во дворе. Она любить доить коров и обеспечить семью молочными питаниями. Гульчехра 12 лет своей прекрасной жизни продвигает свою работу. Она хочет расширить животноводческую деятельность. Гульчехра просит кредит для купли скота. Она верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Gul'chehra is 47, married, and a native of the Khuroson district where she lives with her family.  She has one son.  Her husband makes a living renovating houses.  The Khuroson district is a beautiful district of Tajikistan and many of its residents raise livestock because the weather there is very favorable to animal husbandry. 

Gul'chehra raises cattle at home. Her husband helps her with the farm work during his free time.  Gul'chehra enjoys milking her cows and providing dairy products to her family.  She has a good life and she has been involved in animal husbandry for the past 12 years.  She now wants to expand her business.  She is taking this loan to buy some cattle.  She relies on you and on your support.

loans.use: to buy some cattle and expand her animal husbandry activity.

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru: Зухра, 42 года, замужем, есть сын. У Зухры средне-специальное образование, дополнительно сейчас учится на заочном отделении Университета, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она работает бухгалтером. Также занимается полеводством, на арендованном земельном наделе в 0,30 Га и собственном - 0,50 Га, она выращивает картофель и фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход - составляет в среднем 27,000 сом (KGS). Зухра обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) для закупки строительных материалов для проведения ремонтных работ в доме и пристройку сарая. Свои доходы Зухра планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zuhra is 42 years old, married, with one son.  She has a specialized secondary education.  At the moment, she's also enrolled in a university distance learning program. She works as an accountant, a job which constitutes the main source of income for her family.  In addition to her job and studies, Zuhra is involved in agriculture.  She grows potatoes and beans for resale on 0.3 hectares of leased land and 0.5 hectares of her own land.  On average, she makes a total monthly income of 27,000 som (KGS).

Zuhra has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and she is taking a loan of 110,000 som (KGS) to buy building materials to renovate her house and to build a barn.  She is planning to use her income to further develop her farming business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her house and build a barn.

loans.name: Reibati Group

texts.en:
Reibati is 47 years old and is from Imphal East of Manipur (India). She has formed a group called Reibati Group which consist of five members. Together they need a loan of INR 35,000 for their respective businesses.

Reibati is the leader of this group and she plans to use the loan for her weaving business. She plans to make loin clothes, mekhala, chadar and saree, which will only be possible with this loan. Currently her monthly income is INR 7,500, which is not enough to either run her business or meet the needs of her family of four members. With this loan, she might earn up to INR 9,000 per month and can contribute to her household income.

In the same manner, other members of the group also need the loan to expand their respective businesses involving vegetables, embroidery, a meat center and garments. With your help, they will be able to expand their businesses and also contribute to the family income and cover their needs.

loans.use: to purchase yarn for her weaving business.

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Amavi est une femme mariée résidant à Adidogomé avec trois enfants à charge. Amavi est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Amavi  nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation à leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Amavi is a married mother to three children who lives in Adidogomé. She earns a living through selling wood charcoal which she purchases twice monthly from her local market then resells out of her own home.

In order to finance her purchase, Amavi needs this loan to procure sacks of wood charcoal so she can earn a larger profit and support her husband with their family's expenses. This will allow for their children to receive a good education.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of wood charcoal.

loans.name: Eva Elvira

texts.es:
Eva es una mujer de 58 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene hijos independientes, y su negocio es la venta de golosinas y refrescos.
Ella es independiente, amable y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa Fátima’ que es la puerta que contacta con las provincias del norte.
Eva es morena de baja estatura y cabello rojizo. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.  Su negocio es la venta de golosinas com0; chocolates, dulces, papas fritas, chicles y otros, “mi trabajo me ha mantenido durante los últimos 15 años, gracias a esto no necesito ayuda de mis hijos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que trabaja desde tempranas horas para atender a los escolares, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de un equipo telefónico para ofrecer el servicio. Su sueño es vivir tranquilamente, ella desea comprar un equipo telefónico para ofrecer el servicio de llamadas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que realiza este negocio.
Es por esos motivos que Eva solicita un préstamo para comprar un equipo telefónico para ofrecer el servicio de llamadas y atraer nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Eva is a 58 year old woman. She lives with her spouse and has grown children. Her business is selling snacks and beverages.

She is independent, friendly, and very responsible. She runs her business in the ‘Villa Fátima’ area, which is the door that connects to the northern provinces.

Eva has dark skin, short stature and reddish hair. She shares her life with her spouse, who works. They live in a rented house built of brick and cement that has all of the basic services. Her business is selling snacks such as chocolates, candies, potato chips, gum and more. “I have maintained my work for the last 15 years and thanks to this I don't need my children's help", she remarks. The advantage of her business is that she works from the very early hours to serve students. The disadvantage is a lack of capital to buy telephone equipment to offer a calling service. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 15 years she has had this business.

It is for these reasons that Eva is asking for a loan to buy telephone equipment to offer a calling service and attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy telephone equipment to offer calling service and attract new customers.

loans.name: Edjowa Enyonam

texts.fr: Agée de 40 ans, Edjowa est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé. Avec six enfants à charge, Edjowa est une femme dynamique qui se bat pour l’épanouissement de ses enfants en préparant de la bouillie accompagné des gâteaux faites à base de la farine de blé. Edjowa sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de maïs, de la farine de blé, des litres d’huile et des boîtes de poudre mélange. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Edjowa répondra favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir ainsi une autonomie financière considérable pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation.
texts.en:
Edjowa is a married mother to six children who lives in Adidogomé. She is a dynamic woman who fights to see her children do well in life through selling porridge and cakes made from wheat flour. She is requesting this loan to purchase sacks of maize, wheat flour, oil and packs of mixed powder.

With the resulting profits, she would like to be able to meet her customers' needs and thereby have a considerable amount of financial independence. She will then be able to support her children in their educations.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of maize, one bag of wheat flour, 10 litres of oil and two packs of mixed powder.

loans.name: Gotitas De Amor Group

texts.es: Agustina tiene 39 años de edad es casada con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella implemento su bodega en su vivienda hace muchos años en el cual ofrece productos de toda variedad frutas verduras carne pollo abarrotes útiles de limpieza. Ella de esta manera puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de educación y alimentación de sus hijos. Y a la vez tener –un negocio en su casa le permite dedicarse a sus hijos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas abarrotes verduras frutas y útiles de limpieza. El grupo “GOTITAS DE AMOR” agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Agustina es la que tiene a su bebe en brazos.
texts.en: Agustina is 39 years old. She is married and has 3 dependent children. She opened a store in her house many years ago where she offers products of all types- fruit, vegetables, meat, chicken, groceries, and cleaning supplies. This is how she can help her husband with e costs of feeding and educating their children. At the same time, a business in her home allows her to focus on her children. She will invest the loan in buying more groceries, fruit, vegetables and cleaning supplies. The “GOTITAS DE AMOR” is thankful to the Kiva lenders for the loan.  Agustina is the one with a baby in her arms.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, vegetables, fruit and cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Ima

texts.fr: Ima  est âgée de 47 ans et est une femme mariée. Ima vit avec ses six enfants et son mari à Adidogomé où elle prépare de la bouillie faite à base du maïs accompagner des beignets  pour ses consommateurs qui trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Ima s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et désire commander des sacs den maïs afin de gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour ainsi promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ima is a 47-year-old married mother to six children. She lives with her children and husband in Adidogomé where she prepares wheat porridge and fritters for customers who enjoy her cooking.

Ima gets her supplies three times per month from market and wishes to order sacks of maize so she can earn a solid profit. By doing this, she will be able to support her children's educations.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of maize.

loans.name: Alindor

texts.es:
Alindor tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y dos menores hijos, en el caserío Santa Rosa en el distrito Santo Tomás, tienen casa propia de material rustico un piso; provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Alindor es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1,5 has.Actividad la realiza hace 03 años en caserío Santa Rosa Distrito Santo Tomás, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café, producto lo vende en su distrito y alrededores.Adicionalmente se dedica a la actividad pecuaria cría de ganado vacuno y también al cultivo de caña de azúcar para elaboración de aguardiente y productos de pan llevar. El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento de 1,5 has. de café en producción, con ello asegurara mayor y mejor producción para campaña 2015 y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Alindor is 30 years old and lives with his spouse and two minor children in the village Santa Rosa in Santo Tomás district. They have their own one-floor house made of rustic material in the province of Cutervero, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

The work that Alindor does is growing coffee. He has at this time 1.5 hectares. He has done this work for 3 years in the village of Santa Rosa in Santo Tomás district. He has experience in the field of coffee growing, he sells the product in his district and nearby ones. In addition, he works in agriculture raising cattle and also growing sugar cane to make aguardiente and products to make bread. The loan is destined to maintain the 1.5 hectares of coffee in production. With this, it will assure greater and better production for the 2015 season and in the end he will get better income so to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain 1.5 hectares of coffee production.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria continúa con su negocio de confección de ropa. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de cortes de tela por mayor. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo vender toda su producción. Su negocio continúa mejorando, los clientes son continuos, “la tela se acaba y debo comprar cortes grandes de tela para poder trabajar sin parar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son continuas, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de cortes de tela por mayor. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa, ella desea realizar la compra de cortes de tela por mayor. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución e 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de cortes de tela por mayor para confeccionar prendas femeninas.
texts.en:
Maria still makes clothes.
She used the previous loan to buy cloth wholesale.
Since she managed to sell her whole production, she was punctual in her repayments.
Her business keeps improving and more and more customers come to her.
Maria says that she is almost out of cloth and that she needs to buy more to keep working.
Her business's main advantage is that sales are constant. The main challenge is the lack of capital to replenish the stock of cloth.
Maria's dream is to open a clothes shop. She wants to buy cloth wholesale.
Maria has been in business for twenty years and this is her second loan with the field partner.
Maria will use the loan to buy cloth wholesale to keep making women's clothes.

loans.use: to buy cloth wholesale to make women's clothes.

loans.name: Un Futuro Mejor Group

texts.es:
En Oaxaca hay una zona muy importante dedicada a la producción de caña de azúcar donde, en temporada de zafra, queman, cortan y trasladan el producto al ingenio. Allí es donde se somete a un proceso para finalmente obtener azúcar la cual comercializan en grandes fábricas al igual que la melaza.
   A unas cuadras de la fábrica se ha integrado un grupo para solicitar el apoyo de VF México para invertir en sus actividades, su nombre  es Un Futuro Mejor y hace referencia a los objetivos que tienen en mente. Los miembros son: Ernesto y Everardo quienes se dedican a vender abarrotes; Alicia, Tirso y Roberto, ropa; Dulce, lencería y calzado; Teresa, pollo y abarrotes; Victoria, tacos; Jacinto, refresco y Claudia, cosméticos.
   Doña Teresa es conocida por todos sus vecinos como Tere, y junto con su esposo Benjamín tiene un hijo que depende económicamente de la pareja. Se dedica a la cría y venta de pollo desde hace más de tres años para lo cual su esposo construyó un corral en el patio trasero de su hogar. Desde entonces siempre procura mantener una cantidad aceptable de animales pues sus clientes suelen solicitar muchos ejemplares. En esta ocasión el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de 40 pollos y alimento suficiente para su sano desarrollo.
   En orden de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, comienza sus actividades a partir de las 5 de la mañana de lunes a sábado; el proceso suele ser complejo pero gracias a su experiencia ahora lo realiza de manera sencilla siempre respetando las normas de calidad. De igual manera se hace cargo de una tienda de abarrotes que anteriormente pertenecía a su suegra, en general toda su familia se esfuerza por ayudarse el uno al otro. Las ganancias le han permitido remodelar su casa, pagar la educación de su hijo y ahorra para someterse a una cirugía que tiene programada. Con estas palabras demuestra su sentimiento, “agradezco día con día a Dios por la gran oportunidad que me brindo al otorgarme la vida, por hacer posible que nos otorguen préstamos y por la gran familia que me dio”.
*Los integrantes del grupo decidieron tomarse la fotografía en el patio de Boni, Doña Tere es quien viste blusa a cuadros color rosa.
texts.en:
In Oaxaca, there is a very significant region dedicated to sugar cane production where, in the harvest season, they burn, cut and transport the product to the mill. There is where it undergoes a process to finally get sugar which they sell to the big factories as well as molasses.

Some blocks from the factory, a group has formed to ask for VF México's support to invest in its work. Its name is Un Futuro Mejor [A Better Future] and refers to the objectives that they have in mind. The members are Ernesto and Everado who work selling groceries; Alicia, Tirso and Roberto, clothing; Dulce, lingerie and shoes; Teresa, chickens and groceries; Victoria, tacos; Jacinto, snacks, and Claudia, cosmetics.

Teresa is known by all her neighbors as Tere and, with her husband Benjamín, has a child who depends on the couple. She has worked raising and selling chickens for more than three years, for which her husband built a corral in the backyard of their home. Since then, she has always managed to maintain an acceptable quantity of animals since her customers tend to ask for many specimens. At this time, the loan will be invested in the purchase of 40 chickens and feed sufficient for their healthy development.

In order to satisfy her customers' needs, she begins her work at 5 in the morning from Monday to Saturday. The process is usually complicated but, thanks to her experience, now she does it in a simple way, always respecting the quality standards. She also is in charge of a grocery store which previously belonged to her mother-in-law. In general, the whole family works to help each other. The earnings have allowed them to remodel their house, pay for their son's education and save to pay for a surgery that is scheduled. With these words, she expresses her feelings, "I am grateful each day to God for the great opportunity He has offered me when He gave me life, for making it possible for us to get loans, and for the great family He has given me."

*The members of the group decided to take their photo on Boni's patio. Tere is the one wearing a pink checkered blouse.

loans.use: to purchase 40 chickens and feed.

loans.name: Las Conocidas Group

texts.es:
REVISADO
Una presa ubicada en el estado de Oaxaca brinda un paisaje espectacular pues su gran extensión de agua ha permitido que se formen pequeñas islas las cuales se pueden observar desde muy lejos. La pesca y la agricultura son las  principales actividades económicas llevadas a cabo por los habitantes. La imagen de los pescadores adentrándose a la presa asemeja una postal debido a la hermosa vista que contrasta con la luz del día.
   En una de las colonias aledañas a la presa se ha integrado el grupo Las Conocidas cuyo nombre refiere a la gran confianza que se tienen sus miembros quienes son: Rosa dedicada a la venta de ropa y recipientes de plástico; Nadine y Karla, ropa; Hilda, perfumes y ropa; Victoria, artículos de papelería; Gabriela, zapatos y pollo asado y Rafael quien cría cerdos.
   Doña Victoria es una mujer que a pesar de las adversidades ha sabido salir adelante junto con sus 5 hijos quienes ahora son mayores de edad. Para doña Viki, como le conocen en la comunidad, lo más importante siempre ha sido su familia por lo que ha desempeñado distintas labores desde lavar ropa y planchar ropa hasta vender tamales y comida típica con el fin de solventar sus necesidades. Después de varios años de trabajar como empleada decidió iniciar con su propia actividad y para ello abrió una papelería que ha mantenido durante cinco años. La clave de su éxito es ofrecer variedad, precios accesibles y lo mejor de todo un trato amable a cada uno de sus clientes.  
   “Mis hijos se admiran de mí pues aunque sólo estudié hasta primer año de primaria sé leer y escribir además de hacer cuentas” son las palabras de doña Viki quien ofrece servicio a partir de las 8:00 am y hasta las 8:00 pm. Para ella éste es su primer préstamo y lo invertirá en la compra de lápices, bolígrafos, colores, libretas, papel y aire comprimido para limpiar las computadoras que ocupa en el servicio de internet. Con las nuevas ganancias espera poder ampliar su local y aire acondicionado para contrarrestar el exceso de calor.
*La fotografía fue tomada en “la novia del sol” ubicada a 40 minutos de la presa, Doña Viki viste blusa negra.
texts.en:
A dam located in the state of Oaxaca offers a spectacular landscape. It's great expanse of water has allowed small islands to form, which can be seen from far away. Fishing and farming are the main economic activities of the inhabitants. The image of the fisherman going on the dam looks like a post card with the beautiful scene and the contrast of the daylight.

In one of the communities surrounding the dam the Las Conocidas group formed. Its name refers to the great trust that it members have. They are Rosa, who sells clothes and plastic containers, Nadine y Karla, clothes, Hilda, perfume and clothing, Victoria, paper products, Gabriela, shoes and roast chicken, and Rafael who raises pigs.

Victoria is a person who despite her adversities has been able to get ahead with her 5 children, who are all grown. For Viki, as she is known in the community, the most important thing has been her family, and she has been doing different jobs from washing and ironing clothes to selling tamales and traditional clothes in order to cover her needs. After several years o working as a maid, she decided to start her own activity, and to do that, she opened a paper goods store that she has maintained for five years. The key to her success is to offer a variety, accessible prices and best of all, friendly treatment to each of her customers.

“My children admire me because although I only went to school up to the first year of primary school. I know how to read and write and do the accounts”. These are the words of las Viki, who offers her service from 8:00 am until 8:00 pm. This is the first loan for her and she will invest it in buying pencils, pens, crayons, notebooks, paper and compressed air for cleaning computers used for the internet service. With the new profits, she hopes to be able to expand her locale and have air conditioning to combat the excess heat.

*The photograph was taken at “La Novia del Sol”, located 40 minutes from the dam. Viki is wearing a black blouse.

loans.use: to buy pencils, pencil cases, crayons, notebooks, contact paper and compressed air.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira ofrece diversos artículos, principalmente artículos de uso escolar. Ella solicita un préstamo de quinientos mil colones (₡500 000), para la compra de mercadería que le permita ampliar su negocio y además poder ofrecer mayor diversidad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en: Elvira offers a variety of items for sale, particularly school supplies. She is applying for a loan of five hundred thousand Colones (500,000 CRC) to buy merchandise that will allow her to expand her business and offer a greater selection of products to her clients.

loans.use: to buy bookstore merchandise.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Chapi Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “EMPRENDEDORAS DE CHAPI” conformada por 05 socias responsables con deseos de progresar. Ella es Jenny una de las socias de 37 años de edad Soltera con 1 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de postres peruanos como mazamorra morada arroz con leche desde hace más de 4 años que tiene dicho negocio. Su mayor deseo es de poder tener su local propio ya que lo hace de forma ambulatoria. Solicito el crédito para la compra de leche arroz azúcar. El grupo “EMPRENDEDORAS DE CHAPI” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. JENNY es la tercera del lado derecho viste polo color blanco.
texts.en: This is the new group Emprendedoras de Chapi made up of 5 responsible members with desire to progress. Jenny is one of the members, 37 years old, single, with one dependent child. She has worked selling Peruvian desserts such as mazamorra, morada, and arroz con leche for over 4 years that she has had this business. Her greatest desire is to be able to have her own retail space since she does it as a street vendor. She asked for the loan to purchase milk, rice, and sugar. The Emprendedoras de Chapi group is grateful to the people from Kiva who made this loan possible, since it allows them to continue improving. Jenny is the third from the right wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: to purchase milk, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Diomedes Alexander

texts.es: Diomedes de 27 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos una niña de 6 años y un niño de 2 años de edad, por quienes se esfuerza trabajando día con día para darles lo mejor y que no les falte el alimento diario. Él se dedica a cultivo de plátanos los cuales los comercializa cuando llega la cosecha, trabaja todo el día  y en ocasiones cuando no trabaja en las tardes trabaja como jornalero en cultivos ajenos todo eso para tener un poco de dinero extra.  Él está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en:  ladrillos, cemento, arena, hierro, grava, polines etc., para construir su casa ya que actualmente está hecha de láminas, madera en mal estado, y palmeras que las utiliza como techo en la parte de afuera de su casa. Él espera una respuesta favorable a su crédito y comenzar con la construcción pronto y así brindarle a su familia una vivienda digna y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Diomedes is 27 years old. He lives with his wife and their two children, a 6 year old girl and a 2 year old boy. He works hard day to day to give them the best so that they don't lack daily food.  He grows plantains, which he sells when he harvests them. He works all day and on occasion, when he doesn't work in the afternoon, he works as a day laborer on other people's farms. All of that is to have extra money. He is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in bricks, cement, sand, iron, rods, etc. to build his house, because the one he has now is made from sheeting, wood that's in bad condition, and palm fronds that he uses as a roof on the exterior of his house. He hopes to have a favorable response for his loan and start construction soon to offer his family a worthy home and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in bricks, cement, sand, iron, gravel, rods, etc., to build his house.

loans.name: Vireak's Group

texts.en:
Vireak’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Vireak works as farmer and sells fishes to support her family.

In the village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
La socia Cornelia se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza platos como pollipapas es un plato a base de pollo y papas, la socia es una persona muy trabaajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar papas y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member, Cornelia, works in the food sales business. She prepares dishes such as pollipapas, which is a dish made from chicken and potatoes.

Cornelia works very hard and provides for her family by means of this business. Her dream is to open a restaurant. She is applying for a loan to purchase ingredients for cooking, such as potatoes and chicken.

She is happy about the loan, and she promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking, such as potatoes and chicken.

loans.name: Jeannie

texts.en:
Jeannie is 41 years old and is from Tulat, San Jose, Nueva Ecija. She and her husband have one daughter. Despite having only one child, they are struggling financially.

To help send her daughter to school, Jeannie wants to take out an education loan of PHP 33,000 from the Kiva lenders. Her daughter Jeannie Ross is taking a 6-month bookkeeping course at the ASKI Skills and Knowledge Institute.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fee.

loans.name: Vuthy's Group

texts.en:
Vuthy’s group lives in a rural village in the Battambang province of Cambodia. Vuthy makes a living cultivating rice, and does extra work as a salesperson to support his family.

In the village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Sharopat

texts.ru:
Эту милую женщину зовут Шаропат. Ей 53 года. Она мать троих детей. Шаропат добрая и отзывчивая женщина. 
   Шаропат занимается земледелием, она мастер в своем деле. Шаропат выращивает и продает виноград. Работать в этой сфере не всем подвластно, так как выращивание винограда требует большое внимание, опыт и мастерство. Шароат справляется со своими обязанностями безупречно. На сегодняшний день у нее не большой виноградник и Шаропат планирует расширить грани виноградника. Но сначала она просит помочь ей купить минеральные удобрения, чтобы получить качественный урожай и за счет продажи виноградов расширить свой бизнес. Шаропат надеется, что ее поддержат, и заранее благодарит за помощь.
texts.en: This nice woman is called Sharopat. She is 53 and a mother of three. Sharopat is a kind and sympathetic woman. She is also an excellent farmer who grows and sells grapes. Not everyone is suited to work in this area because growing grapes requires great attention, experience, and skill. Sharopat flawlessly performs her work. She has a small vineyard and plans to expand. But first she is asking for help to buy fertilizer in order to obtain a good harvest. She will expand her business with the profits from selling her grapes. Sharopat hopes for support and is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Cañaris que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Edilberto se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Edilberto espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Edilberto, 41, lives with his wife and children in his own home made of rustic materials. His home is located in the district of Cañaris, province of Ferreñafe, Lambayeque region, in the northern coast of Peru. Life in this district is quiet, the residents work mainly in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

Edilberto works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. He has 10 years of experience in this business, and very good personal and work references in the area.

This loan is to buy compost and fertilizers that he will use to give proper maintenance to his coffee crops, as well as to hire labor for the harvest season. In this way, Edilberto is looking to offer a better quality coffee to his clients, which will in turn have a positive impact on his level of income and improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers for the proper maintenance of his coffee cultivation, as well as to hire labor for the harvesting.

loans.name: Jinky Mae

texts.en: Jinky Mae is 22 years old from General Tinio, Nueva Ecija. She stopped schooling for a long time and now she wants to continue by taking a 6-month bookkeeping course in ASKI Skills and Knowledge Institute. She wants to finish her studies not just for herself but for her family as well. To do that, she wants to avail an education loan of PHP 33,000. She believes that this course will help a lot in enhancing her skills and knowledge that will help her find a stable job.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Don Fernando se dedica a la actividad de pollos de engorde. Solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000), para la compra de pollos y alimentación para los mismos, de esta forma logrará aumentar el peso y desarrollo de sus pollos lo cual le generará mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Fernando works raising broilers. He is applying for a loan of a million Colones (1,000,000 CRC) to buy chickens and the feed for the same. In this way, he will be able to increase the weight and development of his chickens which will in turn generate better income.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed for the same.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn has owned and managed her vegetable garden for eight years. She earns well and has sustained the business.  With her generated income she was able to repay successfully her previous loan used for the business.  Developing her business is easier with her access to GDMPC. Recently she took a new loan to buy fertilizer for her vegetables to be able to deliver plenty of vegetables in the market. She plans to use the additional profit generated by the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her vegetable garden

location.town: Sta. Cruz, Kapatagan Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Lortes

texts.en:
Lortes is 48 years old and has three children to provide for. Her husband is a farmer and to be able to help her husband provide for the needs of her family she engaged in a buy and sell business. For almost 3 years in the business she was able to send her children to school. She joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to enable her to engage in business activities.

Recently, Lortes took a new loan to purchase useful items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to save more money for the educational needs of her children when they get in college.

loans.use: to buy more useful items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Chamnan's Group

texts.en:
Chamnan is 32 years old living in a rural village of Battambang province. She is a married mother of three dependent children, two of whom are schoolchildren and another is under school age. To support her family she grows rice, raises fish and works as a teacher. These businesses have been with her for 10 years. Due to lack of water to fill her farmland, her crop has not grown well and she cannot earn good income as before.

For Chamnan, she has been with VisionFund for three cycles already and with the help of those previous loans she has enough household supplies to use. She is now leading a group of two to get a new Kiva loan. As the group leader, she will use her entire portion of loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed and pay for plowing fees to increase her crop. She hopes that this fourth loan will help her to get more income so that she can upgrade her living standard to be better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed to increase her crop yield and get more income.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn has been running her grocery store for almost six years. We're glad to be informed that her earnings are really good and she has generated enough income to repay her previous loan. 

Arlyn is requesting a new loan to buy more goods to sell to meet the needs of her customers. She wants to expand her business. Arlyn will use her loan to increase profits, improve her family’s quality of life, and meet the educational needs of her child.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell

loans.name: Khen's Group

texts.en:
Khen lives in Kampong Cham province. She is 48 years old and has two children, one of whom is in school. Rice farming has been the primary source of her family’s income for 30 years. She can earn additional income via working as a handicraft. The price of fertilizer is increasing while the crop is growing unhealthily, which is the main challenge for her business.
