This is Khen’s fist time to apply for a loan with VisionFund. In a group of two, she is the leader. She is going to manage her loan portion in order to buy seed and fertilizer to produce a good yield. She hopes to gain more yield and increase income to be better support her daughter’s studying and buy school materials for her.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Sinonn

texts.en:
Sinonn is 37 years old, a married grocer with two children in her care. She resides in a village in the Kampong Chhnang Province in Cambodia.

She has been a grocery retailer since 2012. Her husband is a teacher and her children attend school. Sinonn and her husband can make approximately USD 13.5 per day.

This is her second loan cycle with Kiva. Sinonn would like to request a loan because she needs finances to buy more groceries to sell. With this loan, she will be able to buy more groceries and improve her business and family’s income. In the future, she is going to expand her business and support her children to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: La Cosecha Del Señor Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACION COMUNAL LA COSECHA DEL SEÑOR ESTA CONFORMADA POR OCHO INTEGRANTES, SIETE MUJERES Y UN HOMBRE, MADRES Y PADRES RESPONSABLES DE FAMILIA CON DOCE HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DE MALPAISILLO, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGION Y SE CARCTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE LA COMPANIA DE SUS HIJOS, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN PARA SACAR ADELANTE SUS NEGOCIOS Y CUMPLIR SUS SUEÑOS Y METAS PERSONALES.
LA CORDINADORA DEL LA ASOCIACION LA COSECHA DEL SEÑOR ES SANDRA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA ELABORACION  Y VENTAS DE TORTILLAS UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION, , LA RUTINA DE TRABAJO  DE ESTA JOVEN MUJER ES DE UNA OCHO HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS A CLIENTE FIJOS Y EVENTUALES, SE LEVANTA DESDE LAS 4: 00 AM A NISQUESAR Y LUEGO A PÀLMEAR LAS TORTILLAS PARA LA VENTA DEL DIA, ACTIVIDAD QUE LA DESEMPEÑA CON MUCHO GUSTO YA QUE HA SIDO SU FORMA DE SUBSISTENCIA Y DE SU FAMILIA. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA  EN UN QUINTAL DE MAIZ , LEÑA, BOLSAS PLASTICAS, CAL, ETC. LA COSECHA DEL SEÑOR AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LES BRINDAN LOS INVERSIONISTAS PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en: The Communal Group "La Cosecha del Señor" is formed by eight members: seven women and a man. They are responsible mothers and fathers of their families, with twelve children under their responsibility. They are native of Malpaisillo, a place located in the northern region, characterized by being responsible working people, wishing to progress. In their free time they like to enjoy the company of their children. Currently, they are struggling to move ahead with their businesses and reach their dreams and personal goals. The group's coordinator is Sandra and her business is the production and sale of tortillas, which she does from her house. This young woman's work routine is eight hours a day, offering her products to regular and occasional customers. She gets up at 4:00 a.m. to cook the corn and afterwards to form the tortillas in order to sell them that day, an activity that she enjoys doing, because it has been her means of support ant that of her family. The loan's objective is to invest in work capital by buying raw materials such as: a quintal of corn, firewood, plastic bags, lime, etc. "La Cosecha del Señor" is grateful for the help they receive from the lenders so they can have the means for decent work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as corn, lime, firewood, plastic bags, etc. for the production of tortillas.

loans.name: Nova Joy

texts.en:
Nova Joy is 18 years old and is from Sto. Cristo, Maria Aurora, Aurora. She has four siblings and what her parents earn is not enough for all of their needs. 

Nova Joy is requesting a 33,000 PHP education loan from Kiva lenders to take a six-month bookkeeping course. She wants to finish her studies to be able to help her family and give back to her parents.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en:
Bayan, 21 years old, lives in Salt. She is studying at the university in her third year, majoring in architectural engineering.

She does not have a dream except to complete advanced studies to enable her to work as a teacher in university. This has been her ambition since childhood.

Because of the financial problems faced by her family, she submitted a request for an education loan so that she can complete her study.

loans.use: to cover her semester fees.

loans.name: Bakoniaina Ony

texts.fr:
Bakoniaina Ony, est une jeune femme dynamique et débrouillarde de 21 ans. Elle est mère d'un bébé de 10 mois. Le père de son enfant est un irresponsable car il a déjà quitté Bakoniaina Ony  tôt avant même la naissance du bébé. Il ne veut rien savoir ni de son bébé ni d'elle.
Face à cette situation, elle doit s'occuper et élever seule son enfant. Pour gagner sa vie, elle dirige un commerce des sacs et des sandales il y a maintenant 3 ans. Heureusement, qu'elle a déjà cette activité avant qu'elle est enceinte. 
Elle et son bébé habite en ce moment avec ses parents, et son désir est d'être indépendante. Elle voudrait ainsi offrir à son enfant une meilleur condition de vie. C'est une mère très courageuse et travailleuse.
texts.en:
Bakoniaina Ony is an energetic and resourceful, young 21-year-old woman. She is the mother of a 10-month-old baby. The baby's father is irresponsible, as he left Bakoniaina Ony before the birth of the baby. He wants nothing to do with her or the baby.

In light of this situation, she must take care of herself and raise her baby on her own. In order to make a living, she has been selling bags and sandals for the last three years. Fortunately, she had already started this work prior to becoming pregnant.

She and her baby currently live with her parents, and she wishes to be independent. She would like to improve the living conditions for her baby. She is a very courageous and hardworking mother.

loans.use: to buy backpacks, overnight bags, sandals.

loans.name: Wilman

texts.en:
Wilman is 21 years old and is from Langka, Palayan, Nueva Ecija. His parents run a sari-sari (variety) store but their little income cannot sustain his schooling fees.

Wilman is requesting a 43,000 PHP education loan to enroll in a nine-month Microfinance Technology Course. He believes that finishing this course will give him a brighter future and a bigger chance to find a stable job.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Thịnh

texts.en:
Thịnh is 29 years old. He is married and has one child. He lives in Dong Son district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Thịnh has been working in agriculture as a farmer for three years. His family is a low-income household in a village; moreover, the income from his business is not high enough for him to do what he really needs to comfort his life.

The main hardship that Thịnh faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase equipment, sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

This is Thịnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. He hopes that this loan could make his little dream come true.

In the future, Thịnh hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and for his children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase equipment, sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Shahana

texts.en:
Shahana is a 26-year-old single lady. She is a university student who is majoring in hospital management. Shahana lives with her parents. She has a grand dream of becoming an excellent manager. Shahana wants to realize her dream of being a productive woman and wants to find good job to improve the quality of her life and help her family. 

Shahana is requesting a loan to pay her university tuition and cover other school-related expenses. She wants to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to pay university fees and complete her education

loans.name: Maria Liza

texts.en:
Maria Liza has been selling pets such as dogs, cats, and fish in her village. She has been working for almost five years to earn a living. Maria Liza earns well and has sustained her pet store. She has been able to repay her previous GDMPC loan.

Maria Liza is requesting a loan to purchase additional stocks of feeding supplies for her pet store. In the future, she wants to become a pet supplier in her market in town. Maria Liza's plan for the future is to save money from her business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and supplies for her pet store

loans.name: Nay's Group

texts.en:
Nay, 62, is living in a wooden house with a roof made of colored tiles, located in Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of six children.

She does rice farming and she raises pigs to support her living condition. She has done this for 44 years. Her daily income is about 13 USD per day and she can save around 6 USD each day after her family’s expenses.

Recently, her farm gained a much lower yield than she expected because of drought. Now she has not enough working capital to do farming for this season, so she decided to lead a group to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund.

This is the first time for her to get a loan with VisionFund. As the group leader of two, she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to increase her crop yield.

She hopes that she can make more income to upgrade her lifestyle and save for future need.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yield so that she can make more income to upgrade her lifestyle and save for future need.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Lợi

texts.en:
Lợi is 35 years old and she is married. Lợi lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in a village; moreover the market need is low in this region.

She has been working in agriculture, raising poultry, for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet and a bathroom.

This is Lợi's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.

In the future, Lợi hopes for her business to do well, for her to make enough money to provide for her children and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet and a bathroom.

loans.name: Vita

texts.en:
Vita is in a civil marriage. Recently she gave birth to her small daughter.

Vita has her own business. Due to the previous loan, Vita increased the turnover of goods. She is an active and hardworking person.

Vita is asking for a loan of 60,000 UAH to purchase school supplies and backpacks. Autumn is the best season for this kind of sales. The loan will help Vita to receive additional income and take better care of her baby daughter.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies and backpacks for sale.

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province, Rin is 54 years old and a mother of three children.

Growing rice and cassava are the main sources of her income. She has been involved in her job for 36 years.

The price of fertilizer is higher while the crop is not growing well, so she can’t afford to do farming for this next season. Because of this, she decided to get a loan with VisionFund, and this is the first time for her.

In a group of four, Rin is the group leader and she is going to manage her portion of loan in order to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farmland. She hopes to gain more profits and upgrade her standard of living and able to save to future need.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yield as well as her returns in order to save for future need.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Lina Maria

texts.es:
Lina es una señora con 30 años de edad, casada y tiene un hijo de 2 años. Desde niña se ha dedicado a realizar labores de campo, algo que le ha generado buenos ingresos y con lo que logra salir adelante con su familia.
Es dueña de un gran cultivo de hortalizas.
Solicita un préstamo con el que podrá comprar semillas de papa criolla e insumos agrícolas como insecticidas y abonos.
Su mayor anhelo es tener su propia casa, mejorar si estabilidad económica y gozar de una buena salud.

Las actividades que realiza esta mujer para sobrevivir con los suyos son dignas de aplausos y la hacen merecedora de la ayuda que solicita.
texts.en:
Lina is a 30 year old lady, married, and she has a 2 year old son. Since childhood she has made a living doing field work, which has generated a good income that has enabled her family to get ahead.

She owns a large vegetable farm. She is applying for a loan so she can buy criolla potato seeds and agricultural supplies such as insecticides and fertilizers.

Her greatest desire is to have her own home, improve her economic stability and enjoy good health. The endeavors this woman accomplishes in order to survive on her own are worthy of applause, and attest to the merit of the assistance requested.

loans.use: to buy criolla potato seeds and agricultural supplies, such as insecticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda, 38, is a widowed woman who lives in straw house located in Takeo province. She is a mother of a child who is still in school.

She has been growing rice to support her family’s living for 10 years. Meanwhile, she is working at a garment factory to supplement her income. She is able to save around 4 USD each day for emergency needs.

She does not have enough to fill in her farmland, which causes her crop to grow poorly and gain her a very low yield.

Chanda has been with VisionFund for two cycles and those previous loans enabled her to send her son to school. Now, she decided to apply for a new loan in order to buy cows to help her in plowing the farm to save the cost of plowing fees. She hopes to get more income so that she can support her child’s education until his graduation so he can get a good job in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows to help her in plowing the farm to save the cost of plowing so she can spend that on her son's studying.

loans.name: Laith

texts.en:
Laith, a capable man, was born in Jordan in 1991. He is single and lives with his parents in Irbid.

Laith is a university student, majoring in industrial engineering, and he is well known among friends and students.

He tried to find good work besides his education to save his daily pocket money and to complete his education, but there was no job suitable with his study.

Laith lacks sufficient funds to pay his tuition fees, and he is an ambitious and high-powered guy, so he did not want to give up without doing anything. Therefore, he requested a loan to help him pay for his university fees and achieve his dreams. He hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees and achieve his dreams.

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
This 38-year-old hardworking entrepreneur is Madeline from Toril, Davao City.

She runs a variety store that also sells rice and vegetables. It supplements her husband’s income in providing for their usual expenditures and their children’s education.

Two of their children will be studying in college soon, and Madeline would like to prepare for it. She wants to obtain more products for sale to boost her income and savings. A loan worth PHP 40,000 will help her a lot. She will use it to buy sacks of rice, groceries, beverages, and more vegetables for her inventory.

Madeline consistently meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from her religion. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, groceries, beverages, and more vegetables for her inventory.

loans.name: Abeteraine Kyenkonge Group

texts.en:
Emelda is married and has four children. She lives in Kagadi, Uganda. Edmelda operates a retail shop, which she has been doing for seven years. She earns additional income from farming. She started her business to generate income to support her family and develop herself. She is hard working and very honest. Her major challenge is the lack of capital to realize her dreams.

Emelda requested a loan, which she will use to buy goods such as sweets, biscuits, and sodas to sell. She is a member of the Abeteraine Kyenkonge Group where members guarantee one another in order to access money. She plans to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as  sweets, biscuits, and sodas to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 45 years old, married, and has two children. He is from Kitabi Ibaare Bushenyi district. His major source of income comes from agriculture, which he has been doing for 14 years with the hope of generating income to cater to his family's needs. He earns additional income as a bailiff. He is an honest man who works eight hours a day. He is faced with a challenge of pests and diseases.

James requested a loan for 5,000,000 UGX, which he will use to buy organic fertilizers. His dream is to educate his children and his dependents so they can have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara is a 63-year-old mother with nine children. To earn a living, she runs a business selling fish in her community. Her children help her with the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. Sara requested a loan to buy a fishing net, a torch, a new canoe, a container, an ice bag, and a swimming suit to help her catch the fish and sell them. She became a member of SPBD in 2006. She will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, a torch, a new canoe, a container, an ice bag, and a swimming suit

loans.name: Diturije

texts.en:
Diturije's income comes mostly from livestock; although, her family owns agricultural land where they plant mostly feed for animal such as lucerne, fodder, vetch and corn.

From the raw milk Diturije sales she makes about $5400 and $1000 from dried beans. Both these incomes on an annual basis.

loans.use: to buy fodder for the animals

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 31 years old, married, and is a business woman. She is applying for a loan of 600 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop where she sells second-hand clothes. She also sells in the market. Virginia became involved in this business a year ago, which she started with her own working capital of 250 USD. She earns a good income from selling second-hand clothes because many people like to buy them. The items are cheap and unique, compared to new clothes. She is still happy to do her business.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts, jackets, shirts and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 31 years old, married to a farmer, and has 2 children. She has a small fattening project that she started a year ago. She is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy two heads of cattle to increase her sales of cheese, milk and butter and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy two heads of cattle. .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new collection of fruit and vegetables to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 50-year-old married woman and the mother of six children.

Her daughter owns a beauty parlor in partnership with an expert in hair styling and cutting. She is an expert in makeovers. Both are very professional in their arts. She provides makeovers to her clients at home, also. Most of their clients belong to the neighborhood, and her clients appreciate her craft. Over time, the furniture has broken and her beauty products are running out. Now, she wants to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty salon.

Therefore, Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her daughter can buy new furniture and additional cosmetic products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion, etc. She wants to establish a separate parlor in a nearby town so she won't have to split her profits.

Shamim thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and additional cosmetic products for her daughter's beauty parlor.

loans.name: Moshi Group

texts.en:
Emmanueli who is in his 20's is single and has no children. He has been selling fried fish for five years and works from 08am to 08pm and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be 3rd loan from Tujijenge. He used the previous loans to improve his business through increase on fish stock. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. He paid back his loans successfully and used the profit to repay a loan, save some money and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to increase on the fish stock, to buy cooking oil, charcoal for cooking etc. He dreams of expanding his business.

Emmanueli will share this loan with his loan group Moshi which consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his fish stocks and to buy cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is 47-years old lady and the mother of five children. Her husband owns a workshop in which he provides the services to maintain wagons. He is professional in his techniques and can easily fix the wagons in no time. He has to use various types of tools for the work. A few days ago he shifted his workshop to another place, due to replacement some of important and expensive tools have been misplaced.

Shaheen has requested a loan for her husband so that he can compensate against this loss. He will buy repairing tools and some spare parts such as brake shoe and engine oil for his wagon repairing workshop.
She is hopeful that her husband will utilize this amount in positive way and his monthly income would be increase. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools for her husband's wagon repairing workshop and some spare parts.

loans.name: Jehovah Jireh School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Winfred. She is the Head teacher of Jehovah Jireh School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Gayaza in Wakiso District with 200 students. Jehovah Jireh School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1,000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Jehovah Jireh School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Winfred ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. .

loans.name: Begim

texts.en:
“Psychology is one of the most complex but unique sciences, as the object of its study is a man. And there is nothing that could be more complex than a human psyche, because it is neither  calculated by a formula nor it is a subject to laws. I realized that studying psychology involves constant work, which is hard, and requires a lot of self-study and effort.
I would have been now a sophomore, if I had entered AUCA last year. Unfortunately, last year due to limited finances and due to the lack of other sources of funding for my education, I went to study to another local university. But soon I realized that I had made a great mistake of my life. I visited AUCA again at AUCA Open Doors, and understood that it is a modern and dynamic educational system, timely responsive to labor market requirements. Education is provided in English, there are well-experienced professors who seek to convey their deep knowledge, an incredible combination of rigid self-discipline and flexibility in the choice of subjects, and a rich library.
That day we were told about financial aid and Kiva loan to cover the part of tuition. I was so upset to learn about it so late, but became so happy to find the reply for my question. From that day I started preparing for the AUCA entrance exams and believed that if I just pass the exams successfully, I will get an interest free loan and repay it back just after graduation. My parents supported me morally and now I am again a freshman, but this time at the university, having graduated from which I will bring great benefit both to my family and my country as an expert in the field of Psychology. I kindly ask you to give me this opportunity.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education in Psychology at AUCA.

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso De La Zona B Group

texts.es: CLAUDIA de 27 años de edad es soltera y tiene 2 hijo dependientes. Ella Pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “esperanza y progreso de la zona b” la cual lo conforman 05 socias con deseos de  trabajar honradamente y progresar. Ella hace más de 2 años que se dedica al negocio de venta de artesanías textiles peruanas. Gracias a su constante dedicación logro sacar adelante a  su familia. Su mayor deseo es poder ampliar su negocio. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de hilos y lanas de diferentes tipos y colores. La Alcancía “esperanza y progreso de la zona b” agradece a los Inversionistas de Kiva por el apoyo y se comprometen a seguir trabajando honradamente. Claudia es la primera del lado izquierdo se encuentra de pie y viste polo color rojo.
texts.en:
Claudia is 27, single, and she has two dependent children. She belongs to the communal bank "Esperanza y Progreso de la Zona B" which is made up of five women whose desire is to have decent work and make progress.

Claudia has worked for two years selling Peruvian artisan textiles. Thanks to her constant dedication, she has been able to provide for her family. Her greatest wish is to expand her business. She is applying for this loan to buy threads and wool of different types and colors.

The “Esperanza y Progreso de la Zona B” group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their support, and is committed to continue with their honest work. Claudia is the first woman from the left, standing, wearing a red polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy threads and wool of different types and colors.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-years-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and one child in a simple house. Mohammad works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. He would like to improve the family living conditions and buy some necessary items.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to provide clean water especially for his child.
Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is in her late 30s and is married with two children, who are still in school. She has been running two projects, a beauty salon and a grocery store for eleven years now. She works from 07am to 08pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be her 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start running a grocery store and increase on the salon products and has paid back all his loans successfully. She is happy with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees, she built a shop for her business, saved some in the back, to repay loans and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to to increase on drinks and buy the up to date salon products to meet her customer's requirements. She dreams of becoming an international business woman.

Helen will make sure she is accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to increase on drinks and buy the up to date salon products to meet her customer's requirements.

loans.name: Khurshaid

texts.en:
Khurshaid is a 42-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband has been running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. He also assists his younger brother by purchasing a stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of three children, and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health expenses.

She wants to help grow the business of her husband, so she has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits. She is expecting a boost in earnings, and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventories for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila, a Lebanese dressmaker, lives with her son and daughter in Tripoli, North of Lebanon. Her daughter became recently widowed and her son is in the military which allows him to help his mom and sisters in the house expenses.

Leila is 63 years old and owns her own shop for selling or renting wedding and party dresses. She established her business seven years ago, after losing her husband, in order to be able to support her children and ensure a regular income.

Leila is asking for the first time for a 2,827,840 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva's partner Ibdaa to buy new dresses. Her goal is to attract more clients to her shop with the new collection. She is known in her town for being ambitious and with very strong morals. She is doing her best to improve her work and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy new wedding and party dresses.

loans.name: Ronita

texts.en:
Ronita is 52 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Ronita is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Ronita has been farming rice for twenty years and also earns additional income from vegetables vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a divorced with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en: Ayman is 41, married, has 2 children, and takes care of his aging parents who live with him in the same house. He has an animal feed sales business and is requesting 4000 EGP loan to buy new kinds of feed for the business.

loans.use: to buy new kinds of feed. .

loans.name: Armando De Jesus

texts.es:
Armando es un señor con 49 años de edad, la adversidad que lo ha perseguido no ha sido obstáculo para querer salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños, lo que se propone lo logra, antes deseaba tener su propio negocio, ahora lo tiene, quiere formalizarlo y que en un futuro pertenezca  a sus hijos.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual comprará abonos, fertilizantes, venenos y también realizará el pago de canales.
Armando es un hombre trabajador y lleno de sueños, su propósito es seguir fortaleciendo su labor y aumentar sus ingresos.
Su actitud positiva y los deseos de progresar, permiten ver en este hombre unas ganas inmensas de superarse y por supuesto una respuesta favorable a su petición.
texts.en:
Armando is a 49 year old man. The adversity through which he has persevered has not deterred him from wanting to get ahead and to fulfill his dreams. Previously he wanted to have his own business, which he now has. So what he now proposes is to secure it so that in the future it will belong to his children.

He is requesting a loan to buy manure, fertilizers, insecticides and to pay for installing irrigation.

Armando is a hardworking man and full of dreams, he aims to continue fortifying his livelihood and to enhance his income. His positive attitude and desire to progress, lets you see that in this man there is a huge desire to better himself. He hopes to receive a favorable response to his request.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and to pay for installing irrigation.

loans.name: Imaculada

texts.en:
Imaculada lives in Atsabe, and most of her daily income is from selling cows. She is now applying for a loan of $1,000.

Imaculada started her business a few years ago with her own working capital of $5,000. With her husband, she was going to add money to their principal amount to buy another cow to improve their business, because it has become their activity.

She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more cows in the future.

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Fotu

texts.en:
Fotu is a 51-year-old mother with two children. She runs a small business of selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years.

Fotu requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves, a backpack sprayer and a chainsaw to help her run the business.

She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2004.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves, a backpack sprayer, and a chainsaw.

loans.name: Muayad

texts.en:
Muayad is a 23-year-old, single man from Yatta, Hebron City. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support.

Muayad has a greenhouse for the cultivation of vegetables and fruits in the city. It is a good business and provides him a good income, but the economic situation in the West Bank is bad.

Muayad could not save cash from last season, so he took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy some seedlings and pesticides for his greenhouse for this season.

He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales and customers, and eventually save enough income to get married.

loans.use: to buy some seedlings and pesticides for his greenhouse for this season.

loans.name: Sepa

texts.en:
Sepa is a 31-year-old mother with three children. She has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, and cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Sepa requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves, and safety boots to help her run the business.

She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves, and safety boots.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia Mercedes se sigue dedicando al negocio de hospedaje,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar camas y sabanas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mercedes is continuing to run her lodging business. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman who through her business wishes to help her family get ahead.

Mercedes is seeking a loan to buy beds and sheets. She is very happy to get this loan and promises to repay it.

loans.use: buy beds and sheets.

loans.name: Adjo Rose

texts.fr: Adjo est une femme célibataire sans enfant qui habite à Adidogomé. Agée de 40 ans, Adjo est une revendeuse des objets en plastique qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend au bord de la route. Adjo demande ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de plats en plastiques et des unités de bassines plastiques. Avec le bénéfice qui en résultera, Adjo va pouvoir aider sa famille à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens puis réinvestir dans son commerce.
texts.en:
Adjo is a single woman with no children who lives in Adidogomé. Aged 40, Adjo sells plastic objects and renews her inventory three times a month at the market, reselling it on the side of the road.

Adjo is asking for this loan so as to order dozens of plastic platters and plastic basins. With the profit that will result from the loan, Adjo will be able to help her family to cover daily needs and then reinvest in her business.

loans.use: 10 dozen plastic platters and nine plastic basins

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Mère de quatre enfants, Adjo est une femme mariée âgée de 53 ans habitant à Adidogomé. Adjo est une marchande  de bouillie  préparée à base du maïs et accompagné des beignets à domicile. Adjo revend sa marchandise au bord de la route. Adjo s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché du nécessaire pour sa préparation et désire ce prêt pour réaliser ses achats des sacs de maïs, de farine de blé, de sucre et de bidon d’huile afin de gagner une marge bénéficiaire assez importante pour inscrire ses enfants dans des écoles de haut niveau.
texts.en:
The mother of four children, Adjo is a married woman aged 53, living in Adidogomé. She sells porridge made of maize accompanied by homemade fritters. Adjo sells her foods at the side of the road.

Adjo buys the necessary ingredients for what she prepares twice a month at the market, and she wants this loan to cover her purchase of sacks of maize, wheat flour, sugar, and a jerrycan of oil. She hopes to make a big enough profit to register her children in advanced level schools.

loans.use: to buy one sack of maize, one sack of wheat flour, one sack of sugar, and one jerrycan of oil.

loans.name: Esperanca

texts.en: A $800.00 is offered to Esperanca to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day, because she lives near many people. She will buy some additional supplies with this loan including detergent, salt, sugar, water, candles, cooking oil, milk, sardines, soft drinks and hard drinks, and other things to sell. She has been involved in business activities since 2013, with her own working capital. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can help her husband to be responsible for her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: to buy detergent, salt, sugar, water, candles, cooking oils, milk, sardines, soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
RAFAEL TIENE 51 AÑOS CONVIVIENTE SIN CARGA FAMILIAR, VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD HABITADA POR GENTE AMABLE, DEDICADA A LA AGRICULTURA, COMERCIO Y PESCA, EN EL DISTRITO DE MÓRROPE, PROVINCIA CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERU.

RAFAEL SE DEDICA A PRESTAR SERVICIO COMO JORNALERO AGRICOLA POR ZONA DE RESIDENCIA Y ALREDEDORES,DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS, CUENTA CON BUENAS REFERECNIAS LABORALES Y PERSONALES.CON EL CRÉDITO COMPRARA ANIMALES PARA SU VENTA Y ALIMENTOS PARA ESTOS, Y ASI PODRA TENER UN INGRESO EXTRA PARA LA MEJORA DE SU CALIDAD DE VIDA Y LA DE SU CONYUGE.
texts.en:
51-year old Rafael is married but doesn't have any dependent children. He lives in a friendly community where he earns his living as a farmer, businessman, and fisherman. His village is located in Mórrope district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

Rafael works as a day labourer in the local and surrounding areas, a job he's had for several years. He has good work and personal references. With the loan he plans to buy animals to sell, and feed for them. Then he will have extra income to improve his own and his wife's standard of living.

loans.use: buy animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Salaima

texts.en: Salaima is 27 years old with 1 child. She runs a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Salaima requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals, to assist her to run the business. She joined SPBD in 2015, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals,.

loans.name: Creciendo Unidos Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “CRECIENDO UNIDOS” conformada por 06 socios con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella es luz una de las socias de 48 años de edad separada con 3 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de desayunos como pan con huevo y leche pan con palta. Desde hace más de 6 meses que tiene dicho negocio. Su mayor deseo es de poder tener su local propio ya que lo hace de forma ambulatoria. Solicito el crédito para la compra de leche azúcar pan huevo. El grupo “creciendo unidos” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Luz es la primera del lado derecho viste polo color morado.
texts.en:
The is the new group, Creciendo Unidos. It is comprised of six members who wish to improve their quality of life.

Luz, age 48, is one of the members. She is separated and has three children. She sells breakfasts like egg with bread and milk bread with avocado. She has had this business for over six months. Her biggest wish is to be able to have her own place because now she sells in an itinerant manner.

She requested the loan to buy milk, sugar, bread, and eggs.

The Creciendo Unidos group is grateful to the Kiva lenders who made this loan possible. It allows them to continue improving.

Luz is the first on on the right, and she is wearing a purple shirt.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, bread, and eggs.

loans.name: Mehriya

texts.ru: Мехрия проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем и имеет 5 детей. У нее 3 сыновей и 2 дочери. Дети учатся в средней школе. Муж занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Мехрия серьезная и целеустремленная женщина. Она мастер швея. Мехрия в ателье предоставляет услуги портнихи на заказ. Ей нравится сшить национальное платье, и ежедневный доход, который она трудится. Мехрия  более 4 лет двигается на этой виде деятельностью. Ей нужно купить новую швейную машинку, чтоб увеличить свой доход. Мехрия обратилась за кредитом, потому что у нее нет денежных средств. Она заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
Mehriya lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 35 years old. She is married and has five children: three sons and two daughters. Daughters are in secondary school. Her husband does farm work. Mehriya is a serious and goal-oriented person. She works as a seamstress, taking custom orders in a workshop. Mehriya enjoys sewing traditional national dresses and earning an income in this way every day. 

Mehriya has been in this line of business for over four years. She needs to buy a new sewing machine so as to increase her earnings. She has applied for a loan because of lack of funds. She expresses her gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mombasa Group

texts.en:
JOHA in is her mid 50s. She is a divorcee with four children and all of them are grown up. She has been running two projects raising and selling broiler chickens and selling boiled eggs since 1986. She works from 6 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be JOHA's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy chicks and chicken feed and to increase her egg stock, and she has paid all her loans successfully. She is doing fine with the loans. She used the profit to install electricity in her house, to take care of herself, to repay back the loan and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her eggs to meet her customers' demand, and to buy chicks and chicken feed. She dreams of owning a clothes shop and a grocery store.

Joha will share this loan with her loan group MOMBASA which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her eggs to meet her customers' demand, and to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa familiar; vive en una zona rural, del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.Oyotún es una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura, ganadería, comercio.

David se dedica a brindar servicio de mototaxi; hace 3 años, con buenas referencias laborales y personales, él solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; mantenimiento de motor y compra de piezas para su mototaxi, lo que le va a permitir asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo, para poder seguir brindando un buen servicio, y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos, y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
20-year old David is single and doesn't have any children. He lives in the family home in a rural area located in Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast. The local people earn their living through agriculture, animal-raising, and business.

David has had a motorbike taxi service for three years. He has good work and personal references. He is seeking a loan to invest in his taxi business: maintenance of the engine and purchase of spare parts. These purchase will enable him to have a properly functioning taxi so he can continue offering a good service leading to increased income and an improved standard of living.

loans.use: provide maintenance of the engine and purchase of spare parts for his motorbike taxi

loans.name: Lucero

texts.es: Lucero es una joven de 20 años de edad, es soltera y vive muy feliz junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad que queda a las orillas del lago más bello del mundo. Lucero es una de las muchas personas que sus vidas son beneficiadas por los préstamos a los que tienen acceso, Lucero a pesar de ser muy joven ha logrado superarse, este logro ha sido posible por su gran entusiasmo a la vida, y cuenta que su tienda de abarrotes ya tiene más productos y con esta inversión ha logrado satisfacer mejor a sus clientes, con este avance ella está contenta más no conforme y ahora su deseo es comprar más productos para seguir incrementando su negocio, por lo que nuevamente solicita un préstamo con el que ella comprara productos como: azúcar, aceite, gaseosas y golosinas. Su esperanza de vida, es contar nuevamente con el préstamo para mejorar su negocio e incrementar sus ganancias para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: 20-year-old Lucero is single and lives very happily with her parents and brothers and sisters in a village on the shores of the most beautiful lake in the world. Lucero is one a the many people who have benefitted from the loans to which they have access. Although she is very young, Lucero has managed to make progress thanks to her great enthusiasm for life. She says that she now stocks a wider range of goods in her grocery shop and that her loan has enabled her to better satisfy her customers' demands. She is delighted to have made such progress and she now wants to buy more goods so she can continue expanding her business. So she is applying for another loan to buy products such as: sugar, oil, soft drinks and sweets. Her ambition is to obtain this second loan so she can expand her business and boost her income, which will enable her to look after her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as: sugar, oil, soft drinks and sweets.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 60 years old. He is a landlord at Ayidiki in the Greater Accra Region. He is married with four children. Philip's house lacks basic household toilet facility so he and his household and tenants use commercial toilet in Ayidiki.

Philip is requesting for a loan of GHC2944.00 to enable him to put up a toilet in his house. With this loan he will be able to buy building materials and toilet seats to construct the toilet.He is hopeful that this will enable his tenants and family to access the toilet at any time they want to. He will repay the loan out of the rent advance he receives from his tenants.

loans.use: to build a toilet facility for his household.

loans.name: Divino Nino Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACION COMUNAL DIVINO NIÑO ESTA CONFORMADA POR OCHO INTEGRANTES SIETE MUJERES Y UN HOMBRES MADRES Y PADRES DE FAMILIA RESPONSABLES DE QUINCE HIJOS, TODOS MEJORES DE EDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE LUGAR QUE SE  CARACTERIZA POR SER UNA ZONA PRODUCTORA DE LECHE, ESTAN PERSONAS HAN DEMOSTRADO SER RESPONSABLES, TRABAJADORAS, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PESRNAL, EN SUS CREDITOS ANTERIORES SE HA VISTO LA DICIPLINA DE PAGO EN LA PUNTALIDAD DE SUS CUOTAS EN TIEMPO Y FORMA, LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONOMICOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR  Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR A TEMPRANA EDAD PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.
LA CORDINADORA ES MARIBEL Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA PULPERIA ES UNA  PEQUEÑA TIENDA QUE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES COMO: ARROZ, FRIJOLES, AZUCAR, LECHE, PAN, GASEOSAS, GALLESTAS, ACEITES, JUGOS,  GASEOSAS ETC. ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNA DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO CON PRODUCTOS COMETIBLES PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS.
texts.en:
The Divino Niño communal bank is comprised of eight members, seven women and one man. They are responsible parents with 15 children, all adults. They are from El Sauce, which is known for being a milk producing area. They are people who have shown themselves to be responsible and hard-working. They have the desire for personal improvement.

With their previous loans they have had the discipline to make their payments punctually. Unfortunately, they were not able to go to school because of the lack of financial resources. They saw the need to work at an early age in order to help with the household expenses.

Maribel is the coordinator. She has a small grocery store where she sells food products like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, soft drinks, cookies, cooking oil, and juice, etc. She spends 12 hours a day on her business selling products.

The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business with grocery products. She will do this in order to be able to have better earnings in the near future.

loans.use: to buy grocery products like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, and soap, etc.

loans.name: Neema Kimara Group

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is in her early 50s and is married with two children. One of them is in school and the other one one is still small. She has been running several projects: working as a tailor, selling handbags and selling sewing products for sixteen years now. She works from 8 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mwanaidi's 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start selling handbags, to start selling sewing products, and she bought materials for making more dresses and suits to resell. She is doing great and managed to pay back all her loans successfully.

Mwanaidi used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, to buy a plot of land, and she covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy materials for her tailoring business, to buy handbags, and to sell sewing equipment. She dreams of expanding her business.

Mwanaidi will accountable for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business, to buy handbags, and to sell sewing equipment.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Cynthia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Valerio

texts.en:
Valerio is aged 54 years and single, with three children who all live in Bundibugyo Uganda. She grows and trades in cocoa, mainly buying and selling to agents and cocoa companies. She gets additional income from selling cassava flour in the markets.

She started the business in the year 2011 to raise income for the family and school fees for the children; her main challenge is limited capital. She hopes to expand the business, educate children and support the family in getting basic needs. Her family dream is to educate all her children and this compels her to work extra hard. She has asked for a loan to pay tuition for her son and enable him complete his course.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson wants another loan to pay school fees for his children and to improve his cocoa gardens. He is a 55-year-old married man who has seven children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been a farmer for over 20 years. His main hardships are inadequate capital, price fluctuations, and changes in seasons.

He has a dream of educating his children and building a permanent home for them, while his business goals are buying land to grow crops and hiring employees to help expand his business. These make him work tirelessly most of the day. Edson used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and labour for his cocoa plantation

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 34 years old married woman and lives in Kvareli district with her family. Nino works as a office-cleaner at a petrol station. Her husband works at local bakery and bakes bread.

Nino decided to start family business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 2000 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a car, her husband will drive the car and they will trade seasonal fruits and vegetables. Nino hopes that the business will be profitable and awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car in order to begin trade fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Living in a rural village in Kandal province, Phea is 46 years old and a married mother of three children, one of whom is in school. The primary source of her family’s income is from growing rice. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to get additional income. She has been involved in her job for 20 years and these businesses earn her around 10USD per day. She is able to save about 3USD each day after expenses.

Her rice has not grown well since it has been destroyed by insect pests. This is Phea’s first loan from VisionFund and she will use it to buy fertilizer and seed to increase her crop. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income so that she can buy enough household supplies and be able to keep sending her child to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to increase her crop yield to earn more income so that she can keep sending her child to school.

loans.name: Mouykea

texts.en:
Mouykea is aged 55 years and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She and her husband have worked very hard for years to support their big family by selling grocery items in the local area and planting cassava. Low cassava crops have been the main challenge for her business.

This is the fifth loan for Mouykea from VisionFund. Now requesting a loan of 2,000,000KHR, she is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cassava and use a portion of it to buy grocery items. She hopes that this loan will enable her to generate more income so as to improve her standard of living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her rice field in order to increase her rice products.

loans.name: Destiny Boarding School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Julius. He is the Director of Destiny Boarding Primary School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Mpigi with 500 students. Destiny Boarding School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Destiny Boarding School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Julius ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. .

loans.name: Kishiwar

texts.en:
KISHIWAR is aged 55. She is a mother of three daughters and three sons and she is living in Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband has grown old. He set up a general store when he was young but now stays at home due to weakness. Nowadays her son is handling all affairs regarding the general store; he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store; as well, his relatives like to purchase from his general store. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well.

Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Kishiwar requested a loan for her son so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. She hopes that her son will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the demands of her family. Kishiwar thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her son's general store.

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager living in Battambang province’s Bovel district, Sim is aged 45 years and married with seven children. She has been a rice farmer for six years, and she also sells grocery items in order to earn additional income for the family. The main challenge for her business is lack of working capital.

This is the first loan for Sim with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. Sim wants to use her portion to buy seeds, pesticides, and organic fertilizers for supporting her farmland in order to harvest more crops. She hopes to increase her farming production to generate more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides, and organic fertilizers to support her farmland in order to harvest more crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to boost her stock of groceries for sell.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is 34, married, and has 2 children. Her husband works as a laborer in Cairo and she has a small cleansers sales project. She is requesting a 3000 EGP loan to buy more cleansers, increase her sales and afford education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more cleansers for sale.

loans.name: Okesa

texts.en: Okesa is 34 years old with 3 children, and runs a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She requested a loan to buy a chainsaw, a backpack sprayer, banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals, to help her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2013, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw, a backpack sprayer, banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama est une femme qui est âgée de 50 ans  et qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses quatre enfants à charge. Ama vend des perles pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants grâce au bénéfice de son activité. Ama s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des paquets de perles, Ama demande ce prêt  pour financer son achat et avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ama is a woman aged 50 who lives in Adidogomé, raising her four children. She sells beads to cover the needs of her children, thanks to the profit from her business. She stocks up twice a month in the market.

To order some packets of beads, Ama is asking for this loan to finance her purchase and have a good profit margin to cover the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy nine packets of beads.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Oun is a 58-year-old mother of three dependent children. She and her husband are farmers who grow cassava and rice in the local area. Having been in the business for almost 40 years, she can earn daily income of approximately US$11 and is able to save about US$6 each day for the future needs.

This is the fourth loan for Oun with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She wisely and successfully used the first loans from VisionFund to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve financial burdens. Now she is seeking a new loan to buy fertilizer for her cassava and rice. She will also use some portion of the loan on labor fees. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice and cassava healthily and fruitfully and also hopes to earn more income to better her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava and rice, and she will also use some portion of the loan on labor fees.

loans.name: Feiloaiga

texts.en:
Feiloaiga is 52 years old with 2 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Feiloaiga requested a loan to buy banana tube seedlings, taro root seedlings, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals, chainsaw, and a knife to assist her in running the business.

She joined SPBD in 2012. She will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube and taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals, chainsaw, knife

loans.name: Martha Lucia

texts.es: Martha es una polifacética mujer de 41 años de edad, habitante de Chía un municipio de Cundinamarca que es reconocido por sus principales actividades económicas entre ellas la agricultura y la ganadería específicamente la lechera.  Martha aprovecho la riqueza de su región y su tradición familiar para dedicarse a la recolección de leche y además de esta labor también se dedica a la confección y clínica de ropa; servicio que ofrece sus vecinos, amigos y conocidos. La producción de leche que sus vacas le generan, es suministrada a recolectadoras del sector a quienes les factura para cancelar quincenalmente o de contado, según la preferencia del cliente. Martha desea que su negocio sea cada día más próspero y para ello necesita ampliar su capacidad de producción, por eso está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de dos vacas, así mismo en la legalización de las escrituras de su predio y saldar unas deudas. Con esta inversión podrá consolidar sus deudas y manejar un mejor flujo de efectivo.  Su meta a futuro es poder ser una competitiva productora de leche en la zona y tener un alrededor de 50 cabezas de ganado disponibles para su planta recolectora.
texts.en: 41-year-old Martha is a versatile woman. She lives in Chía, a town in Cundinamarca department which is known for its main business activities, which include agriculture and dairy farming. Martha took advantage of the riches of her region and her family tradition to work in milk production. She also makes and alters clothing, offering her services to neighbours, friends and acquaintances. The milk which her cows produce is supplied to local dealers who pay her fortnightly by invoice or in cash, depending on their preference. Martha would like to see her business become more successful every day and, if she is to achieve this, she needs to boost her output capacity. For this reason, she is applying to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for her first Kiva loan which she will use to buy two cows, pay for the deeds to her property to be authenticated and to pay off some debts. This investment will help will enable her to consolidate her debts and have better cash-flow. Her long-term ambition is to be a competitive milk producer in the area and to have about 50 cows available for her milk collection premises.

loans.use: to buy two cows, pay for the deeds to her property to be authenticated and to pay off some debts.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila engages in tailoring services. She caters services like dress making and dress adjustment respectively. She is a 55-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 30 and the youngest is 16 and still attending school. She has been engaged in tailoring services for more than 10 years now.

Cirila decided to request a loan to purchase materials like cloth and thread. It would allow her continue sewing more dresses and eventually improve her earnings. She would be able to settle her obligations and handle her finances. She could also provide her family with nutritious diets.

In the future, Cirila could start to do the necessary improvement to make her tailoring more business more productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase materials like cloth and thread.

loans.name: Yawa  Delali

texts.fr: Yawa est une femme mariée âgée de 49 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mère de cinq enfants, Yawa est une marchande de friperies et des sacs qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Yawa demande ce prêt pour commander des unités d’habits, des culottes et des jupes afin de répondre aux attentes de ses clients et gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Yawa is a 49-year old married woman who lives in Tokoin. The mother of five children, Yawa sells used clothes and bags. She gets her purchases once per month at the market and resells in front of her house.

Yawa is requesting this loan to order units of clothes, underpants and skirts in order to respond to her clients' expectations and earn a good profit margin so she can help her children in their school education.

loans.use: to buy 100 units of clothing, 70 units of underpants and 70 units of skirts.

loans.name: Hasrat

texts.en:
Hasrat is a 24 year old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother with a son. She is a good housewife and looks after her family.

Hasrat's husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for many years. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly due to regular usage. He feels that most of its parts are out of order, so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Therefore, Hasrat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business.

Hasrat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Chamroen's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Phnom Proek district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living, Chamroen, 37, is married with two children. She and her husband grow cassava as the main business for the family’s income. Having been in the business for five years, they can earn about US $10 per day to respond to the family’s needs and manage to save about US $5. The lack of working capital for operating her business is the main challenge for her.

Chamroen has never been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, before. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farm land and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to increase crop yields to earn a larger income so as to better her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor.

loans.name: Sokheak

texts.en:
Sokheak, 41, is living in a wooden house located in Kratie province and she has three dependent children who are in school. She has done rice farming to support her family’s living condition for 23 years. Because a flood affected her crop she will get lower yield and she is able to earn income only about $10 USD per day. After offsetting expenses, she can save around $4 USD each day.

After successfully repayng her previous one loan, Sokheak is now requesting this second loan with VisionFund. She will manage her loan to buy seed and pay for labor fees to produce a good yield. She hopes that she can get a high yield to make more income and upgrade her standard of living to be better than last year.

loans.use: to buy seed and pay labor fees.

loans.name: Benkadi-Santoro I Group

texts.fr: NANA est celle qui posa sa main droite sur le sac  à riz. Elle est une commerçante malienne et est âgée de 38 ans ; courageuse . NANA n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école. Elle est mariée et mère de six(06) enfants (01 Garçon et 05 Filles) dont trois(03) scolarisés ; et leurs âges sont entre 03 à 20 ans. NANA fait recours à IMF (RMCR) pour acheter plus sacs de riz. Elle s’approvisionne  et vend dans la même localité. Le prêt l’aide à soutenir son mari pour les charges familiales et la réussite de leurs enfants à l’école. Elle fait l’achat de riz en sacs et en tonnes pour sa vente.  NANA exerce cette activité il y a  19 ans .La vente et le paiement immédiat font son  plaisir dans cette activité. Par contre, le non-paiement de la part de certaine clientèle est l’obstacle auquel elle se heurte souvent dans son activité. De nos jours. Elle souhaiterait  construire un  magasin pour ses stocks à courts-termes pour la progression de son activité dans les jours à avenirs.
texts.en:
Nana is the woman whose right hand is on the bag of rice. She is a Malian trader and is 38 years old; she is brave. Nana did not have the opportunity to go to school. She is married and mother to six children (one boy and five girls), three of whom go to school; their ages range between 3 and 20 years.

Nana is resorting to an IMF (RMCR) to buy more bags of rice. She gets her supplies and sells in the same locality. The loan helps her to support her husband with the family's expenses and their children's success in school.

Nana purchases rice by the bag and by tonnes for her sales. She has been undertaking this activity for 19 years. She enjoys the sales and immediate payments in her activity. However, non-payment by certain clients is the obstacle that she often encounters in her activity these days.

She wishes to build a store for her short-term stocks for the growth of her activity in the days to come.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice for resale.

loans.name: Ameto  Francisca

texts.fr: Ameto est une femme âgée de 55 ans qui vit à Tokoin avec ses trois enfants à charge. Ameto est mariée et est une revendeuse des perles. Ameto s’approvisionne et revend une fois par mois au marché et dans les quartiers environnant. Pour commander des perles en argiles et des épingles et des fil. Ameto sollicite ce crédit pour financer son approvisionnement et avoir un gain pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Ameto is a 55-year old woman who lives in Tokoin and takes care of three children. Ameto is married and is a bead reseller. Ameto gets her supplies and resells once per month at the market and in surrounding neighbourhoods. She wants to order clay beads and pins and thread. Ameto is requesting this loan to finance her purchase and make a profit to take care of her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy six bags of clay beads, six units of pins and forty units of thread.

loans.name: Pesseli

texts.fr: Pesseli est une femme âgée de 41 ans résidant à Tokoin. Mariée, Pesseli vit avec son enfant et son mari. Pesseli est une revendeuse  de chaussures qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pesseli demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat des unités de chaussures fermées, nu pied dame et nu pied enfant en vue de gagner des bénéfices et pouvoir aider son mari à bien prendre soin de leur enfant dans son éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Pesseli is a 41-year old woman living in Tokoin. Married, Pesseli lives with her child and her husband. Pesseli resells shoes, she gets her supplies once per month at the market and resells in front of her home. She is requesting this credit to complete her purchase of units of closed shoes, ladies' open shoes and kids' open shoes in order to earn profits and be able to help her husband to take good care of their child's school education.

loans.use: to buy 15 units of closed shoes, 15 units of ladies' open shoes and 25 units of kids' open shoes.

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en: Jackie is 18 years old from Ura, Dilasag, Aurora. She is taking up a 9-month Microfinance Technology Course. She wants to finish her studies to help her family out of poverty. Because her parents cannot fully sustain her schooling, she wants to avail an education loan of PHP 43,000 to pay for her own school expense. She is hopeful that KIVA lenders will approve her loan so she is able to continue her education.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Moko

texts.fr: Mariée, Moko a à sa charge trois enfants. Moko est âgée de 42 ans et habite à Tokoin où elle vend  des produits alimentaires. Moko s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar au bord de la route. Moko sollicite ce crédit pour commander des bols de farines de manioc et des cartons de tomates vue de gagner des bénéfices et pouvoir soutenir aux besoins de sa famille  puis améliorer ses conditions de vie quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Moko is married and has three children in her care. She is 42 years old and lives in Tokoin, where she sells food products. Moko stocks up twice a month at the market and resells her goods under an awning along the highway. 

Moko is seeking this loan to stock up on bowls of manioc (cassava) flour and boxes of tomatoes to resell. In this way she will earn a revenue and will be able to provide for her family and improve her life conditions.

loans.use: to buy eight bowls of cassava flour and two boxes of tomatoes.

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
Esterlina engages in farming; she toils on the land and grows rice. She is 57 year old and a married woman with 10 children. Five of her children are still attending school. She has been engaged in farming for more than 10 years now. Her husband is also a farmer. She decided to take a loan to support her farming livelihood.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides. This is very vital. It will help improve the yield of her farm, thus her earnings will increase and she can start to settle her finances. She could also continue support the schooling of her children for a brighter tomorrow.

She is determined that her rice farming will become productive and sustainable as a source of income for the improvement of the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her rice farm.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Мухайё 35 лет, она проживает в городе под названием Худжанд. У Мухайё трое детей. Она в течение 7 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды в национальном стиле. В месяц Мухайё может сшить даже 25 платья. Мухайё прекрасно справляется со своей работой и количество клиентов постепенно возрастают. Мухайё обратилась за кредитом, потому что ей необходимо поменять швейную машинку, потому она уже не рабочем состояние, и прослужила очень долгое время, еще она хочет купить оверлок, Мухайё хочет сделать вышивки на платьях, чтобы привлечь себе больше клиентов. Новая швейная машинка и оверлок стоит дорого, чтобы их купить Мухайё потребуется еще не большое количество денег. Она решила приобрести за счет кредита.
texts.en:
Muhayo is 35 and lives in the city of Khujand. She has three children. She has been sewing women's clothing in the national style for seven years. In a good month she can sew 25 dresses. She does a wonderful job on her work and her number of customers is constantly growing.

Muhayo is looking for a loan because she needs to upgrade her sewing machine - her old one isn't working anymore after long years of service. She also wants to buy an overlocker. She wants to do embroidery on dresses in order to attract more customers. A new sewing machine and overlocker will be expensive, and she needs a decent amount of money to buy them. She has decided to borrow money for this.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and an overlocker

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr: FATIMATA est celle qui tient le bidon d’huile. Elle est instruite et titulaire du Brevet de technicien deuxième partie(BT2) en comptabilité. Elle est  une commerçante malienne.  FATIMATA exerce l’activité du commerce il y a six(06) ans de cela, lorsqu’elle s’est séparée de son conjoint .Elle est mère d’un enfant (Garçon)  âgé de   12 ans. Cette cliente est  dévouée et courageuse. De nos jours FATIMATA à 33 ans. Elle  fait recours  au RMCR  parce que sa possibilité financière est faible.
