Elle s’approvisionne dans les milieux lointains et vend  dans sa localité. FATIMATA  achète des bidons d’huile en cartons et des sacs de lait en poudre pour sa vente. Le prêt l’aide à couvrir ses charges prioritaires et  la réussite de son seul enfant à l’école. De plus elle préfère construire en dur dans les jours  à venir.  La vente et le paiement immédiat font son plaisir dans cette activité. Par contre, le non-paiement de la part de sa clientèle, et  le retard que prennent les marchandises  sont les obstacles auxquels elle se heurte  souvent dans son activité. Pour le moment, elle n’a subi aucune influence du prêt sur  son activité, sa vie personnelle ou celle de sa famille. Elle souhaiterait  avoir une boutique personnelle au marché  ou au quartier de sa localité pour pouvoir bien progresser  dans  son activité de vente d’huile
texts.en:
Fatimata is the one who is holding the jug of oil. She is educated and holds a BT2 degree (Brevet de technicien deuxième partie) in accounting. She is a small-scale retailer from Mali. Fatimata has been working in retailing for six years, ever since she separated from her spouse. She is the mother of a child (a boy) aged 12. She is 33 years old at present and is dedicated and courageous.

Fatimata has come to RMCR because her financial possibility is weak. She stocks up in distant areas and resells in her location. She buys jugs of oil by the case and sacks of powdered milk for resale.

The loan allows her to cover her urgent expenses and the success of her only child in school. Moreover, she would prefer to build a house of concrete in the coming days. Making sales and getting immediate payment is her pleasure in this business. On the other hand, if her customers don't pay or she gets her merchandise late, these are obstacles she encounters in her activity.

For the moment, she has experienced no influence of the loan on her business, on her personal life or that of her family. She would like to have her own shop at the market or in her neighborhood so that she could really make progress with her sales of oil.

loans.use: to buy some jugs of oil and bags of milk to resell.

loans.name: Charlotte  Agossi

texts.fr: Veuve femme de 62 ans, Charlotte habite à Tokoin avec ses deux enfants à charge. Malgré son âge avancé, Charlotte achète et revend des habits confectionné en pagne pour gagner son revenu. Charlotte s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend en se promenant dans les quartiers. Charlotte fait recourt à ce crédit pour commander des unités d’habits et des habits complets en vue d’avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
A 62-year-old widow, Charlotte lives in Tokoin with two children for whom is responsible. In spite of her age, Charlotte buys and resells clothing made out of "pagne"cloth in order to make an income.

Charlotte purchases supplies four times a month at the market and resells the clothing walking in the neighborhoods.

Charlotte is requesting this loan to order units of clothing and complete outfits with the goal of having a sizable stock and maximizing her profits in order to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy 28 units of clothing and 5 units of complete outfits.

loans.name: Tiaina

texts.en: Tiaina is 57 years old with five children. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community. She has been doing this for more than a year. Tiaina requested a loan to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedling), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals to help her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2010 and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals,

loans.name: Khakimjon

texts.ru: Хакимжон 37 летный мужчина. Он один из жителей района Шахритус. Все жители района Шахритус занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. У кого-то земельный участок, который выращивает растение, а некатором еще домашнее животное, который выращивает скота. В районах и селах Республики Таджикистан, отличная и прекрасная погода для сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Свежий воздух, свежая трава для корма скота, и чистая вода. Хакимжон женат. Он проживает вместе женой и детьми. Его деятельность является основной, потому что его семья тоже занимается этой деятельностью. Хакимжон в этом году хочет посадит. И готовится к новому посеву урожай. Ему нужно обработать землю минеральными удобрениями. Он запрашивает кредит для минеральных удобрений и семена лук. Хакимжон хочет, чтобы Вы ему помогли финансам, и он будет рад на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Khakimjon is 37 and a resident of the Shahrituz region. Everyone in this region works in farming. Some people have agricultural land where they grow crops, while others raise livestock. Tajikistan's regions and villages have excellent, wonderful weather for agriculture: fresh air, fresh grass for feeding livestock, and clean water.

Khakimjon is married. He lives with his wife and his children. He and his family work together on his business. This year he wants to do some planting and to prepare to plant new crops. He needs to amend the soil with mineral fertilizers. He is requesting a loan for mineral fertilizers and onion seeds. He wants you to help him financially, and will be grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and onion seeds

loans.name: Ioana

texts.en: Ioana is 52 years old with six children. She runs a business selling ice cake in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. She hopes to expand her business, but in order to do that, Ioana  requested a loan to buy an ice bag, a sack of sugar, coolio, plastic bags, containers, and a cooler  to assist her to run the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy an ice bag, a sack of sugar, coolio, plastic bags, containers, and a cooler.

loans.name: Telma Rina

texts.es: Telma es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora de 49 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia con su hijo de 2 años de edad. Telma se dedica a la venta de comida a unas personas que están cerca de su vivienda, así como a lavar y planchar ajeno es así que ella ha logrado salir adelante. Ella desea hacer la construcción de su vivienda y ya tiene algunos materiales para eso pero necesita un complemento para la compra de otros materiales por lo que está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para la inversión de cemento, hierro y grava para poder iniciar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Telma is an enterprising and very hardworking woman.  She is 49 years old and lives in her own home with her two-year-old child.  Telma works selling food to some people near her home.  She also goes out to wash and iron; in this way she has managed to get by.  

She wants to work on the construction of her home.  She already has some of the materials for this but needs a supplement in order to buy other materials.  This is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI: to invest in cement, rebar, and gravel to be able to begin the construction on her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, rebar, and gravel in order to begin construction on her house.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald, 30 years old, has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000. He runs a motorcycle taxi (bodaboda) service and earns additional income from coffee farming. Ronald is a well-known, hard-working businessman in Kabaare-Ishaka, Bushenyi District. He works 10 hours a day. Ronald started this business in 2007 to earn a living. He says he will use this loan funds to purchase a motorcycle to improve his transport business. He aims to buy a car some day so that he can increase his profit. He said his main challenge is price fluctuation.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap is 45 years, married, and has four children. She and her husband are rice farmers, which they have been doing for 10 years. They earn additional income working for others for a fee. The main challenge for her family’s business is insufficient working capital. 

Sopheap is the leader of Sopheap’s Group, which consists of two members. Sopheap is requesting her first loan from VisionFund Cambodia, which she will use to buy pesticides and seeds for her rice farm. She hopes to grow more crops to sell for a good price to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and seeds for her rice farm

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov is 54 years old, married and lives in a wooden house located in Battambang province’s Phnom Prpek district. She has six children, one still in school. Pov has been selling grocery items while her husband works as a paid worker. Together, they can earn about $20 (USD) per day. Lacking working capital to support her business is Pov's main challenge.  
Pov has had three loans with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely repaid the past loans which have helped her relieve her family’s financial burden and generate more income. She is leading her group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she buy more grocery items for resale and use some of it to renovate her store. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Los Hijos De Dios Group

texts.es: La Sra. María tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos que aun dependen de ella. Tiene como negocio la compra y venta de artículos usados como refrigeradora, lavadora, cocinas, etc. que con la ayuda del esposo implementaron hace algunos años un pequeño taller en casa donde pueden mejorar y vender sus artículos, es por ello que el préstamo lo invertirá en comprar más artículos usados para poder mejorarlos y venderlos a un muy buen precio, es así como María viene trabajando arduamente no solo en su negocio sino también en el grupo “Los Hijos de Dios” que ella representa desde hace algunos años de manera responsable. Uno de sus nuevos objetivos es implementar otro taller donde pueda ofrecer el servicio de costura de todo tipo de prendas de vestir. En la foto grupal María se encuentra de pie en medio de sus demás compañeros sentados.
texts.en:
Sra. María is 39 years old, married, and has two dependent children. She has a business of buying and selling used appliances such as refrigerators, washing machines, stoves, and other items. With the help of her husband, she was able to establish a small shop in their house a few years ago. This gave them a place where they could refurbish and sell these items. María is requesting a loan so that she can invest in more used appliances that she can refurbish and sell at a good price.

Not only has she been working hard at her business, but also as a member of her group “Los Hijos de Dios” (The Children of God) which she has represented in a responsible manner for the past few years. One of her new goals is to open another shop where she can offer sewing services for producing all types of clothes. In the group photo, María is the one standing among the other group members who are seated.

loans.use: to buy used appliances that she can sell.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 47-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband sells fodder in a nearby village. Here, most of the people keep cattle in their houses for producing milk. Due to the upcoming Eid festival the demand for cattle fodder will increase. Eid is the second most important Islam festival and people purchase cattle so they can sacrifice them on Eid day. To feed their cattle the people require fodder.
Naseem has requested a loan to help her husband buy fodder in bulk to meet the rapid increase in demand. In this way; he can benefit from the higher seasonal business and can purchase bright cloth for his children to celebrate Eid festival.
Naseem is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for this support.

loans.use: to buy fodder in bulk for her husband's fodder shop.

loans.name: Chicken Run - N07Nbảnvhòa Group

texts.en:
Dậu is 58 years old and married. 
She has been working in agriculture, raising poultry for more than 10 years.
Dậu lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in her village and the market need is low in this region. Income from this business is unstable because when disease on poultry happens, they could die leaving her nothing to sell.
The main hardship that Dậu faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry to raise and sell in the future.
In 2014, Dậu joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Dậu has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the Chicken Run - N07NBảnVHòa Group which consists of five members.
In the future, Dậu hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her children, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Kayi est une femme mariée âgée de 55 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Kayi est une revendeuse de fournitures scolaire qui s’approvisionn deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Kayi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des paquets d’écritoires et de carton de cahiers. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Kayi compte réinvestir dans cette activité qui rapporte bien ces derniers moments de fin des vacances scolaires puis aider son mari à payer les frais scolaire des enfants dès la rentrée.
texts.en:
The mother of three children, Kayi is a married woman aged 55 who lives in Tokoin. She sells school supplies and stocks up twice a month at the market, reselling in front of her house.

Kayi is requesting this loan to order packets of writing boards and a carton of notebooks. With the profit she will earn, Kayi is intending to reinvest in this activity which allows her to earn well at the end of school vacation, then help her husband to pay the school fees of their children at the start of this new school year.

loans.use: to buy 10 packets of writing boards and one carton of exercise books.

loans.name: Jumaboy

texts.ru: Чумъабой житель сельской местности в возрасте 64 лет. Чумъабой родился и вырос в селе и с юных лет занимается разведением скота. С детства отец научил его правильно ухаживать за скотом и этот опыт очень ему пригодился в дальнейшем. Повзрослев  Чумъабой сам смог купить пару голов скота и начать бизнес. Постепенно он стал расширять свое стадо и на данный момент у Чумъабоя 6 голов взрослого скота. Каждую неделю Чумъабой посещает скотные рынки и покупает молодняк, откормив несколько месяцев,  он их перепродает за более высокую цену. Жена во всем помогает мужу по хозяйству. Ухаживает за скотом и в отсутствие мужа выводит пастись в поле. Дополнительно Чумъабой занимается земледелием, у него есть участок земли и там он выращивает клевер и кукурузу. Сейчас из за упадка цены на скот Чумъабой не может продать свой готовый скот. На накопленные деньги он уже успел закупить корм для скота,  и на покупку молодняка у него не хватило денег. С данной проблемой он решил обратиться в «АРВАНД» за поддержкой. На полученные деньги Чумъабой хочет закупить несколько голов молодого скота.
texts.en: Jumaboy is 64 years old and lives in the countryside. Jumaboy was born and raised in the village and since his youth has bred livestock. His father taught him how to properly care for cattle when he was a child, and this knowledge and experience has proved useful to Jumaboy over the years. When he grew up Jumaboy was able to buy a few head of cattle and start his own business. Slowly he began to grow his herd and now he has six adult cattle. Every week Jumaboy visits cattle markets and purchases a calf, fattens it up for a few months, and resells it at a higher price. His wife helps him with everything on the farm. She looks after the cattle and when her husband is away she takes them to the fields to graze. Jumaboy also farms clover and corn on a small plot of land. Now, because the price of cattle has fallen, Jumaboy cannot realize a profit on his fattened cattle. From his savings he has managed to purchase feed for the cattle, but he doesn't have enough money to purchase any calves. To solve this problem he decided to turn to MDO Arvand for support. With the loan Jumaboy wants to purchase a few calves.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es: Reina de 40 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo con el cual se esfuerzan por mantener en buen estado su vivienda para sus 4 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo y hace costuras y con eso ella se apoya con su compañero para mantener la economia de su hogar. Reina desea hacer unas divisiones en la vivienda para definir las habitaciones de cada uno es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, grava, hierro, cemento y ladrillos para hacer la mejora en su vivienda y tener mayor comodidad y privacidad en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Reina is 40 years of age and lives in her own home with her husband. They both make every effort to maintain a good standard of living for their four children.

Reina sells products by catalog and does sewing. By means of these activities she helps her companion maintain their household economy.

Reina wishes to make some divisions in their home to define better each person's living area. For that purpose, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in sand, gravel, construction iron, cement, and bricks. She wants to make these improvements in order to provide greater comfort and privacy in her home.

loans.use: to invest in sand, gravel, iron, cement, and bricks to make improvements in her home.

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.ru: Это Саноат. Она из города Душанбе. Ей 50 лет. Саноат замужем и мать двоих сыновей. Старший сын  женат, но он вместе отцом и младшим братом находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. У Саноат хороший характер и она приятно общения женщина. Саноат 2 года назад начала заниматься шитьем женской одежды. В начале работы ей было нелегко заниматься швеей. Сейчас у нее хорошо получается, она уже набрала опыта. В день она шьет 2-3 одежды. Саноат шьет одно платье за 25-35 TJS. Она просит кредит для купли швейную машинку. Потому что ее нынешняя швейная машинка хорошо не выполняет свои функции. За счет сумму от кредита Саноат решила купить новую швейную машинку, чтобы улучшить процесс работы и ежедневный доход. Она нуждается на Вашу поддержку. Саноат заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: This is Sanoat. She is 50 years old and lives in Dushanbe. Sanoat is married and the mother of two children. Her older son is married but he, along with his father and younger brother, are working abroad in Russia. Sanoat has a good nature and is a pleasant and agreeable woman. Two years ago Sanoat began sewing women's clothing. At the beginning, the work was not easy. Now it is going well, and she has gained some experience. She sews 2-3 dresses per day. She makes a dress for approximately 25-25 TJS. She has applied for a loan to buy a new sewing machine because her current machine isn't working very well. With her loan she has decided to purchase a new machine, to improve the working process and her daily income. She needs your support. Sanoat expresses her gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Savoern's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Kratie province’s Sambour district, Savoern is now 43 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are in school while the other one is too young for school.

Savoern is farmer who grows rice as her main business to support the family while her husband is a house construction worker. Having been in their businesses for twenty-seven years, they are able to make daily earning of 7 US$ and manage to save about 4 US$ each day.

This is the second loan for Savoern with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely repaid the first loan and used the profit to better support her family. Now she is forming a new group to seek a loan. Savoern, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her rice growing and also grow her crops healthily to make more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is married and a resident of Bundibugyo, Uganda. He became a cocoa trader so as to earn an income to support his family. The cocoa business is dependent on the seasons, and most people in the area are also into the cocoa business. So there is a lot of competition when cocoa is in season.

But Richard is determined to promote his business and serve the cocoa agents in his area. He used his previous loan of 1,000,000 UGX obtained through Kiva's field partner HOFOKAM to pay for labor on his cocoa plantation, which enabled him to harvest more cocoa. He has now applied for a 3,000,000 UGX loan to buy cocoa to sell as well. Richard farms cocoa and also buys cocoa from other farmers to supplement the amount he sells to the agents.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell to local agents.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en: Leonardo, 50 years old, is a loving husband and father of three children. He has two sons (23 years old and 19 years old) and a young girl who is only three years old. He lives with all his family in a house that he owns. He provides for them by running his grocery store with his wife. He works 15 hours per day in order to be able to support his family, and he thinks that his store could do better and get him a brighter future. But to make this dream possible, he needs to increase his stock, which means buying more products to sell such as sodas, groceries, ham, cheese, milk and vegetables. In order to buy these, he is asking for a 5,000,00 MXN loan. He has enough solvencies to repay it, and has all the power of will that he requires to succeed in this project.

loans.use: to increase his stock

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas de Santa Rosa está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, son de la ciudad de San Pedro, una zona aun en crecimiento, eminentemente rural, son mujeres muy sacrificadas y luchadoras.
La Sra. Idalina, una de las integrantes empezó con un pequeño negocio de despensa, que va creciendo en forma constante gracias a su esfuerzo en busca de una mejoría para su familia. Es una mujer muy sacrificada que se está esforzando por crecer en el pequeño emprendimiento que hace.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su negocio con productos variados, como ser verduras, carnes, panificados, lácteos y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, y agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group named “Mujeres Unidas de Santa Rosa” (Unified Women of Santa Rosa) is in its second loan cycle as part of the Women’s Committee Program. The members are from the city of San Pedro, a growing area that is predominantly rural. These women are self-sacrificing and determined.

Sra. Idalina, one of the members, started a small store as her business. It is constantly growing thanks to the effort she puts forth to make improvements for her family. Idalina is a self-sacrificing woman who is striving to grow the small business that she established. She is requesting a loan in order to restock her business with various products such as vegetables, meats, baked goods, dairy goods, and other items. This will allow her to continue her work just as before.

Idalina appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, baked goods, dairy goods, and other products.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolas tiene 50 años de edad, vive con conyuge, en casa propia de material rústico de un piso, ubicada en la zona rural del caserio La Succha; distrito Santo Tomas, Provincia Cutervo, Region Cajamarca, Sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Nicolás es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 ha. Variedad catimor resistente a enfermedades y plagas. Tambien cria y vende de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, platano, viticas, menestras y otros).El destino del crédito sera para mantenimiento y cultivo de 1 ha. de café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendra mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 50 years old, and lives with his spouse in their rustic one-story home; they are located in the small rural village of La Succha, within the Santo Tomas district, of the Cutervo province, and the Cajamarca region - in the northern Sierra of Peru.

Nicolas makes a living through the cultivation of coffee. To date he has one hectare of the Catimor variety of coffee, which is resistant to diseases and pests. He also raises and sells small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and others), and grows staple crops (cassava, plantains, chia, beans and others).

The purpose of this loan will be to maintain and cultivate his hectare of coffee that is in production. This will ensure good production for the 2016 season, and will be reflected in his higher volume of sales. Thus Nicolas will attain a higher income in order to improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee farm.

loans.name: Israel

texts.en:
Israel is a 43-year-old man, who currently lives with his girlfriend and their 5-year-old son. He is a hardworking person who makes a living by selling bales of clothing with his brother in a street market stand. They import the bales clothing from the U.S.A.. and they are both commited people who have managed to create a business that is able to provide for their families.

Israel and his brother agreed it is time to expand their business, so they are looking to buy bigger bales of clothing. In order to do this, Israel decided to ask for a 10,000 MXN loan.

This is a thrilling case for Kubo and Kiva, because Israel has only had services and communication credits, meaning that he has not been able to get a loan elsewhere due to his lack of credit history.

The Kubo loan is going to be his first real chance to build a serious credit history. Kubo is confident that he has the solvency to repay the loan and to make his business bigger and more prosperous.

loans.use: to increase his stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Level

texts.en:
Level is 24 years old with two children. She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years.

Level requested a loan to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, and a backpack sprayer, to assist her in running the business.

She joined SPBD in 2012 and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace and her group members are so excited about their previous loan and thank Kiva Lenders for supporting them. Grace, in particular, used her previous loan to purchase chicken breeds that have now started laying eggs. She also used part of her money to establish a maize garden from which she yielded enough maize for food and sold part of it for household income. As a single mother, Grace has big plans for the future. She wants to educate all her children up to the university level and ensure that she has a sustainable source of income for her household. 

Grace is therefore requesting a second loan so as to prepare for her next farming season. She plans to use this loan to expand their gardens, buy good quality seeds and farm inputs so as to double their yields. Grace's future plan as a group is to expand her poultry project and increase her savings in the Village Savings group from which other vulnerable women can benefit.

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds, pesticides, herbicides and fertilizers for their farming enterprises.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is requesting a loan of $ 1000.00 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as slippers, candies, salt, sugar, coffee, detergent and other things to sell. Rosita started to open her kiosk in 2005 with her own working capital of $ 200.00. She is happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as slippers, candies, salt,  sugar, coffee, detergent and other things to sell.

loans.name: Gye Nyame Group

texts.en: There are four women who are involved in this group, including Ami (60), Veronica (45), Bernice (44), and Hannah (44). The group members are independent and hardworking women. They operate businesses in order to bring in extra money for their families. They are into businesses in charcoal, fried yams, potatoes, fish, groceries, flour, margarine, and eggs. Hannah was appointed as the group representative, and she is old enough to work hard and get enough for her family. Hannah is married and has four children, and all are attending school. The group needs the total amount of GHS 3,200 to help them improve their businesses. Hannah needs a loan to buy more flour, margarine and sugar to be sold to her customers. This loan is really helpful because they can add more things to their businesses, and as a result, their incomes will be increased.

loans.use: to buy more flour, margarine and sugar to be sold to her customers.

loans.name: Prossy's Group

texts.en:
For 13 years I have participated in farming; I had never yielded 3 tons of maize, not even 240 Kgs of beans!" Prossy explained when interviewed by the YICE field team! She attributes this achievement to YICE's trainings on farming, and a small loan from Kiva lenders! She used her income from her good harvest to pay up her loan and buy a cow. 
Prossy is so excited about her last season harvest and can't wait to prepare for the coming major season. 
She is therefore asking for a new loan to rent new land, to pay for local laborers, and good quality seeds and fertilizer. Prossy believes, with an expanded garden, she will be able to double her income, buy her own land and start a piggery project. Her dream is to become a leading female farmer in her community

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and access more training on better farming methods.

loans.name: Ibodullo

texts.ru: Ибодулло 34 летный мужчина района Шахритус. Он семейный человек. У него двое дети. Дети учатся в средней школе. Жена домохозяйка, она занимается во дворе сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Сам Ибодулло трудолюбивый и честный муж и отец. Он имеет коровник, где  выращивает крупнорогатого скота. 3 года Ибодулло занимается купли продажей скота. Он покупает скота и откармливает несколько месяцев, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке. Его научил заниматься этим видом деятельностью его отец. Ибодулло решил идти по его стопам. Он хочет купить несколько скота, и увеличить поголовье скота и за счет этого увеличить доход от животноводческой деятельности. Ибодулло обратился к Вам за кредитом, потому что он верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Ibodullo is a 34 year old man from the Shahrituz district. He is a family man with two children in secondary school. His wife is a homemaker and works the land around their house. Ibodullo himself is a hardworking and honest man and father. He has a small barn where he raises cattle. He has been buying and selling livestock for three years, which involves him buying the animals, feeding them for several months, and then selling them at the livestock market. His father trained him in this business and Ibodullo decided to follow in his footsteps. He would like to buy a few animals to expand his herd and thus increase his income from animal husbandry. Ibodullo is asking you for a loan because he believes in you and your support.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Blanca Mirian

texts.es: Blanca de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde ahce 10 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca is 43 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and daughter. She has a small store in her home that she has managed for the past 10 years. Blanca has many customers because of the good prices she offers and the friendliness that she demonstrates when making a sale. With the income she earns, Blanca is able to cover some of her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snack foods, sweet bread, and other products. As a result, she will be able to have more income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snack foods, sweet bread, and other products.

loans.name: Marel

texts.en: Marel is 18 years old from Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya. She is taking up a 9-month Microfinance Technology course in ASKI Skills and Knowledge Institute. Even though that her parents are earning, she said that it is not enough because her other siblings are also going to school. With that, Marel wants to avail an education loan of PHP43,000 so she can support her own schooling.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee in Microfinance Technology

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 63 years old and is from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Feliciano, a fisherman. She is thankful to God that even with their limited income, they were able to raise their children well. They already have families of their own. 

She has been running her store for five years already, and its earnings greatly helped cover their daily sustenance. She sells dry and packaged commodities directly to consumers. All products are essential food and household items. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  

To compete well with other stores nearby, she is humbly asking for a PHP 25,000 loan to fill her store with canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, soda, toiletries, etc. Although there are times when her sales are low, she is confident that her sales will pick up once customers see that she offers more grocery items.

As any small general store owner does, she dreams of having a big grocery store someday. She prays for God's abundance in their senior years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Rollan

texts.en:
Rollan is thankful that he received financial assistance thrice which really helped sustain his food business. His earnings are a big help in his daily sustenance. he may not be rich but he is blessed with a supportive wife. He, with his wife, has been making "puto pao," which is a steamed Filipino mini rice cake made from rice flour with meat filling, for eight years already.

He trusts that he can still avail of a PHP 50,000 loan to buy rice flour, pork and seasonings to make several pieces of "puto pao". He is glad that he has already established quite a number of customers in his community who make regular orders. He thanks CCT and Kiva for their noble cause of giving spiritual and financial support to small businessmen like him.

He aims to sell more "puto pao". He prays for good health and to see his offspring finish college. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy rice flour, pork and seasonings for his food business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 25 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling beauty products.

Evelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 53 years old and married with five children.

Emelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emelita has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling beauty products.

Emelita aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashewnuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashewnuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashewnuts

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is 36 years old and caring mother of four children, who is working hard to provide a good education for her children.
Her husband is running a small business which is selling candies to the stores, but he is not able to cover all the expenses of his family and because Ola believes that she has to help him, because the marriage is like a partnership in the bad and good life.

She started to sell candies and more to the family and neighbors located at her home to be able stay near of her children to care of them. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of candies and more kinds of products because of that she applied for a loan.
She needs your support to provide living for her big family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of candies and more kinds of products

loans.name: Tuti. A

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Tuti A, who is a 25-year-old married woman with one son. Tuti is a housewife and her husband has been an employee for four years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah.

This loan will be used to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Tuti will be able to repay the loan received. She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is married with two children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a 25-year-old married woman, who lives in a populated area with her husband who knows about people's needs in this area. He is a market vendor who sells seasonal fruits from his place in a central bazaar and also from his home. He has a few years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers.

Esha's husband chose this business because it is profitable and brings in a stable income. People use fresh fruits every day and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of fruits. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he could sell the maximum amount of fruits till evening and get maximum reward for his efforts.
Esha applied for a loan so her husband can purchase more seasonal fruits and thus increase his monthly turnover. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more seasonal fruits for her husband's fruit selling business.

loans.name: Vaega

texts.en: Vaega is 32 years old and single. He runs a small business selling ice cake in his community to earn a living. He has been doing this for more than a year. Vaega requested a loan to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, an ice bag, coolio, and a container to help him run the business. He will use his profit to expand his business. He joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, an ice bag, coolio, and a container

loans.name: Leleaga

texts.en:
Leleaga is a 55-year-old mother with 5 children. She owns and operates a business of selling pancake, pork cake, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. Leleaga requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, and a fry pan to assist her run the business.

She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, and a fry pan.

loans.name: Salameh

texts.en:
Salameh is a 54-year-old, married man from Gaza City, in Gaza Strip. He lives with his family in a small, old house, where he is the only breadwinner for his family.

Salameh has a shop selling electrical tools in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict. Salameh took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of electrical tools to sell at his shop. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to cover school fees for his children

loans.use: to buy a new collection of  electrical tools to sell at his shop.

loans.name: Ginafe

texts.en:
Ginafe is from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is a 34-year-old woman, married and has six children. The oldest child is 13 years old while the youngest child is one year old. To provide for the needs of the family, Ginafe and her husband do fishing business. They have been doing this for 13 years. Thus, she is asking a loan to buy a new fishing boat and machine.

In the future, Ginafe wants to improve their livelihood. She wishes to send all her children to school and finished a degree.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and machine.

loans.name: The More The Merrier - N07Tnamqthạch Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thơm is 38 years old and married. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for eight years. Thơm lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is unstable because when poultry get a disease, they could die, which leaves her nothing to sell and creates problems with her finances.

Therefore, Thơm decided to invest in another business: selling fish. The main hardship that Thơm faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase a net for catching fish and baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Thơm joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thơm has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of "The more the merrier - N07TNamQThạch," which consists of eight members. In the future, Thơm hopes to maintain a successful business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a net for catching fish and baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his banana plantation through weeding and manure application

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
Yan is a 49-year-old mother of six children and earns a living through growing cassava while her husband works as a paid worker to earn additional income for supporting the family. She has been in this business for almost 5 years.

Yan is the third cycle with VisionFund. She wisely and successfully used her past loans from VisionFund to better support her family’s livings and business. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for labor fees in plowing the field for her cassava growing. She hopes to increase her family’s income from the current business to make a living better.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees in plowing the field for her cassava growing

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy, 43, is a married mother living with her child in a rural village of the Keo Sima district of Mondolkiri province, Cambodia. She earns a living through planting cassava and working for others for a fee. She has been in this business for seven years. The main challenge for her business is the low price of cassava.

Thy has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already, and she completely repaid the past loan, which helped her relieve her family’s financial burden and support her business.

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides for her cassava. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her cassava.

loans.name: Ephraim

texts.en: Mr. Ephraim, an agriculturalist, is a repeat customer from Kakanju Bushenyi district whose previous loan helped to increase his sales and profit and he was even able to expand his banana plantation with the income from sales of goats. He started his goat trade business in 2003 to be able to sustain his family. Honest as he is, he has applied for a loan of one million (1,000,000) UGX to buy more goats that he will sell to increase his income. He hopes to educate his children for a bright future.  He is faced with a challenge of a limited working capital.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Inacia

texts.en:
Inacia is married, and she is a businesswoman. Every day she sees all the women who are always dependent on their husbands. So, one day she thought to help her husband so that he could feel less responsibility in the household, and she began her business.

She has been involved in business activities since 2010, starting with her own working capital of $200, and she does her best with it. She started with a small store, so she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital. She will buy additional items to keep in her store including hand/body products, candles, aqua, eggs, coffee, noodles, shampoo, salt, and other things to sell.

loans.use: to buy hand/body products, candles, aqua, eggs, coffee, noodles, shampoo, salt, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Oyminoz

texts.ru:
Ойминоз занимается животноводством у себя во дворе дома. Она занимается этими делами уже более 3 лет. 
Ойминоз проживает в районе Шахритус с четверыми детьми, которым по 18,15 12  и 7 лет. Ее младшие дети школьники. В животноводстве Ойминоз также помогают ее старшие дети. Ойминоз в основном разводит молодых телят и в дальнейшем после откорма перепродает их на скотном рынке. В настоящий момент Ойминоз просит кредит, чтобы купить несколько молодых телят и увеличить поголовье скота и продвигать бизнес. В будущем Ойминоз планирует расширить коровник и животноводческую деятельность.
texts.en: Oyminoz raises animals on the land around her home. She has already been in this business for over three years. Oyminoz lives in the Shahrituz district with her four children who are 18, 15, 12, and 7 years old. The younger children are in school. The older children help Oyminoz with the animals. She primarily raises calves and after fattening them sells them at the livestock market. Now Oyminoz is asking for a loan to buy several young calves to expand her herd and advance her business. In the future she plans to expand her barn and her work with livestock.

loans.use: To buy and resell livestock

loans.name: Monalisa

texts.en:
Monalisa is a 33-year-old mother with six children. She runs a business of catching fish in the sea and selling them in her community to earn a living.

Monalisa joined SPBD in 2015. She has requested a loan to buy a fishing net, a torch, an ice bag, a container, and a new canoe, to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, a torch, an ice bag, a container, and a new canoe,

loans.name: Vaitoelau

texts.en:
Vaitoelau is a 48-year-old mother of 7 children. She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living.

Vaitoelau has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and fry pan to assist her in running her business.

Vaitoelau will use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and fry pan.

loans.name: Giyosiddin

texts.ru: 33 летный мужчина Гиёсиддин. Он из района Шахритус. Гиёсиддин честный и ответственный дехканин. Он в районе занимается животноводством 5 лет.  Гиёсиддин имеет коровник для выращивания скота. Он покупает скота и откармливает их 3-4 месяцев, потом перепродает. Гиёсиддин больше времени проводит с домашними животными. Животноводческая деятельность вляется основным, потому что доход от этого бизнеса обеспечить его семью. Гиёсиддин женат и отец одного ребенка. Его жена домохозяйка, следит за домашними делами. Гиёсиддин  обратилась за кредитом для расширения бизнеса. Она надеется с расширением бизнеса увеличиться доход, и он может улучшить условия жизни семьи. За счет кредита Гиёсиддин купит скота. Он надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: This 33 year old man is Giyosiddin. Giyosiddin is an honest and responsible man from the Shahrituz district. He has been practicing animal husbandry in the district for five years. He has a barn for the animals which he buys and feeds for 3-4 months before reselling. Most of his time is spent with the animals. This work is of primary importance to him because he uses it to support his family. Giyosiddin is married and has a child. His wife stays at home and takes care of household duties. Giyosiddin is asking for a loan to expand his business, which he hopes will allow him to improve his family's standard of living. The loan will be used to purchase livestock. He hopes for your support.

loans.use: To buy livestock and expand his business

loans.name: Soliga

texts.en:
Soliga is a 64-year-old mother with three children. She owns and operates a small business of bingo in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than five years.

Soliga requested a loan to buy a bingo machine, a box of paper bingo cards, a box of ink bottles, a TV screen and a loudspeaker, to assist her in running the business. She will use her profit to expand her business.

She became a member of SPBD in 2006.

loans.use: to buy a bingo machine, a box of paper bingo cards, a box of ink bottles, a TV screen, and a loudspeaker.

loans.name: Mishell

texts.en:
Mishell is 35 years old, married, and has two children. She is managing a variety store for income. Her family lives at Alcala.

Mishell aims for business progression, and she needs additional capital to invest in her business. She will buy more merchandise to sell. She is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy grocery items, feed, clothes, and other merchandise to sell.

She hopes to continuously offer good products and services to all customers. She will save the additional revenue for education purposes. She hopes to become a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, feed, clothes, and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Valeriia

texts.en: Valeriia is a freshman at American University in Central Asia. Her dream is to get a bachelor degree at this university, as it provides a qualitative education to take the necessary steps for a successful life. She has done her best to enter this university: learned English, was one of the best students at school, not just academically, but also in extra-curricular activities and has passed the university entrance exams successfully. Now her dream may come true just thanks to a Kiva loan. Valeriia is good at Math and Physics. She has taken part in many Math Olympiads, including Sochi 2014 Winter Olympics. Her hobbies at school were to debate in English and to be an editor of the school newspaper. She hopes that being an active student at the university and in other places will broaden her horizons and better her leadership and communicative skills.Valeriia's mother is a hairdresser at a salon; she is a single parent. She has done all she could to give her daughter love, a beliefs and a good education. Valeria says that she is proud to be a daughter of such strong and wise person, and hopes to make her mom happy and be financially independent in the future. Valeriia thanks Kiva lenders in advance and wishes peace and love to everybody.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education tuition fee

loans.name: Abas

texts.en:
Abas was born in 1957 and is a well known taxi driver in Ishaka town. He is married with four children, all school going. He operates a taxi to earn income to meet his financial obligations as a family man.

Abas has obtained UGX 1,000,000 (one million only). The purpose of this loan fund is to service his car so that he can run his transport services effectively. His dream is to buy a new car in the near future.

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 40 years old. She is married with 4 children, 2 of whom are enrolled in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cristina has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 29,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more fruit to sell to customers.

Cristina has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is a 33-year-old mother with 2 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling pancake, pork cake, and buns in her community to earn a living. Jacinta requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, fry pan, and container to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, fry pan, and container.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia thanks Kiva from the bottom of her heart for the continuous support of her livelihood. The loans granted to her in the past certainly have helped sustain and grow her farm. From what she earns, she makes a living; from what you give, however, makes a life for these small farm owners like Sofia.

To ensure continuous healthy harvest of her pineapple farm, Sofia is again seeking a loan in the amount of 17,000 PHP to pay for fertilizer, labor, and other materials for her farm. She treasures her farm of 30 years, which has helped feed her 6 children, most of whom are already married and working. She is now sending her youngest to college.

Sofia's precious dream is to see her child finish college. She prays for abundance in all areas of their lives. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farming supplies and other products needed for her business.

loans.name: Leka

texts.en:
Leka is 35 years old and has one child. She sells bananas and taro in her community. 

Leka requested a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy banana tube (seedling), taro roots (seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals. She joined SPBD in 2015 and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase banana tube (seedling), taro roots (seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Kimsrin's Group

texts.en:
Kimsrin, 36, lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Three of her children are in school while another one is too young for school. She has struggled to feed and care her children by farming rice. She has been in the business for 17 years while her husband works as a paid worker.

Kimsrin has been with VisionFund for one cycle already and she completely paid back the loan. She wisely and successfully used the loan to relieve family’s financial burden and afford to buy some basic household necessities for the family. As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for another loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and earn more to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sharopathon

texts.ru: Это женщина Шаропатхон. Ей 48 лет. Она мать двоих детей. Детям 12 и 10 лет. Шаропатхон со своей семьей проживает в городе Худжанд. Шаропатхон старается зарабатывать на жизнь. Она занимается поваром на ресторане. Шаропатхон вкусно готовить. Ей клиентам нравится ее блюдо. Она сейчас собирается отремонтировать дом. Шаропатхон обращается за кредитом, и за счет кредита хочет отремонтировать свой дом и улучшить жилищные условия. За счет кредита она купить стройматериалы. Ее надежды и мечты на будущее, жить в хороших условиях и обеспечить новые экономические возможности для своей семьи. Из-за нехватки денежных средств Шаропатхон просит кредит.
texts.en: This woman is Sharopathon. She is 48 years old and has two children, a ten year old and a twelve year old. Sharopathon and her family live in the city of Khujand. She does her best to earn a living working as a cook in a restaurant. She prepares excellent food which is well liked by customers. Currently she is planning to remodel her home. Sharopathon is requesting a loan to use for remodeling the home and improving her living conditions. She will use the loan to buy building materials. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to live in good conditions and foster new economic opportunities for her family. Because she doesn't have the necessary cash. Sharopathon is asking for a loan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for home repairs.

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es:
Ana tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su esposo en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ana se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con varios años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Ana espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old.  She lives with her husband in a rural area of the district of Cayaltí, which is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region, on Peru's north coast.  The inhabitants of this district work primarily in agriculture, livestock, and commerce.  

Ana raises and sells small animals, such as chickens, hens, ducks, turkeys, and others.  Her business is located in her own home.  She has several years of experience in this business and very good personal and professional references in the area.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a larger quantity of animals, such as hens, ducks, turkeys, chickens, and others, as well as to buy feed for them.  With this Ana hopes to offer her customers a better product, which will allow her to generate more income and thereby improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay small photovoltaic solar systems for their houses.

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида из города Худжанд.  Ей 38 лет и она мать троих детей. У нее 1 дочка и 2 сыновей. Ее Муж занимается таксистом в городе. Фарида шустрая и честная женщина. Она занимается торговлей деятельности. Фарида на рынке продает мед. Она продвигает свою работу 8 лет. Ей нравится своя работа, и заниматься торговлей. Фарида давно мечтала о расширения бизнеса. Она хочет приобрести больше мед и расширить торговля. С такими планами она обратилась за кредитом. Вы можете поддержать ее сейчас! Фарида заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Farida is from the city of Khujand. She is 38 years old and has three children: a daughter and two sons. Her husband is a taxi driver in the city. Farida is a bright and honest woman. She works as a salesperson, selling honey at the market. She has been doing this work for eight years and she loves it. Farida has long hoped to expand her business. She wants to buy more honey and increase her sales. This is the plan she is requesting a loan for. You can help her now! Farida thanks you in advance.

loans.use: To expand her business and obtain more honey for sale.

loans.name: Srun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Churng Prey district, Srun is a 32-year-old mother of two children who are in school. She is a rice farmer in the local area and supplements her family’s income by working as a paid worker. Having been in the business for 12 years, she can make a daily income of US$15 from her current business and is able to save about US$5 per day, after expenses, for future needs.

This is the first loan for Srun with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. She is now forming a group of four people to seek a loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland to gain more crop yields. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice in a timely manner to increase her family’s income for their future needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland to gain more crop yields

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a 36 year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married, with four children. The oldest child is 11 years old while the youngest child is three years old. Analyn and her husband work together to provide for the needs of their children.

They are in the fishing business to earn a living, and have been doing this for almost 11 years. Aside from fishing, Analyn sells dried fish to get extra income.

She is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat to help them increase their livelihood.

In the future, she wants to support their catch and sell more fish in order to increase their earnings.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat.

loans.name: Kika

texts.en:
Kika is a 24-year-old mother of three children. She has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, and cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Kika became a member of SPBD in 2015. She has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, hand gloves, and safety boots, to help her run the business. She hopes to expand her business by using her profit.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, hand gloves, and safety boots,

loans.name: Patricia Margarita

texts.es: Patricia es una mujer emprendedora y con deseos de superación de 36 años de edad habita en vivienda familiar con su esposo, sus 2 hijos y la madre. Patricia se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos y es de donde obtiene los ingresos para mantener su vivienda junto a su esposo. Ella desea hacerle mejoras a la casa y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para la inversión de: madera, cemento, ladrillo y lámina para lograr hacer las mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en: Patricia is an entrepreneurial woman who wants to better herself.  She is 36 and lives in a family home with her husband, her two children, and her mother.  Patricia sells clothing and shoes and this is how she generates the income to support her household, along with her husband.  She wants to make improvements to her home, which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: wood, cement, brick, and sheet metal to make these improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy: wood, cement, brick, and sheet metal to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a good housewife and a mother to three children ages one, five and twelve. She and her family live in the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (general store) business for four years now.

She is requesting a loan to buy chips, canned food, seasoning, toiletries, feed and food for her family. She works hard taking care of her children and managing her business.

Fe hopes to achieve an increase in her daily sales. She hopes to elevate her family's standard of living in the future as well.

loans.use: to buy chips, canned food, seasoning, toiletries, feed and food for her family

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme célibataire âgée de 50 ans qui habite à Tokoin. Mère de quatre enfants, Afi est une marchande des céréales qu’elle achète une fois par mois au marché et le revend au bord de la route et à domicile pour gagner des revenus. Pour commander des bols du haricots et des sacs de maïs,  Afi demande ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et mieux couvrir les frais scolaire de ses enfants dès la rentrée à venir.
texts.en:
Afi is a single, 50-year-old woman who lives in Tokoin. She has four children. Afi sells grains that she buys once a month at the market and resells by the side of the road and from her home to make an income.

To order bowls of beans and bags of corn, Afi is asking for this loan to cover her provision of supplies. She would like to make a good profit margin in order to meet her family's needs and better cover her children's school fees for the start of the upcoming school year.

loans.use: to buy 20 bowls of beans and 5 bags of corn.

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en:
Rajaa, living with her three kids in the Lebanese mountains of Chouf, is divorced and working hard to ensure a good life for her children. One of her sons is an employee and gets a monthly income; his sister does too, and both of them help their mom to cover all the house expenses.

Three years ago, Rajaa started working in clothes retailing. She sells clothes from home or visits her clients upon request. She is now 41 years old and hopes to see her business expand. Her living conditions have been greatly improving since she established it. Rajaa is very friendly with her clients and has a very good reputation in the area.

She is asking for a loan of 1,543,658 LBP (Lebanese pounds) for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa in order to improve her business by buying a new collection of clothes. Renewing her clothing line will attract more clients; thus she will be able to improve her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: bricks, cement, sand, and gravel to continue building her wall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to spend on: doors, windows, and labor so she can offer her children a better quality of life.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a gate and pay for the manual labour, and in this way give a better quality of life to her children.

loans.name: Sarguon's Group

texts.en:
Sarguon lives in a rural village of the Churng Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 61 years old and married with nine children, three of whom are in school.

To support her family, she and her husband have been working as rice farmers on a one-hectare area of farmland. Sometimes, her husband helps to earn additional income by working for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about US$15 per day to make a living and can afford to save US$5 each day after expenses. Low crop yield has been a challenge for her business.

This is Sarguon’s second loan with VisionFund Cambodia. She has wisely used the first loan to better support her current business. Now she is forming a new group to request a new loan. Sarguon will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland to increase crop yields.

With this loan, she hopes to make more healthy rice to increase her family’s income to make a better living and afford to buy some household necessities for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland to increase crop yields

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Kahindi

texts.en:
Kahindi is a 39-year-old poultry farmer in Kilifi, Kenya. He is a married father of two who has been in this business for the last two years and is doing well.

This marks his second time borrowing to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase chicks and feeds and plans to use the anticipated profit to expand his poultry business. He hopes to raise the poultry on a large scale in future.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and feeds

loans.name: Ulaula

texts.en: Ulaula is a 33 year old mother with three children. She runs a small business selling taros and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years. Ulaula requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves, a backpack sprayer, a chainsaw, and banana tubes (seedlings) to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2004.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves, a backpack sprayer, a chainsaw, and banana tubes (seedlings).

loans.name: Pillao Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PILLAO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Yanet  sigue con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas ,la socia cría a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a todo sus clientes que solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
Los socios en general agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se comprometen  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
Al momento de tomar la foto una de las socias salió con la cara tapada ya que la socia es tímida, pero se compromete para la próxima salir en la foto.
texts.en:
The members make up the communal bank PILLAO. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.
The member Yanet continues with her business of raising young animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens. The member raises the animals and then sells them to all her customers who request them. The member is doing well with her business, which brings her personal satisfaction. The member wants to continue in this work and in this way continue to support her family.
The member is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs.
The members in the attached photos (in the corner) had requested permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work commitments.
The members in general are grateful to those who form a part of this dream through this means and promise to complete the payments within the established period.
The face of one of the members cannot be seen in the photo because it was covered as she is shy but she promises that she will be in the next photo.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.es:
Jeremias tiene 41 años de edad, vive solo en casa propia de material rústico en el Caserío Cabra chica, distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Jeremias se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de piña, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de piña así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto jeremias espera ofrecer una piña de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jeremias is 41 years old. He lives alone in a rustic house that he owns in the rural community of Cabra Chica in the district of Pucará, which is located in Jaén province in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern mountains. Life in this district is peaceful. The residents earn their livings primarily in farming, commerce, and livestock production.

Jeremias works in agriculture, specifically pineapple farming. He has 10 years of experience in the field and very good personal and work-related references in the area. The loan that he will be granted will be used to buy soil amendments and fertilizers to properly maintain his pineapple crop, as well as to contract manual labor for the harvest season. With this, Jeremias expects to offer a better-quality pineapple to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his level of income, with the result of improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and fertilizers to properly maintain his pineapple crop

loans.name: Sokea's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Sokea is 40 years old and married with four children (who are still in school). For more than twenty years, she and her husband have been farming rice and fishing as primary sources of the family’s income. They can earn about US $13 per day and manage to save about US $2 each day for future needs. Drought has been the main challenge for her farming business.

Sokea has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already and she wisely and successfully used the first loan to make her living conditions better. Now, she is leading her group to apply for a new loan. Sokea will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland, increase her rice farming production, and help her make more rice to improve her family’s lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Miraneta

texts.en:
Miraneta is 34 years old with four children. She operates a banana-selling business in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Miraneta requested a loan to buy banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals, and a chainsaw to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2014, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals, and a chainsaw.

loans.name: Phach's Group

texts.en:
Aged 37 years, Phach is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Memot District of the Tbaung Khmum Province. She is a mother of two daughters, who are still in school. She earns a living through farming cassava and selling clothes at the market nearby her house. Having been in these businesses for seven years, she can manage to earn around $20 USD per day to support her family’s needs.

This is the second loan for Phach with VisionFund. She has used the first loan wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood and keep her children in school. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice farming production, which will improve her family’s living condition and fulfill her dream of renovating her old house.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland.
