loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия 53 летняя женщина. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. Сыновья находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Они зарабатывают, и помогает родителям обеспечить семью. Ее муж занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Сама Зулфия трудолюбивая и сильная женщина. Она занимается торговлей деятельности. Зулфия ходит по улицам и по домам, чтобы продать  миндаль. Она 4 года продвигает свой бизнес.  Она с утро до вечера занимается бизнесом. Зулфия планирует, перевозит больше миндаль на продажу, и увеличить товарооборот. Но для завершения данных операции у нее нет денежных средств. И по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Зулфия надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Zulfiya is a 53-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of two children. Her sons are away earning in the Russian Federation. They earn and help their parents to provide for the family. Her husband works in agriculture. Zulfiya herself is a hard-working and strong woman. She is a trader. Zulfiya goes round the streets and houses in order to sell almonds. She has been running her business for four years. She works from morning till night. Zulfiya plans to buy in more almonds for sale and to increase her stock of goods, but she does not have enough funds to carry out these tasks. For this reason she has applied for a loan. Zulfiya hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy in more almonds and to increase her stock of goods.

loans.name: Abra Jeannette

texts.fr: Abra est une femme divorcée qui habite à Adidogomé avec deux enfants à charge. Agée de 49 ans, Abra vend des bijoux pour subvenir à ses besoins. Pour s’approvisionner, Abra se rend quatre fois par mois au marché. Abra sollicite ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de chaines et bracelets en vue de gagner des bénéfices afin de pouvoir supporter ses charges quotidiennes et de bien prendre soin de ses enfants.
texts.en: Abra is a divorced woman who lives in Adidogomé with two children in her care. Abra is 49 years old and sells jewelry to meet her needs. To get her supplies, Abra goes to the market four times per month. She is seeking this loan in order to purchase dozens of necklaces and bracelets with the goal of earning a profit to be able to meet her day-to-day expenses and take good care of her children.

loans.use: purchase three dozen necklaces and two dozen bracelets.

loans.name: Up - N02Tnamqthạchqxương Group

texts.en:
Nhung is 50 years old and she is married. She has had a manufacturing business making fishing nets for more than ten years. Nhung lives in Quang Xuong District, a rural town in the Thanh Hoa Province.

Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Nhung faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase necessary things for making fishing nets.

In 2013, Nhung joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Nhung has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of "UP - N02TNamqthạchqxương", which consists of five members. In the future, Nhung hopes to maintain a successful business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase necessary things for making fishing nets.

loans.name: Leusitai

texts.en: Leusitai is 46 years old with five children. She operates a business selling taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Leusitai requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals, backpack sprayer and chainsaw to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2013, and she will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals, backpack sprayer and chainsaw.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata, who is in her late 40's, is divorced with three children who are in school. She has been running two projects: selling cosmetics and selling fabrics for seven years now. She works from 7am to 6pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Consolata's ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her cosmetics stock and start selling fabrics. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profits to pay school fees, reinvest in business, build her own house and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her cosmetics and buy the fast moving fabrics like fabrics called London wax. She dreams of expanding her business to an international level.

Consolata will make sure she pays back the loan within the loan schedule

loans.use: to increase her cosmetics stock and buy the fast moving fabrics like London wax.

loans.name: Toka Chini Group

texts.fr: Kiraba, président du groupe TOKA CHINI, cultive le paddy depuis 2005 grâce à la formation qu'il a reçu de ses parents. La saison précédente, il a pu réaliser une production de deux cents dollars pour soixante dollars de coûts d'exploitation. Les maladies de plantes, les oiseaux et l'insuffisance d'eaux d'irrigation sont les obstacles fréquents de l'activité; cela ne l'empêche pas de rêver à des bonnes récoltes qui lui permettront d'élargir son champ et améliorer l'habitat de sa famille. Sur photo, Kiraba tient un carnet dans sa main.
texts.en: Kiraba, the president of Toka Chini Group, has been growing rice since 2005 thanks to the training he received from his parents. Last season, he was able to achieve a crop [worth] $200 for $60 in operating costs. Plant diseases, birds, and insufficient water for irrigation are common obstacles in this business, but that doesn't stop Kiraba from hoping for good harvests that will allow him to expand his field and improve his family's housing conditions. In the photo, Kiraba is [the one] holding a notebook in his hand.

loans.use: to pay the costs of labor for upkeep, and to purchase fertilizer and phytosanitary products.

loans.name: Wend Manekondo Group

texts.fr: Bekianbone, est une femme âgée de 40 ans, mariée. elle exerce son activité depuis 1 ans. ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est la meilleur qualité de son tissu,elle est la seule dans son lieu de commerce à vendre du tissu et à moindre goût. elle veut le prêt pour acheter du tissu à 50 000 F cfa afin de revendre. l'utilité du prêt c'est de s'approvisionner afin de renforcer son activité. elle a déjà reçu le prêt plusieurs fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Bekianbone is a 40-year-old, married woman. She has been working in her business for one year. What makes her business work is the superior quality of her fabric. She is the only one in her commercial area to sell fabric and at a low cost.

She is asking for this loan to purchase 50,000 francs worth of fabric in order to resell it. This loan will be used to purchase supplies to strengthen her business. She has already received many loans and repaid them on time.

loans.use: to buy 50,000 francs worth of fabric to resell.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch, 39, lives in a rural village in Kampong Cham province’s Chueng Prey district, Cambodia. She is married and has four children. For the last 21 years, Touch has been a rice farmer to support her family. The low price of rice has been the main challenge for her business.

Touch has just been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for this cycle. She is now applying for a new loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her rice field in order to increase her rice products. She hopes to earn more income to better support her business and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her rice field in order to increase her rice products

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Julita

texts.en: Julita, 53 years old, is from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with seven children. She has been buying and selling crops for 18 years now to earn a living. She buys and sells bananas in her town. Julita is asking for a loan to buy more supplies of bananas, yams and taro. Her loan will serve as additional capital so she can further increase her stocks and profit. In the future, she hopes to make her business more profitable in order to live a good and prosperous life.

loans.use: to buy bananas, yams and taro.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en: Elna is a sari-sari store owner from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has three adult sons. Elna has been doing the sari-sari store business for almost 30 years.  She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks such as soft drinks, chips, biscuits, candies, chocolate bars, spices, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, toiletries, coffee, sugar, powdered chocolate drink and juice. In the future, she wishes to improve her business to have sustainable earnings.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, chips, biscuits, candies, chocolate bars, spices, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, toiletries, coffee, sugar, powdered chocolate drink and juice.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 38 years old and married with three children who all attend school.

Ofelia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Ofelia requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ofelia has been farming rice for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough money to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Vise

texts.en: Vise is 23 years old with two children. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Vise requested a loan to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel and chemicals to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2015, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel and chemicals.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Victoria De David Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACION COMUNAL LA VICTORIA DE DAVID ESTA CONFORMADA POR OCHO INTEGRANTES SEISMUJERS Y DOS HOMBRES, MADRES Y PADRES DE FAMILIA RESPONSABLES CON  DIES HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, TODOS MENORES DE EDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGION, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE LA COMPANIA DE SUS HIJOS, Y REALIZA ACTIVIDADES EN FAMILIA, EN LOS CREDITOS ANTERIORES ESTAS PERSONAS HAN DEMOSTRADO RESPONSABILIDAD, CON SUS PAGOS EN TIEMPO Y FORMA, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN PARA SALIR ADELANTE Y HACER CRECER DUS DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONOMICAS, CUMPLIR SUS SUEÑOS Y METAS COMO BRINDARLES ESTUDIOS A SUS HIJOS, Y TERMINAR  DE CONSTRUIR SUS VIVIENDAS.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES  MICAELA, Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMCIA LA UNA PULPERIA ES UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA QUE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES COMO: ARROZ, FRIJOLES, AZUCAR, LECHE, PAN, HUEVOS, DETERGENTES, ACEITES, JUGOS, GALLESTAS, GASEOSAS, ETC. ELLA DEDICA UNAS DOCE HORAS A SU NEGOCIO PARA SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES. LA VICTORIA DE DAVID AGRADECE LA AYUDA DE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA POR BRINDARLES LA OPORTUNIDAD DE TENER UN TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Victoria de David is made up of eight members; six women and two men who are mothers and fathers with responsibility for ten young children among them. They are from Sauce which is located in the northern part of the region. They are hard-working, responsible people with a strong desire for personal improvement. In their free time they enjoy being with their children and doing activities as a family.

In previous loans these people have demonstrated how responsible they are by making their payments in a timely manner. Presently they are struggling to get ahead, to grow their various businesses, and to achieve their dreams and goals such as provide an education to their children and finish building their houses.

The coordinator is Micaela who runs a small grocery store where she sells such products as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergents, oils, juices, cookies, soda, etc. She spends about 12 hours there to satisfy the demand of her customers.

La Victoria de David is grateful to Kiva investors for their help and for providing the opportunity to do dignified work.

loans.use: to buy food items such as rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, juice, cookies, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon, 66 years old, is from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married with five adult children. She works hard to sustain their everyday living. She is doing fishing business to earn. She uses a fish trap known as “bubo” in the Iloilo region to catch fish. She has been doing this for more than 25 years. In the future, she dreams of having a sustainable life. She wants to improve her business to have something when the time comes that she is not able to work. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy additional “bubo” (fish traps) to catch more fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy bubo

loans.name: Vie Nouvelle Group

texts.fr: Riziculteur depuis 2009, Jacques s'y est engagé lors de la préparation de son mariage aidé par ses parents et familiers. A la dernière récolte, il a gagné deux cents dollars contre soixante-dix dollars des coûts d'exploitation. L'insuffisance d'eau dans les champs et les ravages des hippopotames sont ses difficultés majeures. L'assistance qu'il aura à recevoir à travers ce crédit lui comblera de joie car il facilitera la prise en charge de certaines tâches liées à l'activité. Avec espoir de l'évolution de son travail, il pourra élargir son champ, varier les semences et obtenir des productions quantitatives comme qualitatives, conséquentes sur l'augmentation de ses revenus pour un avenir assuré et la scolarisation de ses enfants. Présidant le groupe VIE NOUVELLE, sur photo, il tient un carnet.
texts.en:
Jacques has been a rice farmer since 2009, work he committed to while preparing for his wedding, assisted by his family and friends. During the last harvest, Jacques earned $200 against $60 [spent] in operating costs. Insufficient water in the fields and the havoc wreaked by hippos are the major obstacles Jacques faces.

The assistance Jacques will receive through this loan will fill him with joy, because it will make it easier to manage some of the tasks associated with his business. With hope for the advancement of his work, Jacques will be able to expand his field, diversify his seeds and obtain crops [that are equally productive] in quantity as in quality. Consequently, his income will increase, [providing] for an assured future and the education of his children. Jacques is the leader of Vie Nouvelle [New Life] Group; in the photo, he is [the one] holding a notebook.

loans.use: to pay the cost of labor during hoeing and the harvest, and to purchase fertilizer and phytosanitary products.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz, 36 years old, is a married woman and a mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is her husband. Both have been doing agricultural work for many years to bear their household expenditures. They raise different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds and packs of insecticides and pesticides, currently Shehnaz has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds and packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Alvidio

texts.es:
Alvidio tiene 44 años de edad, conviviente, tiene carga familiar, vive en una zona rural del distrito de Bolicar que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de San miguel, región Cajamarca, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Alvidio se dedica a dar servicios de transporte publico, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la reparacion y mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que se encuentra en mal estado. Con esto Alvidio espera ofrecer un mejor servicios a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Alvidio is 44 years old. He is in a relationship and has a family that depends on him. He lives in a rural area in the district of Bolicar, which is located in the San Miguel province in the Cajamarca region on the northern coast of Peru. The people who live in this district primarily work in agriculture, ranching, and trade.

Alvidio works in public transportation. His business is located in his own home. He has five years of experience in this business and has very good personal and professional references in the area. The loan he is requesting will be used to repair and maintain his vehicle, which at the moment is in bad condition. With this loan, Alvidio hopes to be able to provide better service to his customers, which will allow him to earn higher income, thus improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: repair and maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Musarrat

texts.en: Musarrat is 51 years old and married. To provide for her family, she runs a small business selling children's garments. She purchases clothes from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. For the improvement of her business, Musarrat  has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy inventory of new garments in various colors and designs to meet customers’ demand consistently. This will enable her to increase her net income so that she can improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy new garments in various colors and designs to meet customers’ demand
